title: Do You Love Me?
dialogue_line: Okay, okay! I'll make a reservation right now.

title: Dad Has a Girlfriend
dialogue_line: My parents are divorced.

title: Dad Has a Girlfriend
dialogue_line: So are mine.

title: Dad Has a Girlfriend
dialogue_line: Why did your parents get divorced?

title: Dad Has a Girlfriend
dialogue_line: My father found a new girlfriend.

title: Dad Has a Girlfriend
dialogue_line: That's too bad.

title: Dad Has a Girlfriend
dialogue_line: My mother was hurt and angry.

title: Dad Has a Girlfriend
dialogue_line: She had good reason. What did she do?

title: Dad Has a Girlfriend
dialogue_line: She told him to drop his girlfriend.

title: Dad Has a Girlfriend
dialogue_line: What did your father do?

title: Dad Has a Girlfriend
dialogue_line: He moved out of our house.

title: Dad Has a Girlfriend
dialogue_line: I guess he really liked his new girlfriend.

title: Dad Has a Girlfriend
dialogue_line: Yes, but she left him a year later.

title: What's That Smell?
dialogue_line: My grandma's apartment smells funny.

title: What's That Smell?
dialogue_line: So does mine.

title: What's That Smell?
dialogue_line: I think it's an old people's smell.

title: What's That Smell?
dialogue_line: Really?

title: What's That Smell?
dialogue_line: Yes. I think when you get old, you begin to smell.

title: What's That Smell?
dialogue_line: Like fruit that is too ripe?

title: What's That Smell?
dialogue_line: Yes, just like fruit that is too ripe.

title: What's That Smell?
dialogue_line: But the smell is different.

title: What's That Smell?
dialogue_line: Yes, old people don't smell like fruit.

title: What's That Smell?
dialogue_line: No, they smell like a thrift shop.

title: What's That Smell?
dialogue_line: Yes, a thrift shop has that same smell.

title: What's That Smell?
dialogue_line: Yes, an old smell.

title: They Deliver
dialogue_line: The price of stamps goes up and up.

title: They Deliver
dialogue_line: I think stamps used to cost a penny.

title: They Deliver
dialogue_line: That was a long time ago.

title: They Deliver
dialogue_line: It was before I was born.

title: They Deliver
dialogue_line: Now a stamp is 42 cents.

title: They Deliver
dialogue_line: But in May it will be 44 cents.

title: They Deliver
dialogue_line: Have you ever lost a letter in the mail?

title: They Deliver
dialogue_line: No, I haven't.

title: They Deliver
dialogue_line: Neither have I.

title: They Deliver
dialogue_line: So, they do a good job for the money.

title: They Deliver
dialogue_line: Yes, they do.

title: They Deliver
dialogue_line: Maybe we shouldn't complain.

title: A Lost Button
dialogue_line: A button came off my shirt.

title: A Lost Button
dialogue_line: What are you going to do?

title: A Lost Button
dialogue_line: First, I have to find the button.

title: A Lost Button
dialogue_line: Where did you lose it?

title: A Lost Button
dialogue_line: I have no idea.

title: A Lost Button
dialogue_line: A button is hard to find. Did you look in your pant cuffs?

title: A Lost Button
dialogue_line: That's a good idea.

title: A Lost Button
dialogue_line: I found a button in my pant cuffs one time.

title: A Lost Button
dialogue_line: Let me look. No, it's not there.

title: A Lost Button
dialogue_line: Many shirts come with an extra button.

title: A Lost Button
dialogue_line: You're right. This one does have an extra button.

title: A Lost Button
dialogue_line: Now all you have to do is sew it on.

title: Did You Say Something?
dialogue_line: I have to go to the bathroom.

title: Did You Say Something?
dialogue_line: You drink too much coffee.

title: Did You Say Something?
dialogue_line: But I love coffee.

title: Did You Say Something?
dialogue_line: Well, it's your life.

title: Did You Say Something?
dialogue_line: You eat too much chocolate.

title: Did You Say Something?
dialogue_line: I don't think so.

title: Did You Say Something?
dialogue_line: Have you looked in the mirror?

title: Did You Say Something?
dialogue_line: Do you think I'm getting fat?

title: Did You Say Something?
dialogue_line: I didn't say that.

title: Did You Say Something?
dialogue_line: What did you say?

title: Did You Say Something?
dialogue_line: I said I have to go to the bathroom.

title: Did You Say Something?
dialogue_line: That's what I thought you said.

title: Washed and Folded
dialogue_line: Did you do the laundry?

title: Washed and Folded
dialogue_line: Yes, I did.

title: Washed and Folded
dialogue_line: What did you wash?

title: Washed and Folded
dialogue_line: I washed the sheets and towels.

title: Washed and Folded
dialogue_line: What about the pillowcases?

title: Washed and Folded
dialogue_line: Yes, I took them off the pillows and washed them.

title: Washed and Folded
dialogue_line: Did you dry everything in the dryer?

title: Washed and Folded
dialogue_line: Yes, I dried everything in the dryer.

title: Washed and Folded
dialogue_line: Then what did you do?

title: Washed and Folded
dialogue_line: I folded all the towels.

title: Washed and Folded
dialogue_line: Did you put the sheets on the beds?

title: Washed and Folded
dialogue_line: Yes, and I put the pillowcases on the pillows.

title: Talk Radio
dialogue_line: Do you listen to the radio?

title: Talk Radio
dialogue_line: I listen day and night.

title: Talk Radio
dialogue_line: What do you listen to?

title: Talk Radio
dialogue_line: Mostly talk radio.

title: Talk Radio
dialogue_line: What's that?

title: Talk Radio
dialogue_line: People talk about current events.

title: Talk Radio
dialogue_line: What do they say?

title: Talk Radio
dialogue_line: They say they want change.

title: Talk Radio
dialogue_line: What kind of change?

title: Talk Radio
dialogue_line: They want tax cuts.

title: Talk Radio
dialogue_line: Why do they want tax cuts?

title: Talk Radio
dialogue_line: Because tax cuts will save them money.

title: A Bad Diet
dialogue_line: Mom, I'm hungry.

title: A Bad Diet
dialogue_line: Look in the fridge.

title: A Bad Diet
dialogue_line: I'm looking. There's nothing to eat.

title: A Bad Diet
dialogue_line: Are you sure?

title: A Bad Diet
dialogue_line: It's almost empty.

title: A Bad Diet
dialogue_line: I went to the market yesterday.

title: A Bad Diet
dialogue_line: I don't see anything.

title: A Bad Diet
dialogue_line: I bought lots of oranges and apples.

title: A Bad Diet
dialogue_line: I don't want fruit. I want something tasty.

title: A Bad Diet
dialogue_line: Eat the fruit. It's good for you.

title: A Bad Diet
dialogue_line: Next time you go to the market, let me go with you.

title: A Bad Diet
dialogue_line: No, thank you. All you want to eat are hot dogs and candy bars.

title: A Ham Sandwich
dialogue_line: What is there to eat?

title: A Ham Sandwich
dialogue_line: I don't know. Look in the fridge.

title: A Ham Sandwich
dialogue_line: I think I'll make a sandwich.

title: A Ham Sandwich
dialogue_line: What kind?

title: A Ham Sandwich
dialogue_line: A ham sandwich.

title: A Ham Sandwich
dialogue_line: The bread is in the cabinet.

title: A Ham Sandwich
dialogue_line: Where's the mustard?

title: A Ham Sandwich
dialogue_line: It's in the fridge, I think.

title: A Ham Sandwich
dialogue_line: Oh, yes, here it is. Do you want a sandwich?

title: A Ham Sandwich
dialogue_line: Yes, that sounds nice.

title: A Ham Sandwich
dialogue_line: How about some potato chips?

title: A Ham Sandwich
dialogue_line: Yes. And a pickle, if we have any.

title: Time for Your Bath
dialogue_line: It's time for your bath, young lady.

title: Time for Your Bath
dialogue_line: But, Mom, I'm not dirty.

title: Time for Your Bath
dialogue_line: You need a bath every day.

title: Time for Your Bath
dialogue_line: Why?

title: Time for Your Bath
dialogue_line: Because you don't want to smell bad.

title: Time for Your Bath
dialogue_line: I don't smell bad.

title: Time for Your Bath
dialogue_line: That's what you think.

title: Time for Your Bath
dialogue_line: If I smelled bad, I could smell me.

title: Time for Your Bath
dialogue_line: I can smell you.

title: Time for Your Bath
dialogue_line: I can smell you, too.

title: Time for Your Bath
dialogue_line: That's my perfume.

title: Time for Your Bath
dialogue_line: When can I wear perfume?

title: A Black Screen
dialogue_line: Something's wrong with my computer.

title: A Black Screen
dialogue_line: Exactly what?

title: A Black Screen
dialogue_line: All I get is a black screen.

title: A Black Screen
dialogue_line: What's the matter?

title: A Black Screen
dialogue_line: I think I know, because this happened before.

title: A Black Screen
dialogue_line: What happened before?

title: A Black Screen
dialogue_line: My hard drive crashed.

title: A Black Screen
dialogue_line: Oh, no. That's bad news.

title: A Black Screen
dialogue_line: It sure is, but I'm going to call HP first, just to make sure.

title: A Black Screen
dialogue_line: Will you lose all your files?

title: A Black Screen
dialogue_line: No, I always back up my files.

title: A Black Screen
dialogue_line: You're smart.

title: A New Hard Drive
dialogue_line: I called HP about my computer.

title: A New Hard Drive
dialogue_line: What did they say?

title: A New Hard Drive
dialogue_line: They said I need a new hard drive.

title: A New Hard Drive
dialogue_line: That's too bad. How much is a new one?

title: A New Hard Drive
dialogue_line: It's not too much, only about $85.

title: A New Hard Drive
dialogue_line: Plus installation?

title: A New Hard Drive
dialogue_line: No, my hard drive is easy to remove and replace.

title: A New Hard Drive
dialogue_line: Really?

title: A New Hard Drive
dialogue_line: Yes, it's just a couple of screws.

title: A New Hard Drive
dialogue_line: That's nice.

title: A New Hard Drive
dialogue_line: It's a lot better than paying someone $60.

title: A New Hard Drive
dialogue_line: If my hard drive crashes, I'll just call you.

title: Your Email Address
dialogue_line: What's your email address?

title: Your Email Address
dialogue_line: It's bluedog123.

title: Your Email Address
dialogue_line: Bluedog123. Are you sure that's all?

title: Your Email Address
dialogue_line: Yes.

title: Your Email Address
dialogue_line: No. That's incomplete.

title: Your Email Address
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: Your Email Address
dialogue_line: What's your mailing address?

title: Your Email Address
dialogue_line: 456 Cherry Drive, Pasadena, CA 91170.

title: Your Email Address
dialogue_line: That's correct.

title: Your Email Address
dialogue_line: So what's the problem?

title: Your Email Address
dialogue_line: Bluedog123 is just the street. You have to give me the city, state, and ZIP code.

title: Your Email Address
dialogue_line: Oh, I get it. My email address is bluedog123@yahoo.com.

title: Time for a Nap
dialogue_line: I'm going to take a nap.

title: Time for a Nap
dialogue_line: You should unplug the phone.

title: Time for a Nap
dialogue_line: That's a good idea.

title: Time for a Nap
dialogue_line: Do you want me to wake you in an hour?

title: Time for a Nap
dialogue_line: No, thanks. Just let me sleep until I wake up.

title: Time for a Nap
dialogue_line: I'll start dinner at 6:00.

title: Time for a Nap
dialogue_line: Okay. I think I'll be awake by then.

title: Time for a Nap
dialogue_line: If not, your nose will wake you up.

title: Time for a Nap
dialogue_line: You mean I will smell the food cooking?

title: Time for a Nap
dialogue_line: You might even dream about dinner.

title: Time for a Nap
dialogue_line: I don't think I'm going to dream about anything. I'm really tired.

title: Time for a Nap
dialogue_line: Have a nice nap.

title: Thinking about His Funeral
dialogue_line: That was a nice funeral.

title: Thinking about His Funeral
dialogue_line: Yes, dad, it was.

title: Thinking about His Funeral
dialogue_line: The son gave a nice speech about his father.

title: Thinking about His Funeral
dialogue_line: It was long, too.

title: Thinking about His Funeral
dialogue_line: I think it was about 45 minutes long.

title: Thinking about His Funeral
dialogue_line: But it went by fast. It was interesting.

title: Thinking about His Funeral
dialogue_line: I liked it.

title: Thinking about His Funeral
dialogue_line: I'll give you a speech like that, too.

title: Thinking about His Funeral
dialogue_line: Do you think anyone will come to my funeral?

title: Thinking about His Funeral
dialogue_line: Of course.

title: Thinking about His Funeral
dialogue_line: I think only the family will be there.

title: Thinking about His Funeral
dialogue_line: You have lots of friends. They will be there, too!

title: The Elephant
dialogue_line: Yikes! What was that noise?

title: The Elephant
dialogue_line: I had to blow my nose.

title: The Elephant
dialogue_line: Did you have to blow right next to the phone?

title: The Elephant
dialogue_line: Did you hear that?

title: The Elephant
dialogue_line: Of course I heard that. I thought a plane had crashed into your house.

title: The Elephant
dialogue_line: It wasn't that loud.

title: The Elephant
dialogue_line: I will blow my nose sometime for you, and you'll see.

title: The Elephant
dialogue_line: Okay. I'll take your word for it.

title: The Elephant
dialogue_line: I thought you had an elephant in your house.

title: The Elephant
dialogue_line: You're funny.

title: The Elephant
dialogue_line: What did you say? I think I've gone deaf.

title: The Elephant
dialogue_line: I'm going into the bathroom to blow my nose. I'll be right back.

title: You Can Have Some of My Friends
dialogue_line: I have lots of friends.

title: You Can Have Some of My Friends
dialogue_line: Really? How many do you have?

title: You Can Have Some of My Friends
dialogue_line: I don't know, maybe one hundred.

title: You Can Have Some of My Friends
dialogue_line: That is a lot of friends. Do you have a best friend?

title: You Can Have Some of My Friends
dialogue_line: Of course. I have lots of best friends.

title: You Can Have Some of My Friends
dialogue_line: How many best friends do you have?

title: You Can Have Some of My Friends
dialogue_line: I think about twenty-five.

title: You Can Have Some of My Friends
dialogue_line: Hmm. I have only one best friend.

title: You Can Have Some of My Friends
dialogue_line: I feel sorry for you.

title: You Can Have Some of My Friends
dialogue_line: I have only a few friends.

title: You Can Have Some of My Friends
dialogue_line: You must be lonely. I will share my friends with you.

title: You Can Have Some of My Friends
dialogue_line: That's very nice of you.

title: If You Cheat, You Will Die
dialogue_line: Don't you ever cheat on me.

title: If You Cheat, You Will Die
dialogue_line: Why would I do that?

title: If You Cheat, You Will Die
dialogue_line: Because men like to cheat.

title: If You Cheat, You Will Die
dialogue_line: Some men do, but not me.

title: If You Cheat, You Will Die
dialogue_line: I'm watching you.

title: If You Cheat, You Will Die
dialogue_line: I'm an open book. Watch me all you want.

title: If You Cheat, You Will Die
dialogue_line: If I catch you, you'll be sorry.

title: If You Cheat, You Will Die
dialogue_line: You won't catch me, because I love you. I'm not a cheater.

title: If You Cheat, You Will Die
dialogue_line: I will poke your eyes out.

title: If You Cheat, You Will Die
dialogue_line: I don't want any other woman.

title: If You Cheat, You Will Die
dialogue_line: I will chop your toes off, one by one.

title: If You Cheat, You Will Die
dialogue_line: Honey, please. You're the only woman for me, forever. I swear it.

title: Let's Not Go Out
dialogue_line: I hate to go outside.

title: Let's Not Go Out
dialogue_line: Me too.

title: Let's Not Go Out
dialogue_line: Why do you hate to go outside?

title: Let's Not Go Out
dialogue_line: I meet too many jerks.

title: Let's Not Go Out
dialogue_line: I agree.

title: Let's Not Go Out
dialogue_line: This city is full of jerks.

title: Let's Not Go Out
dialogue_line: Rude people are everywhere.

title: Let's Not Go Out
dialogue_line: But what can you do?

title: Let's Not Go Out
dialogue_line: You can yell at them.

title: Let's Not Go Out
dialogue_line: And they will yell back at you.

title: Let's Not Go Out
dialogue_line: Yelling doesn't do any good.

title: Let's Not Go Out
dialogue_line: No. The best thing to do is just stay home.

title: Fill Out the Form
dialogue_line: Will you look at this form?

title: Fill Out the Form
dialogue_line: Are you having problems with it?

title: Fill Out the Form
dialogue_line: I don't understand some things.

title: Fill Out the Form
dialogue_line: Let me help you.

title: Fill Out the Form
dialogue_line: What does "MI" mean?

title: Fill Out the Form
dialogue_line: "MI" stands for Middle Initial.

title: Fill Out the Form
dialogue_line: What does "MM/DD/YY" mean?

title: Fill Out the Form
dialogue_line: That means Month/Day/Year. Use numbers.

title: Fill Out the Form
dialogue_line: I don't understand.

title: Fill Out the Form
dialogue_line: For example, if your birth date is January 12, 1987, write 01/12/87.

title: Fill Out the Form
dialogue_line: Oh. That's simple enough.

title: Fill Out the Form
dialogue_line: Always print clearly, and fill in the bubbles completely.

title: The Animal Shelter
dialogue_line: Let's go to the animal shelter.

title: The Animal Shelter
dialogue_line: What do you want to do?

title: The Animal Shelter
dialogue_line: I want to get a puppy for my son.

title: The Animal Shelter
dialogue_line: That will make him so happy.

title: The Animal Shelter
dialogue_line: I'll get him one of those little dogs.

title: The Animal Shelter
dialogue_line: One that won't grow up too big.

title: The Animal Shelter
dialogue_line: And eat too much.

title: The Animal Shelter
dialogue_line: Do you know which one he would like?

title: The Animal Shelter
dialogue_line: Oh, yes, I took him there yesterday. He showed me one that he really liked.

title: The Animal Shelter
dialogue_line: I bet you had to drag him away.

title: The Animal Shelter
dialogue_line: He wanted to take it home yesterday.

title: The Animal Shelter
dialogue_line: I wonder what he'll name it.

title: Is It Raining?
dialogue_line: What's the weather like?

title: Is It Raining?
dialogue_line: I don't know. I just woke up.

title: Is It Raining?
dialogue_line: Why don't you look outside?

title: Is It Raining?
dialogue_line: Okay. It looks like rain.

title: Is It Raining?
dialogue_line: Why do you say that?

title: Is It Raining?
dialogue_line: The sky is gray.

title: Is It Raining?
dialogue_line: Is it raining right now?

title: Is It Raining?
dialogue_line: No.

title: Is It Raining?
dialogue_line: How do you know?

title: Is It Raining?
dialogue_line: The street isn't wet.

title: Is It Raining?
dialogue_line: I have to go shopping today.

title: Is It Raining?
dialogue_line: You'd better take an umbrella.

title: It's So Hot
dialogue_line: I can't believe how hot it is.

title: It's So Hot
dialogue_line: It's not even noon yet.

title: It's So Hot
dialogue_line: That means it will get hotter.

title: It's So Hot
dialogue_line: I am dying from the heat.

title: It's So Hot
dialogue_line: Turn on the air conditioner.

title: It's So Hot
dialogue_line: It doesn't work.

title: It's So Hot
dialogue_line: What happened?

title: It's So Hot
dialogue_line: I don't know.

title: It's So Hot
dialogue_line: Did you call the repairman?

title: It's So Hot
dialogue_line: Of course.

title: It's So Hot
dialogue_line: When is he coming?

title: It's So Hot
dialogue_line: He's busy. He said next week.

title: A Snowman
dialogue_line: I'll be glad when winter comes.

title: A Snowman
dialogue_line: Why is that?

title: A Snowman
dialogue_line: Because I love the snow.

title: A Snowman
dialogue_line: Yes, the snow is fun.

title: A Snowman
dialogue_line: Last year we made a big snowman.

title: A Snowman
dialogue_line: How big was it?

title: A Snowman
dialogue_line: It was seven feet tall.

title: A Snowman
dialogue_line: How long did it take?

title: A Snowman
dialogue_line: It took us all day.

title: A Snowman
dialogue_line: Did you give him a nose?

title: A Snowman
dialogue_line: Of course. We gave him a big carrot for a nose.

title: A Snowman
dialogue_line: Let me help you make one this year.

title: The ATM
dialogue_line: I'm going to the bank.

title: The ATM
dialogue_line: What do you need to do?

title: The ATM
dialogue_line: I need to withdraw some money.

title: The ATM
dialogue_line: How are you going to do that?

title: The ATM
dialogue_line: I'll just use the ATM.

title: The ATM
dialogue_line: What's that?

title: The ATM
dialogue_line: It's the Automatic Teller Machine.

title: The ATM
dialogue_line: It gives you money?

title: The ATM
dialogue_line: I just insert my debit card into the machine.

title: The ATM
dialogue_line: And it gives you money?

title: The ATM
dialogue_line: Well, it gives me money, but it's my own money.

title: The ATM
dialogue_line: Oh. What good is that? I thought it gave you free money.

title: Move the Blue Bin
dialogue_line: Did you put the blue bin out on the street?

title: Move the Blue Bin
dialogue_line: Oh, no. I forgot.

title: Move the Blue Bin
dialogue_line: Well, you'd better take it out front.

title: Move the Blue Bin
dialogue_line: What time does the recycle truck come by?

title: Move the Blue Bin
dialogue_line: It usually gets here at noon on Tuesday, which is tomorrow.

title: Move the Blue Bin
dialogue_line: I'll just take it out to the street tomorrow morning.

title: Move the Blue Bin
dialogue_line: Oh, no, you don't.

title: Move the Blue Bin
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: Move the Blue Bin
dialogue_line: Every morning you get up late and rush off to work late.

title: Move the Blue Bin
dialogue_line: Do you think I'll forget to do it?

title: Move the Blue Bin
dialogue_line: You'll remember to do it, but you won't have time to do it.

title: Move the Blue Bin
dialogue_line: Okay, I'll take it out front right now.

title: Digital TV
dialogue_line: Are you ready?

title: Digital TV
dialogue_line: Ready for what?

title: Digital TV
dialogue_line: Ready for the big switch.

title: Digital TV
dialogue_line: What are you talking about?

title: Digital TV
dialogue_line: The nation is switching to digital TV.

title: Digital TV
dialogue_line: Oh. Of course I'm ready.

title: Digital TV
dialogue_line: Did you buy the converter?

title: Digital TV
dialogue_line: No, I don't need a converter because I bought a digital TV.

title: Digital TV
dialogue_line: How much was that?

title: Digital TV
dialogue_line: It was only about $120 for a 13-inch screen.

title: Digital TV
dialogue_line: Does it pick up any digital channels?

title: Digital TV
dialogue_line: Oh, yes. I get six Korean channels but nothing in English!

title: Just Shoot Me
dialogue_line: People are funny.

title: Just Shoot Me
dialogue_line: They sure are.

title: Just Shoot Me
dialogue_line: Did you hear about the pilot?

title: Just Shoot Me
dialogue_line: The one that stole a small plane?

title: Just Shoot Me
dialogue_line: Yes, he stole a plane in Canada and flew into the U.S.

title: Just Shoot Me
dialogue_line: Did they catch him?

title: Just Shoot Me
dialogue_line: Yes. After two U.S. fighter jets followed him for an hour, he landed on a highway.

title: Just Shoot Me
dialogue_line: Did he crash?

title: Just Shoot Me
dialogue_line: No, he just landed the plane and walked to a restaurant.

title: Just Shoot Me
dialogue_line: Did the cops find out why he flew into the U.S.?

title: Just Shoot Me
dialogue_line: His life sucked. He was hoping a fighter jet would shoot him down.

title: Just Shoot Me
dialogue_line: Poor guy.

title: Don't Be a Racist
dialogue_line: The police need our help finding a robber.

title: Don't Be a Racist
dialogue_line: How do you know?

title: Don't Be a Racist
dialogue_line: The TV news is reporting a bank robbery.

title: Don't Be a Racist
dialogue_line: Do they know what the robber looks like?

title: Don't Be a Racist
dialogue_line: Yes, he's 6 feet tall, 200 pounds, black hair, and about 30 years old.

title: Don't Be a Racist
dialogue_line: What race is he?

title: Don't Be a Racist
dialogue_line: They didn't say.

title: Don't Be a Racist
dialogue_line: The TV news doesn't tell us the race anymore.

title: Don't Be a Racist
dialogue_line: Of course not. That would be racist.

title: Don't Be a Racist
dialogue_line: But how can we identify someone if we don't know their race?

title: Don't Be a Racist
dialogue_line: Don't ask me.

title: Don't Be a Racist
dialogue_line: Then they also shouldn't tell us if the robber is male or female, because that is sexist.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: Don't wipe your nose on your sleeve.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: But I don't have a tissue.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: Then go find a tissue in the bathroom.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: I didn't have time to get one from there.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: Your sleeves are not tissues.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: But Mom, all my friends use their sleeves.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: That doesn't make it right.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: I saw Dad wipe his nose on his sleeve yesterday.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: I will talk to your father about that.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: I bet Dad did it all the time when he was my age.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: Your daddy was a good little boy.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: How do you know? Were you his mommy, too?

title: Two Little Ones
dialogue_line: I'm worried.

title: Two Little Ones
dialogue_line: Worried about what?

title: Two Little Ones
dialogue_line: I'm getting married.

title: Two Little Ones
dialogue_line: You should be happy, not worried.

title: Two Little Ones
dialogue_line: I am happy, but marriage is a lot of responsibility.

title: Two Little Ones
dialogue_line: Yes, you have to take care of your wife.

title: Two Little Ones
dialogue_line: And I have to take care of our children.

title: Two Little Ones
dialogue_line: Are you going to start a family?

title: Two Little Ones
dialogue_line: Yes. We want to have a little boy and a little girl.

title: Two Little Ones
dialogue_line: That sounds wonderful.

title: Two Little Ones
dialogue_line: Except we can't afford it!

title: Two Little Ones
dialogue_line: No wonder you're worried.

title: But Is It Art?
dialogue_line: I don't get art.

title: But Is It Art?
dialogue_line: Or artists.

title: But Is It Art?
dialogue_line: They're in a different world.

title: But Is It Art?
dialogue_line: I saw a painting of a jar that was full of pencils.

title: But Is It Art?
dialogue_line: The artist said the jar was both full and empty.

title: But Is It Art?
dialogue_line: But it was full of pencils! How could he say it was empty?

title: But Is It Art?
dialogue_line: Artists see things differently.

title: But Is It Art?
dialogue_line: Did you ever see anything that Picasso painted?

title: But Is It Art?
dialogue_line: Of course! He's world famous.

title: But Is It Art?
dialogue_line: Did he ever take art lessons?

title: But Is It Art?
dialogue_line: I can't believe it. I drew paintings like that in third grade.

title: But Is It Art?
dialogue_line: Where are they? Maybe they are worth millions.

title: Life Is for Living
dialogue_line: What's the point?

title: Life Is for Living
dialogue_line: The point of what?

title: Life Is for Living
dialogue_line: Of living.

title: Life Is for Living
dialogue_line: Who knows? You live, and then you die.

title: Life Is for Living
dialogue_line: We must be here for some reason.

title: Life Is for Living
dialogue_line: Maybe we're here to have fun.

title: Life Is for Living
dialogue_line: Then why aren't I having fun?

title: Life Is for Living
dialogue_line: Because you're thinking too much.

title: Life Is for Living
dialogue_line: So I should stop thinking?

title: Life Is for Living
dialogue_line: Stop thinking about what the point is.

title: Life Is for Living
dialogue_line: Okay. I'll start thinking about having some fun.

title: Life Is for Living
dialogue_line: Just be patient. Fun doesn't come along every five minutes.

title: A Tough Choice
dialogue_line: Beer is a powerful drug.

title: A Tough Choice
dialogue_line: So are cigarettes.

title: A Tough Choice
dialogue_line: Which would you prefer?

title: A Tough Choice
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: A Tough Choice
dialogue_line: When you die and go to heaven, they will offer you beer or cigarettes.

title: A Tough Choice
dialogue_line: I could pick only one or the other?

title: A Tough Choice
dialogue_line: Yes. Nothing's perfect, not even in heaven.

title: A Tough Choice
dialogue_line: Boy, that's a tough one.

title: A Tough Choice
dialogue_line: What's so tough about it? Of course, I would pick cigarettes.

title: A Tough Choice
dialogue_line: But cigarettes taste much better when you have a cold beer.

title: A Tough Choice
dialogue_line: Well, you can't have everything.

title: A Tough Choice
dialogue_line: I don't think I want to go to your heaven.

title: Patch It or Sew It?
dialogue_line: My pants have a hole in the front pocket.

title: Patch It or Sew It?
dialogue_line: You shouldn't carry pens in your pocket.

title: Patch It or Sew It?
dialogue_line: Yesterday a pen fell through my pants onto my shoe.

title: Patch It or Sew It?
dialogue_line: Lucky for you it wasn't a sharp knife.

title: Patch It or Sew It?
dialogue_line: Who carries a sharp knife in their pocket?

title: Patch It or Sew It?
dialogue_line: Criminals, of course.

title: Patch It or Sew It?
dialogue_line: Anyway, I have to fix the hole.

title: Patch It or Sew It?
dialogue_line: You can sew it up or use an iron-on patch.

title: Patch It or Sew It?
dialogue_line: Tell me about this patch.

title: Patch It or Sew It?
dialogue_line: The patch has glue. The hot iron melts the glue so the patch sticks on.

title: Patch It or Sew It?
dialogue_line: That sounds a lot easier than sewing.

title: Patch It or Sew It?
dialogue_line: It is. But after about ten washings, the glue washes off.

title: What's So Funny?
dialogue_line: Do you know any good jokes?

title: What's So Funny?
dialogue_line: I can't remember jokes.

title: What's So Funny?
dialogue_line: Neither can I.

title: What's So Funny?
dialogue_line: They go in one ear and out the other.

title: What's So Funny?
dialogue_line: Who makes up all these jokes?

title: What's So Funny?
dialogue_line: Who knows? But there must be a hundred new ones every day.

title: What's So Funny?
dialogue_line: Yes, just in English alone.

title: What's So Funny?
dialogue_line: I wonder if every language has jokes.

title: What's So Funny?
dialogue_line: Of course! People everywhere like good jokes.

title: What's So Funny?
dialogue_line: What do you think people joke about the most?

title: What's So Funny?
dialogue_line: I think most jokes are about women.

title: What's So Funny?
dialogue_line: Oh, really? I think most jokes are about men!

title: Spanish Spoken Here
dialogue_line: You're very lucky.

title: Spanish Spoken Here
dialogue_line: Why do you say that?

title: Spanish Spoken Here
dialogue_line: You speak two languages.

title: Spanish Spoken Here
dialogue_line: Well, my English isn't perfect.

title: Spanish Spoken Here
dialogue_line: No one speaks perfect English.

title: Spanish Spoken Here
dialogue_line: Maybe I will be the first!

title: Spanish Spoken Here
dialogue_line: I've been thinking about learning Spanish.

title: Spanish Spoken Here
dialogue_line: Spanish is easy. I'll be happy to teach you.

title: Spanish Spoken Here
dialogue_line: How long will it take me to learn?

title: Spanish Spoken Here
dialogue_line: I think it will only take you a year or two.

title: Spanish Spoken Here
dialogue_line: How soon can we begin?

title: Spanish Spoken Here
dialogue_line: Ahora! That means right now.

title: It's the Only Earth We've Got
dialogue_line: Do you know what today is?

title: It's the Only Earth We've Got
dialogue_line: Yes, it's April 22.

title: It's the Only Earth We've Got
dialogue_line: It's more than just a date.

title: It's the Only Earth We've Got
dialogue_line: Is it your birthday or anniversary?

title: It's the Only Earth We've Got
dialogue_line: No, it's Earth Day.

title: It's the Only Earth We've Got
dialogue_line: What's that?

title: It's the Only Earth We've Got
dialogue_line: It's a yearly reminder to take care of our planet.

title: It's the Only Earth We've Got
dialogue_line: Oh, you mean like reuse things and recycle stuff?

title: It's the Only Earth We've Got
dialogue_line: Yes. We need to think green, save water, and stop using plastic bags.

title: It's the Only Earth We've Got
dialogue_line: How about if I take shorter showers?

title: It's the Only Earth We've Got
dialogue_line: That's a good idea, because showers waste a lot of water.

title: It's the Only Earth We've Got
dialogue_line: From now on I'll spend only 20 minutes in the shower.

title: No Time for Rhyme
dialogue_line: Poetry sucks.

title: No Time for Rhyme
dialogue_line: I don't know anyone who likes it.

title: No Time for Rhyme
dialogue_line: Some of it is okay, I guess.

title: No Time for Rhyme
dialogue_line: Yes, the poems that rhyme and are easy to remember.

title: No Time for Rhyme
dialogue_line: Like "One, two, buckle my shoe."

title: No Time for Rhyme
dialogue_line: But people still write poems.

title: No Time for Rhyme
dialogue_line: No one makes any money at it.

title: No Time for Rhyme
dialogue_line: Shakespeare was a poet.

title: No Time for Rhyme
dialogue_line: Did he get rich from his poetry?

title: No Time for Rhyme
dialogue_line: Probably not.

title: No Time for Rhyme
dialogue_line: Poems are a little bit like songs.

title: No Time for Rhyme
dialogue_line: Yes, but songs have music. Without music, songs would suck, too.

title: Dumb and Happy
dialogue_line: How smart are you?

title: Dumb and Happy
dialogue_line: I don't know. I think I'm average.

title: Dumb and Happy
dialogue_line: Did you ever take an IQ test?

title: Dumb and Happy
dialogue_line: No, I never did. All I know is that I got A's and B's in school.

title: Dumb and Happy
dialogue_line: I wish I was really smart.

title: Dumb and Happy
dialogue_line: Don't be ridiculous.

title: Dumb and Happy
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: Dumb and Happy
dialogue_line: If you're going to make a wish, wish that you were really rich or famous.

title: Dumb and Happy
dialogue_line: Don't you ever wonder what it's like to be super-smart?

title: Dumb and Happy
dialogue_line: It must be very lonely.

title: Dumb and Happy
dialogue_line: Why's that?

title: Dumb and Happy
dialogue_line: Because if you're super-smart, no one understands what you're saying.

title: Live from NBC 4!
dialogue_line: I missed the TV news last night. What was on?

title: Live from NBC 4!
dialogue_line: Nothing that would pass as news.

title: Live from NBC 4!
dialogue_line: What's the weather going to be like this weekend?

title: Live from NBC 4!
dialogue_line: I don't know. Whenever the weather comes on, I switch channels.

title: Live from NBC 4!
dialogue_line: What was the lead story on the news?

title: Live from NBC 4!
dialogue_line: Some actress was in court for driving without a license.

title: Live from NBC 4!
dialogue_line: What was the second story?

title: Live from NBC 4!
dialogue_line: Some actor married a woman young enough to be his daughter.

title: Live from NBC 4!
dialogue_line: What was the third story?

title: Live from NBC 4!
dialogue_line: A bull chased a man in a supermarket.

title: Live from NBC 4!
dialogue_line: Wasn't there anything about Octo-Mom?

title: Live from NBC 4!
dialogue_line: Of course. She's going to hire a nanny for her eight infants.

title: Life after Death
dialogue_line: What are you going to do about your death?

title: Life after Death
dialogue_line: Well, mostly I'll try to avoid it.

title: Life after Death
dialogue_line: I mean, are you going to get buried or cremated?

title: Life after Death
dialogue_line: My wife and I will be cremated.

title: Life after Death
dialogue_line: Are you going to be buried next to each other?

title: Life after Death
dialogue_line: Oh, no. Our ashes will be shaken into the ocean.

title: Life after Death
dialogue_line: You're not going to be buried?

title: Life after Death
dialogue_line: A coffin costs too much and takes up too much space.

title: Life after Death
dialogue_line: Yes, but it will be in a cemetery where your children can visit you.

title: Life after Death
dialogue_line: Children seldom visit their parents in a cemetery.

title: Life after Death
dialogue_line: That's true. A cemetery is for dead people, not living people.

title: Life after Death
dialogue_line: We figure our kids can visit us whenever they go to the beach.

title: Wipe Your Feet
dialogue_line: Did you wipe your feet?

title: Wipe Your Feet
dialogue_line: Yes, of course I wiped my feet.

title: Wipe Your Feet
dialogue_line: Then why is there mud on the carpet?

title: Wipe Your Feet
dialogue_line: I don't know. It's not my mud.

title: Wipe Your Feet
dialogue_line: Well, someone brought it into the house.

title: Wipe Your Feet
dialogue_line: Look at the bottom of my shoesÂ—they're clean.

title: Wipe Your Feet
dialogue_line: Of course they're clean. You left all the mud on the carpet.

title: Wipe Your Feet
dialogue_line: Okay, I'll get the vacuum cleaner.

title: Wipe Your Feet
dialogue_line: Don't vacuum it now.

title: Wipe Your Feet
dialogue_line: Don't you want me to clean up the mud?

title: Wipe Your Feet
dialogue_line: Wait till it dries. It will be easier to vacuum.

title: Wipe Your Feet
dialogue_line: Next time I will be more careful.

title: Mother's Day
dialogue_line: What are you getting for your mom?

title: Mother's Day
dialogue_line: What are you talking about?

title: Mother's Day
dialogue_line: Sunday is Mother's Day.

title: Mother's Day
dialogue_line: This Sunday?

title: Mother's Day
dialogue_line: Of course. It's all over the news.

title: Mother's Day
dialogue_line: I thought it was next Sunday.

title: Mother's Day
dialogue_line: Well, you'd better get her something.

title: Mother's Day
dialogue_line: I'll get her a nice card.

title: Mother's Day
dialogue_line: Is that it?

title: Mother's Day
dialogue_line: Yes. That's all I ever give her.

title: Mother's Day
dialogue_line: She raised you, and all you ever give her is a card?

title: Mother's Day
dialogue_line: It's okay. She knows that I love her.

title: A New Flag
dialogue_line: I don't like our flag.

title: A New Flag
dialogue_line: What's the matter with it?

title: A New Flag
dialogue_line: It's too much like other flags.

title: A New Flag
dialogue_line: Yes, a lot of flags have stripes.

title: A New Flag
dialogue_line: A flag should be pretty.

title: A New Flag
dialogue_line: What should our flag look like?

title: A New Flag
dialogue_line: It should have a pretty woman on it.

title: A New Flag
dialogue_line: That's ridiculous!

title: A New Flag
dialogue_line: You don't like pretty women?

title: A New Flag
dialogue_line: Of course I do. But not on our flag!

title: A New Flag
dialogue_line: Every nation should have a pretty woman on their flag.

title: A New Flag
dialogue_line: You can't go to war carrying a flag with a woman on it!

title: Work up an Appetite
dialogue_line: I had a busy morning.

title: Work up an Appetite
dialogue_line: What did you do?

title: Work up an Appetite
dialogue_line: I watered all the plants.

title: Work up an Appetite
dialogue_line: You have a lot of plants.

title: Work up an Appetite
dialogue_line: Then I did my laundry.

title: Work up an Appetite
dialogue_line: That takes some time.

title: Work up an Appetite
dialogue_line: I took the dog for a walk.

title: Work up an Appetite
dialogue_line: I'll bet he enjoyed his walk.

title: Work up an Appetite
dialogue_line: I vacuumed the entire house.

title: Work up an Appetite
dialogue_line: That's a lot of work.

title: Work up an Appetite
dialogue_line: And then I made lunch.

title: Work up an Appetite
dialogue_line: I'll bet you were hungry!

title: Dialing for a Dollar
dialogue_line: I don't have long distance service with my home phone.

title: Dialing for a Dollar
dialogue_line: So how do you make long distance calls?

title: Dialing for a Dollar
dialogue_line: I use a calling card.

title: Dialing for a Dollar
dialogue_line: Where do you get that?

title: Dialing for a Dollar
dialogue_line: I buy it at the dollar store.

title: Dialing for a Dollar
dialogue_line: How much is it?

title: Dialing for a Dollar
dialogue_line: It's one dollar for 100 minutes.

title: Dialing for a Dollar
dialogue_line: That's only a penny a minute!

title: Dialing for a Dollar
dialogue_line: It's a great price. But you have to dial a lot of numbers.

title: Dialing for a Dollar
dialogue_line: How many?

title: Dialing for a Dollar
dialogue_line: First you dial seven numbers, then ten numbers, then ten more numbers.

title: Dialing for a Dollar
dialogue_line: Yikes. I think I'll keep my long distance service.

title: I Go to College
dialogue_line: Do you go to college?

title: I Go to College
dialogue_line: Yes, I do.

title: I Go to College
dialogue_line: What college do you go to?

title: I Go to College
dialogue_line: I go to Pasadena City College.

title: I Go to College
dialogue_line: Do you like it?

title: I Go to College
dialogue_line: Oh, yes, I really like it.

title: I Go to College
dialogue_line: Why do you like it?

title: I Go to College
dialogue_line: Because it has great teachers.

title: I Go to College
dialogue_line: What else?

title: I Go to College
dialogue_line: I like all my classmates, too.

title: I Go to College
dialogue_line: Anything else?

title: I Go to College
dialogue_line: Yes. It's not expensive!

title: A Lost Pen
dialogue_line: I lost my new pen.

title: A Lost Pen
dialogue_line: Where did you lose it?

title: A Lost Pen
dialogue_line: I don't know.

title: A Lost Pen
dialogue_line: When did you lose it?

title: A Lost Pen
dialogue_line: I think I lost it today. I used it yesterday.

title: A Lost Pen
dialogue_line: Did you check all your pockets?

title: A Lost Pen
dialogue_line: I checked all my pockets.

title: A Lost Pen
dialogue_line: Did you look in your desk?

title: A Lost Pen
dialogue_line: Yes. It isn't there, either.

title: A Lost Pen
dialogue_line: It's probably around somewhere.

title: A Lost Pen
dialogue_line: Oh, well, it only cost me a dollar.

title: A Lost Pen
dialogue_line: Only a dollar? Don't even look for it.

title: Gravity for All
dialogue_line: Gravity is very important.

title: Gravity for All
dialogue_line: What is gravity?

title: Gravity for All
dialogue_line: It's the force that pulls everything down.

title: Gravity for All
dialogue_line: I don't understand.

title: Gravity for All
dialogue_line: If you pour water into a glass, the water goes down into the glass.

title: Gravity for All
dialogue_line: Of course it does.

title: Gravity for All
dialogue_line: Without gravity, the water would go up.

title: Gravity for All
dialogue_line: You're joking.

title: Gravity for All
dialogue_line: Without gravity, you would go up.

title: Gravity for All
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: Gravity for All
dialogue_line: You would float into the sky like a balloon.

title: Gravity for All
dialogue_line: That would be fun!

title: New Glasses
dialogue_line: I can't read my book.

title: New Glasses
dialogue_line: Turn on the light.

title: New Glasses
dialogue_line: The light is on.

title: New Glasses
dialogue_line: Open the book.

title: New Glasses
dialogue_line: The book is open.

title: New Glasses
dialogue_line: See an eye doctor.

title: New Glasses
dialogue_line: That's what I need to do.

title: New Glasses
dialogue_line: He'll give you a prescription for glasses.

title: New Glasses
dialogue_line: I'll make an appointment tomorrow.

title: New Glasses
dialogue_line: I'll get the yellow pages for an eye doctor.

title: New Glasses
dialogue_line: Read the phone number to me.

title: New Glasses
dialogue_line: I'll read it very loud, in case your hearing is getting bad, too.

title: School Items
dialogue_line: What do you need for school?

title: School Items
dialogue_line: I need pencils.

title: School Items
dialogue_line: Anything else?

title: School Items
dialogue_line: I need a notebook.

title: School Items
dialogue_line: Do you need a pen?

title: School Items
dialogue_line: No. I already have a pen.

title: School Items
dialogue_line: Do you need a calculator?

title: School Items
dialogue_line: No. The teacher doesn't permit calculators.

title: School Items
dialogue_line: How about a dictionary?

title: School Items
dialogue_line: No, we have a big dictionary in the classroom.

title: School Items
dialogue_line: Well, I guess that's it.

title: School Items
dialogue_line: Yes, that's all I need for now.

title: A Good Magazine
dialogue_line: I like this magazine.

title: A Good Magazine
dialogue_line: So do I.

title: A Good Magazine
dialogue_line: I read it once, and I subscribed.

title: A Good Magazine
dialogue_line: It gives you all the news.

title: A Good Magazine
dialogue_line: All the news in only 50 pages.

title: A Good Magazine
dialogue_line: I like the political cartoons.

title: A Good Magazine
dialogue_line: I like the beautiful photos of the houses for sale.

title: A Good Magazine
dialogue_line: I always read the film reviews.

title: A Good Magazine
dialogue_line: I never miss the food and drink section.

title: A Good Magazine
dialogue_line: I gave a subscription to my parents.

title: A Good Magazine
dialogue_line: Me too. They canceled their other news magazines.

title: A Good Magazine
dialogue_line: So did mine!

title: Shake Your Pen
dialogue_line: My pen is out of ink.

title: Shake Your Pen
dialogue_line: Shake it a couple of times.

title: Shake Your Pen
dialogue_line: I shook it. There is no more ink.

title: Shake Your Pen
dialogue_line: You can borrow mine.

title: Shake Your Pen
dialogue_line: Thank you. I'll buy a new one tomorrow.

title: Shake Your Pen
dialogue_line: What were you doing?

title: Shake Your Pen
dialogue_line: I was writing a letter.

title: Shake Your Pen
dialogue_line: Who were you writing to?

title: Shake Your Pen
dialogue_line: It's to my mom.

title: Shake Your Pen
dialogue_line: Tell her I said hello.

title: Shake Your Pen
dialogue_line: Okay. I'll return your pen when I'm done.

title: Shake Your Pen
dialogue_line: Take your time.

title: Do Your Homework
dialogue_line: Have you done your homework?

title: Do Your Homework
dialogue_line: Not yet.

title: Do Your Homework
dialogue_line: Then why are you watching TV?

title: Do Your Homework
dialogue_line: This is my favorite show.

title: Do Your Homework
dialogue_line: Go do your homework.

title: Do Your Homework
dialogue_line: But, mom!

title: Do Your Homework
dialogue_line: You can watch TV after you do your homework.

title: Do Your Homework
dialogue_line: But the show will be over.

title: Do Your Homework
dialogue_line: There will be another show next week.

title: Do Your Homework
dialogue_line: Please?

title: Do Your Homework
dialogue_line: You know the rules.

title: Do Your Homework
dialogue_line: I hate the rules! I can't wait till I grow up.

title: The Soldier
dialogue_line: I can't wait until I graduate.

title: The Soldier
dialogue_line: Me too.

title: The Soldier
dialogue_line: No more homework.

title: The Soldier
dialogue_line: I hate homework.

title: The Soldier
dialogue_line: Are you going to college?

title: The Soldier
dialogue_line: I can't afford it.

title: The Soldier
dialogue_line: Me neither.

title: The Soldier
dialogue_line: So what are you going to do?

title: The Soldier
dialogue_line: I'm joining the army.

title: The Soldier
dialogue_line: You're kidding. You might get killed.

title: The Soldier
dialogue_line: I don't think so. After I finish, I'll have enough money to go to college.

title: The Soldier
dialogue_line: That's not a bad idea.

title: The English Major
dialogue_line: What is your major?

title: The English Major
dialogue_line: English.

title: The English Major
dialogue_line: What are you going to do with an English major?

title: The English Major
dialogue_line: I'm going to be a teacher.

title: The English Major
dialogue_line: High school or middle school?

title: The English Major
dialogue_line: High school.

title: The English Major
dialogue_line: I teach high school English.

title: The English Major
dialogue_line: I didn't know that.

title: The English Major
dialogue_line: I started teaching five years ago.

title: The English Major
dialogue_line: How do you like it?

title: The English Major
dialogue_line: Do you see all this gray hair? It was totally black five years ago.

title: The English Major
dialogue_line: Maybe I'll teach middle school.

title: No Parking
dialogue_line: Parking at school is impossible.

title: No Parking
dialogue_line: I'll say.

title: No Parking
dialogue_line: I drove around for half an hour.

title: No Parking
dialogue_line: Did you find a spot?

title: No Parking
dialogue_line: I found a spot, but someone cut in and took it from me.

title: No Parking
dialogue_line: Did you yell at them?

title: No Parking
dialogue_line: Yes, I did.

title: No Parking
dialogue_line: And?

title: No Parking
dialogue_line: And he yelled back at me.

title: No Parking
dialogue_line: How rude.

title: No Parking
dialogue_line: But I got lucky a few minutes later.

title: No Parking
dialogue_line: You have to be lucky to find a parking space.

title: Keep Your Eyes Open
dialogue_line: This is a huge library.

title: Keep Your Eyes Open
dialogue_line: Yes, it has lots of rooms and lots of space.

title: Keep Your Eyes Open
dialogue_line: And lots of books.

title: Keep Your Eyes Open
dialogue_line: And lots of thieves.

title: Keep Your Eyes Open
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: Keep Your Eyes Open
dialogue_line: I mean, keep your belongings close to you.

title: Keep Your Eyes Open
dialogue_line: The only thing in my backpack is used books.

title: Keep Your Eyes Open
dialogue_line: But thieves don't know that.

title: Keep Your Eyes Open
dialogue_line: They might think that I've got an iPod or laptop in there.

title: Keep Your Eyes Open
dialogue_line: Now you're thinking.

title: Keep Your Eyes Open
dialogue_line: You'd think a library would be safe from thieves.

title: Keep Your Eyes Open
dialogue_line: Not even a church is safe from thieves.

title: Two Plus Two
dialogue_line: How good is your math?

title: Two Plus Two
dialogue_line: I can add two and two.

title: Two Plus Two
dialogue_line: So you're not very good at math?

title: Two Plus Two
dialogue_line: I'm terrible at math.

title: Two Plus Two
dialogue_line: Well, I need some help.

title: Two Plus Two
dialogue_line: With what?

title: Two Plus Two
dialogue_line: I'm taking a math course in school.

title: Two Plus Two
dialogue_line: Well, you should ask your teacher or your classmates for help.

title: Two Plus Two
dialogue_line: I can't do that.

title: Two Plus Two
dialogue_line: Why not?

title: Two Plus Two
dialogue_line: They might think I'm stupid.

title: Two Plus Two
dialogue_line: They're not going to think that! They'll be glad to help you.

title: Prayers
dialogue_line: Do you believe in God?

title: Prayers
dialogue_line: Of course.

title: Prayers
dialogue_line: Do you pray to God?

title: Prayers
dialogue_line: Occasionally.

title: Prayers
dialogue_line: When's that?

title: Prayers
dialogue_line: When I need something.

title: Prayers
dialogue_line: Like what?

title: Prayers
dialogue_line: Well, if I have a big test at school.

title: Prayers
dialogue_line: Does God answer your prayers?

title: Prayers
dialogue_line: Yes, I've passed all my tests.

title: Prayers
dialogue_line: Do you ever pray for money?

title: Prayers
dialogue_line: Not yet. I won't need to do that until I graduate from high school.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: The cops finally found the husband.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: What husband?

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: The husband of the driver who ran over two college students at 3 a.m.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: Oh, yeah. The girl died instantly, and the boy is still in the hospital.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: The husband said he tried to help the boy.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: Yes, he pushed him off the hood of the car.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: No, he said he gently placed the boy on the street.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: So what? They still drove off.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: The husband said a fire department was nearby.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: So what? Did he dial 911?

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: He said he was thinking about it, but he didn't get around to it.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: He didn't get around to turning himself in, either.

title: What Will People Think?
dialogue_line: I don't like riding the bus.

title: What Will People Think?
dialogue_line: Why not?

title: What Will People Think?
dialogue_line: The seats and windows are dirty.

title: What Will People Think?
dialogue_line: Don't they clean the bus every night?

title: What Will People Think?
dialogue_line: I think they do.

title: What Will People Think?
dialogue_line: You should bring some wipes with you.

title: What Will People Think?
dialogue_line: That's a good idea.

title: What Will People Think?
dialogue_line: Then you can wipe your seat and window.

title: What Will People Think?
dialogue_line: People will think I'm strange.

title: What Will People Think?
dialogue_line: Who cares? Everyone is strange.

title: What Will People Think?
dialogue_line: That's for sure.

title: What Will People Think?
dialogue_line: Don't worry about what people think.

title: Don't Ride the Bus
dialogue_line: I don't like riding the bus.

title: Don't Ride the Bus
dialogue_line: Why not?

title: Don't Ride the Bus
dialogue_line: Number one, it's too slow.

title: Don't Ride the Bus
dialogue_line: You're right. A car is faster.

title: Don't Ride the Bus
dialogue_line: Number two, it's usually late.

title: Don't Ride the Bus
dialogue_line: You're right. The buses are never on time.

title: Don't Ride the Bus
dialogue_line: Number three, it doesn't run 24 hours.

title: Don't Ride the Bus
dialogue_line: You're right. Buses don't run late at night.

title: Don't Ride the Bus
dialogue_line: Number four, it's too crowded.

title: Don't Ride the Bus
dialogue_line: You're right. You have to stand in the aisle.

title: Don't Ride the Bus
dialogue_line: Number five, it's unsafe.

title: Don't Ride the Bus
dialogue_line: You're right. Bad guys might rob you.

title: Don't Cut the Tires
dialogue_line: We had a problem at school.

title: Don't Cut the Tires
dialogue_line: What was the problem?

title: Don't Cut the Tires
dialogue_line: Someone cut the tires.

title: Don't Cut the Tires
dialogue_line: What tires?

title: Don't Cut the Tires
dialogue_line: The tires on the cars.

title: Don't Cut the Tires
dialogue_line: Where were the cars?

title: Don't Cut the Tires
dialogue_line: They were in the student parking lot.

title: Don't Cut the Tires
dialogue_line: How many tires were cut?

title: Don't Cut the Tires
dialogue_line: One or two tires were cut on each car.

title: Don't Cut the Tires
dialogue_line: How many cars?

title: Don't Cut the Tires
dialogue_line: Eleven cars.

title: Don't Cut the Tires
dialogue_line: That's terrible. I hope they catch the person.

title: The Crosswalk
dialogue_line: Life isn't fair.

title: The Crosswalk
dialogue_line: It sure isn't.

title: The Crosswalk
dialogue_line: I got a ticket yesterday.

title: The Crosswalk
dialogue_line: What for?

title: The Crosswalk
dialogue_line: I was crossing the street.

title: The Crosswalk
dialogue_line: Were you in a crosswalk?

title: The Crosswalk
dialogue_line: Yes, but the red hand was blinking.

title: The Crosswalk
dialogue_line: So? That's a ticket?

title: The Crosswalk
dialogue_line: Yes, it's a $140 ticket.

title: The Crosswalk
dialogue_line: That's not right!

title: The Crosswalk
dialogue_line: When I started to cross the street, the white walk sign was blinking.

title: The Crosswalk
dialogue_line: You need to walk faster.

title: It's Okay to Speed
dialogue_line: You're driving too fast.

title: It's Okay to Speed
dialogue_line: Why do you say that?

title: It's Okay to Speed
dialogue_line: The speed limit is 65.

title: It's Okay to Speed
dialogue_line: I know that.

title: It's Okay to Speed
dialogue_line: But you're doing 75.

title: It's Okay to Speed
dialogue_line: So is everyone else.

title: It's Okay to Speed
dialogue_line: But a cop might stop you.

title: It's Okay to Speed
dialogue_line: No, he won't. Some cars are doing 85.

title: It's Okay to Speed
dialogue_line: So the cop will stop those cars?

title: It's Okay to Speed
dialogue_line: Of course. He stops the fastest cars.

title: It's Okay to Speed
dialogue_line: My friend got a ticket for doing 75.

title: It's Okay to Speed
dialogue_line: Your friend was unlucky.

title: Check Your Tires
dialogue_line: Remember to put air in your tires.

title: Check Your Tires
dialogue_line: How often do I have to do that?

title: Check Your Tires
dialogue_line: Once every two months.

title: Check Your Tires
dialogue_line: That's a lot.

title: Check Your Tires
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: Check Your Tires
dialogue_line: That's six times a year!

title: Check Your Tires
dialogue_line: Yes, and it takes about five minutes each time.

title: Check Your Tires
dialogue_line: I'll try.

title: Check Your Tires
dialogue_line: Check your tires or you'll get a flat.

title: Check Your Tires
dialogue_line: Oh. That's not good.

title: Check Your Tires
dialogue_line: No, it isn't. A flat costs you time and money.

title: Check Your Tires
dialogue_line: And I don't have either.

title: Don't Be in a Hurry
dialogue_line: You're driving too fast.

title: Don't Be in a Hurry
dialogue_line: I'm in a hurry.

title: Don't Be in a Hurry
dialogue_line: Don't ever be in a hurry.

title: Don't Be in a Hurry
dialogue_line: It's not my fault. You didn't wake me up.

title: Don't Be in a Hurry
dialogue_line: That's not my fault. You didn't tell me to wake you up.

title: Don't Be in a Hurry
dialogue_line: Well, I meant to.

title: Don't Be in a Hurry
dialogue_line: Don't ever be in a hurry when you're driving.

title: Don't Be in a Hurry
dialogue_line: Why not?

title: Don't Be in a Hurry
dialogue_line: Because you'll have an accident. Most accidents are because people are in a hurry.

title: Don't Be in a Hurry
dialogue_line: How do you know that?

title: Don't Be in a Hurry
dialogue_line: I read a lot.

title: Don't Be in a Hurry
dialogue_line: I thought drunks caused most accidents.

dialogue_line: Let's go for a ride.

title: A New Car
dialogue_line: Where are we going?

title: A New Car
dialogue_line: Into the mountains.

title: A New Car
dialogue_line: That sounds nice.

title: A New Car
dialogue_line: I want to show you my new car.

title: A New Car
dialogue_line: You bought a new car?

title: A New Car
dialogue_line: Yes. I bought a Cadillac.

title: A New Car
dialogue_line: A luxury car.

title: A New Car
dialogue_line: Luxury plus speed.

title: A New Car
dialogue_line: What are we waiting for?

title: A New Car
dialogue_line: Let me get the keys.

title: A New Car
dialogue_line: Let me get my camera.

title: I'm Going to Explode
dialogue_line: I have to go to the bathroom.

title: I'm Going to Explode
dialogue_line: Why didn't you go before we left?

title: I'm Going to Explode
dialogue_line: I did, but I have to go again.

title: I'm Going to Explode
dialogue_line: Well, hold on a little longer.

title: I'm Going to Explode
dialogue_line: I think I'm going to explode.

title: I'm Going to Explode
dialogue_line: Just hold on.

title: I'm Going to Explode
dialogue_line: Oh! Don't hit any more bumps!

title: I'm Going to Explode
dialogue_line: We'll be at McDonald's in just a few minutes.

title: I'm Going to Explode
dialogue_line: I hope they are fast minutes.

title: I'm Going to Explode
dialogue_line: Think about something else. Think about a hamburger.

title: I'm Going to Explode
dialogue_line: I'm thinking, but I still have to go.

title: I'm Going to Explode
dialogue_line: It's the next exit. Hold on!

title: The Missing Car
dialogue_line: Where's the car?

title: The Missing Car
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: The Missing Car
dialogue_line: The car isn't here.

title: The Missing Car
dialogue_line: Where did you park it?

title: The Missing Car
dialogue_line: I parked it right here.

title: The Missing Car
dialogue_line: Are you sure?

title: The Missing Car
dialogue_line: Yes. I remember this big tree.

title: The Missing Car
dialogue_line: Maybe it's the wrong tree.

title: The Missing Car
dialogue_line: No, this is the tree.

title: The Missing Car
dialogue_line: Did someone steal it?

title: The Missing Car
dialogue_line: I sure hope not.

title: The Missing Car
dialogue_line: Maybe they towed it away.

title: Too Many Cars
dialogue_line: Look at this traffic.

title: Too Many Cars
dialogue_line: I'd rather not.

title: Too Many Cars
dialogue_line: It gets worse every year.

title: Too Many Cars
dialogue_line: Why are you complaining? We're going almost 20 miles an hour.

title: Too Many Cars
dialogue_line: The speed limit is 65!

title: Too Many Cars
dialogue_line: Well, that's between 2:00 and 4:00 a.m.

title: Too Many Cars
dialogue_line: Where are all these people going?

title: Too Many Cars
dialogue_line: They're all asking the same question.

title: Too Many Cars
dialogue_line: When are they going to fix this problem?

title: Too Many Cars
dialogue_line: They said they need more money.

title: Too Many Cars
dialogue_line: They always need more money.

title: Too Many Cars
dialogue_line: It'll get worse before it gets better.

title: Don't Call the Police
dialogue_line: Did you see that car?

title: Don't Call the Police
dialogue_line: Yes, he went through the red light.

title: Don't Call the Police
dialogue_line: Can we call the police?

title: Don't Call the Police
dialogue_line: No, the police don't care.

title: Don't Call the Police
dialogue_line: Why not?

title: Don't Call the Police
dialogue_line: They have to see it happen.

title: Don't Call the Police
dialogue_line: They don't believe us?

title: Don't Call the Police
dialogue_line: No. They can only give a ticket if they see it happen.

title: Don't Call the Police
dialogue_line: So, what do we do?

title: Don't Call the Police
dialogue_line: We don't do anything.

title: Don't Call the Police
dialogue_line: Maybe we should honk the horn next time.

title: Don't Call the Police
dialogue_line: The driver will just honk back at us.

title: Wash the Car
dialogue_line: My car is dirty.

title: Wash the Car
dialogue_line: Why don't you wash it?

title: Wash the Car
dialogue_line: That's what I'm going to do.

title: Wash the Car
dialogue_line: Are you going to wash it yourself?

title: Wash the Car
dialogue_line: Of course. It's not a hard job.

title: Wash the Car
dialogue_line: I'll help you.

title: Wash the Car
dialogue_line: Okay, I'll get a bucket.

title: Wash the Car
dialogue_line: I'll rinse the car first.

title: Wash the Car
dialogue_line: Then we can scrub it with a wet sponge and soap.

title: Wash the Car
dialogue_line: After that, we can dry it with a towel.

title: Wash the Car
dialogue_line: Then it will look like new

title: Wash the Car
dialogue_line: And you save $10.

dialogue_line: It sure is windy today.

title: Windy Weather
dialogue_line: Paper is flying everywhere.

title: Windy Weather
dialogue_line: This wind is dangerous for drivers.

title: Windy Weather
dialogue_line: Especially for drivers of big trucks.

title: Windy Weather
dialogue_line: The wind blows those trucks over.

title: Windy Weather
dialogue_line: It blows trees over, too.

title: Windy Weather
dialogue_line: A tree fell onto my dad's car.

title: Windy Weather
dialogue_line: Was there much damage?

title: Windy Weather
dialogue_line: My dad had to buy a new car.

title: Windy Weather
dialogue_line: Wow! That's terrible.

title: Windy Weather
dialogue_line: Never park your car under a tree.

title: Windy Weather
dialogue_line: The wind will get you, or the birds will get you.

title: Two Birds with One Stone
dialogue_line: When are we going to stop?

title: Two Birds with One Stone
dialogue_line: We'll stop at the next McDonald's.

title: Two Birds with One Stone
dialogue_line: How far away is that?

title: Two Birds with One Stone
dialogue_line: I think we'll be there in half an hour.

title: Two Birds with One Stone
dialogue_line: I hope so. I have to go to the bathroom.

title: Two Birds with One Stone
dialogue_line: Well, I can always pull over.

title: Two Birds with One Stone
dialogue_line: No, thank you, I'll just wait.

title: Two Birds with One Stone
dialogue_line: We can kill two birds with one stone.

title: Two Birds with One Stone
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: Two Birds with One Stone
dialogue_line: While you're using the bathroom, I'll order some food.

title: Two Birds with One Stone
dialogue_line: Don't order for me. I'm not hungry.

title: Two Birds with One Stone
dialogue_line: I'm very hungry. I'll order for you, and then I'll eat yours.

title: Beat the Light
dialogue_line: This is such a long light.

title: Beat the Light
dialogue_line: Look how many cars are waiting in line.

title: Beat the Light
dialogue_line: They need a left-turn arrow.

title: Beat the Light
dialogue_line: Only two cars can make a left turn every three or four minutes.

title: Beat the Light
dialogue_line: We'll be here forever.

title: Beat the Light
dialogue_line: Get out of this lane.

title: Beat the Light
dialogue_line: But we need to turn left.

title: Beat the Light
dialogue_line: Forget it. Go straight.

title: Beat the Light
dialogue_line: Then what?

title: Beat the Light
dialogue_line: Then we'll just make a U-turn.

title: Beat the Light
dialogue_line: And then we can turn right at the light.

title: Beat the Light
dialogue_line: Good idea. It will be so much quicker.

title: A Dream Car
dialogue_line: I need a cheap car.

title: A Dream Car
dialogue_line: How much money do you have?

title: A Dream Car
dialogue_line: Well, that should get you something.

title: A Dream Car
dialogue_line: But I need something that's reliable.

title: A Dream Car
dialogue_line: You need a car with low mileage.

title: A Dream Car
dialogue_line: A car that was owned by a little old lady.

title: A Dream Car
dialogue_line: Where have you looked?

title: A Dream Car
dialogue_line: I haven't looked anywhere yet.

title: A Dream Car
dialogue_line: Why not?

title: A Dream Car
dialogue_line: Because I'll never find one for such a low price.

title: A Dream Car
dialogue_line: You're right about that. Keep saving your money.

title: A Bad Driver?
dialogue_line: Good afternoon, officer.

title: A Bad Driver?
dialogue_line: Your driver's license and registration, please.

title: A Bad Driver?
dialogue_line: Here you go.

title: A Bad Driver?
dialogue_line: Do you know why I pulled you over?

title: A Bad Driver?
dialogue_line: I have no idea. All of a sudden I heard your siren.

title: A Bad Driver?
dialogue_line: You rolled through that stop sign back there.

title: A Bad Driver?
dialogue_line: But I stopped!

title: A Bad Driver?
dialogue_line: No, you didn't. You slowed down, but you didn't come to a full stop.

title: A Bad Driver?
dialogue_line: Well, nobody else does, so why should I?

title: A Bad Driver?
dialogue_line: That's not the attitude of a good driver.

title: A Bad Driver?
dialogue_line: But I am a good driver. I've never had a ticket in my life.

title: A Bad Driver?
dialogue_line: Well, you've got one now. Here. Have a nice day.

title: A Slow Walker
dialogue_line: $140. I can't believe it.

title: A Slow Walker
dialogue_line: What are you talking about?

title: A Slow Walker
dialogue_line: I got a ticket downtown for $140.

title: A Slow Walker
dialogue_line: Were you speeding?

title: A Slow Walker
dialogue_line: No, I was crossing the street.

title: A Slow Walker
dialogue_line: Were you jaywalking?

title: A Slow Walker
dialogue_line: No, I was in the crosswalk.

title: A Slow Walker
dialogue_line: So why did you get a ticket?

title: A Slow Walker
dialogue_line: The officer said the red hand was blinking.

title: A Slow Walker
dialogue_line: Was it blinking when you entered the crosswalk?

title: A Slow Walker
dialogue_line: No, the white WALK sign was blinking.

title: A Slow Walker
dialogue_line: You should fight that ticket. I'll be your witness.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: They were in a crosswalk near school at 3 a.m.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: Who?

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: Two students from USC.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: What happened?

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: A speeding car ran a red light, killing the girl.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: What happened to the other student?

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: He landed on the hood of the car.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: Did he get off the hood?

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: No, the car stopped and the passenger pushed the injured student off the hood.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: I'll bet the car continued on its way.

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: Of course it did. Why stop after you've run over two people?

title: Hit and Run
dialogue_line: I hope they find them and put them in jail for life.

title: Beware the Carts
dialogue_line: What happened to your car?

title: Beware the Carts
dialogue_line: I got a dent in the parking lot.

title: Beware the Carts
dialogue_line: How did you get it?

title: Beware the Carts
dialogue_line: I don't know. Maybe it was from a shopping cart.

title: Beware the Carts
dialogue_line: Those shopping carts are dangerous.

title: Beware the Carts
dialogue_line: Especially the metal ones.

title: Beware the Carts
dialogue_line: I don't park at a store that uses metal shopping carts.

title: Beware the Carts
dialogue_line: That's a good idea, but there was a good sale at this store.

title: Beware the Carts
dialogue_line: Did you save any money on the sale?

title: Beware the Carts
dialogue_line: Yes, I did. I saved about $50.

title: Beware the Carts
dialogue_line: That's great.

title: Beware the Carts
dialogue_line: Yes, except this dent will cost about $150.

title: A Great Movie
dialogue_line: Did you see "Titanic"?

title: A Great Movie
dialogue_line: Yes. It is a great movie.

title: A Great Movie
dialogue_line: I saw it twelve times.

title: A Great Movie
dialogue_line: I saw it eight times.

title: A Great Movie
dialogue_line: I have the DVD.

title: A Great Movie
dialogue_line: So do I.

title: A Great Movie
dialogue_line: Let's go to your home.

title: A Great Movie
dialogue_line: We can watch my DVD.

title: A Great Movie
dialogue_line: And then we can go to my home.

title: A Great Movie
dialogue_line: And watch your DVD.

title: A Great Movie
dialogue_line: I always cry at the end.

title: A Great Movie
dialogue_line: Me too. It's so sad.

title: A Card Game
dialogue_line: Let's play cards.

title: A Card Game
dialogue_line: I don't know any card games.

title: A Card Game
dialogue_line: I'll teach you one.

title: A Card Game
dialogue_line: Okay. What will you teach me?

title: A Card Game
dialogue_line: It's called poker.

title: A Card Game
dialogue_line: Is it easy to learn?

title: A Card Game
dialogue_line: Yes, it will only take about 30 minutes.

title: A Card Game
dialogue_line: Okay. Teach me how to play.

title: A Card Game
dialogue_line: We each get five cards.

title: A Card Game
dialogue_line: Oh, look. I have four tens.

title: A Card Game
dialogue_line: That's great, but you're not supposed to tell me.

title: A Card Game
dialogue_line: Oh. Sorry. Okay, I don't have four tens.

title: I Have Four Aces
dialogue_line: I'm a good card player.

title: I Have Four Aces
dialogue_line: Why is that?

title: I Have Four Aces
dialogue_line: Because I watch the other players.

title: I Have Four Aces
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: I Have Four Aces
dialogue_line: People will tell you if they have a good hand.

title: I Have Four Aces
dialogue_line: How do they do that?

title: I Have Four Aces
dialogue_line: For example, a friend of mine licks his lips.

title: I Have Four Aces
dialogue_line: When he licks his lips, you know he has a good hand?

title: I Have Four Aces
dialogue_line: I know he has a good hand, so I don't bet.

title: I Have Four Aces
dialogue_line: He never wins your money?

title: I Have Four Aces
dialogue_line: Nope, and it drives him crazy.

title: I Have Four Aces
dialogue_line: He knows you can't read his mind. Maybe he thinks you're cheating.

title: Too Much Volume
dialogue_line: Turn the radio down, please.

title: Too Much Volume
dialogue_line: But I'm listening to it.

title: Too Much Volume
dialogue_line: Well, listen to it more quietly.

title: Too Much Volume
dialogue_line: I can't wait till I grow up.

title: Too Much Volume
dialogue_line: What will you do?

title: Too Much Volume
dialogue_line: I will play the radio as loud as I want.

title: Too Much Volume
dialogue_line: That's okay with me.

title: Too Much Volume
dialogue_line: I will have a radio in every room of my house.

title: Too Much Volume
dialogue_line: Remind me to never visit you.

title: Too Much Volume
dialogue_line: All the radios will be on extra loud.

title: Too Much Volume
dialogue_line: Your neighbors will hate you.

title: Too Much Volume
dialogue_line: If they don't like it, they can move.

title: Don't Waste Your Money
dialogue_line: I hope I win the lotto.

title: Don't Waste Your Money
dialogue_line: Your chances are very small.

title: Don't Waste Your Money
dialogue_line: But you can't win if you don't play.

title: Don't Waste Your Money
dialogue_line: Ha! You can't win if you do play.

title: Don't Waste Your Money
dialogue_line: Someone has to win.

title: Don't Waste Your Money
dialogue_line: That's what everyone says.

title: Don't Waste Your Money
dialogue_line: It might as well be me.

title: Don't Waste Your Money
dialogue_line: That's what everyone says.

title: Don't Waste Your Money

dialogue_line: Of course I'm sure.

title: Double-Check Everything
dialogue_line: Well, I have to go back upstairs anyway.

title: Double-Check Everything
dialogue_line: It's getting later every minute.

title: Double-Check Everything
dialogue_line: I think I left the water running.

title: Double-Check Everything
dialogue_line: No, you didn't. Let's go! The only thing running is the clock!

title: Guns for All
dialogue_line: The city is buying guns.

title: Guns for All
dialogue_line: What are they paying?

title: Guns for All
dialogue_line: Up to $200 for each gun, no questions asked.

title: Guns for All
dialogue_line: Why are they doing this?

title: Guns for All
dialogue_line: They want to get guns off the street.

title: Guns for All
dialogue_line: Who would turn in a gun for $200?

title: Guns for All
dialogue_line: That isn't a good deal?

title: Guns for All
dialogue_line: A good gun costs $400 or more.

title: Guns for All
dialogue_line: Well, if you bring your receipt, maybe they'll give you $400.

title: Guns for All
dialogue_line: I'll keep my receipt and my gun.

title: Guns for All
dialogue_line: I didn't know you had a gun.

title: Guns for All
dialogue_line: Everyone in America should have a gun.

title: Crime Reduction
dialogue_line: You're yawning.

title: Crime Reduction
dialogue_line: I sure am.

title: Crime Reduction
dialogue_line: You should go to bed.

title: Crime Reduction
dialogue_line: I will as soon as I finish this article.

title: Crime Reduction
dialogue_line: What are you reading?

title: Crime Reduction
dialogue_line: It's about crime in Los Angeles.

title: Crime Reduction
dialogue_line: What does it say?

title: Crime Reduction
dialogue_line: The mayor says the crime rate is going down.

title: Crime Reduction
dialogue_line: Then why does everyone lock their doors?

title: Crime Reduction
dialogue_line: I guess they haven't read this article.

title: Crime Reduction
dialogue_line: No one believes that the crime rate is going down.

title: Crime Reduction
dialogue_line: Maybe the mayor is just talking about his own neighborhood.

title: Two Different States
dialogue_line: People who live in California are crazy.

title: Two Different States
dialogue_line: Why is that?

title: Two Different States
dialogue_line: Because of all the earthquakes and fires.

title: Two Different States
dialogue_line: But big earthquakes happen only once in a while.

title: Two Different States
dialogue_line: Once in a while is once too many.

title: Two Different States
dialogue_line: But you're right. There are a lot of fires.

title: Two Different States
dialogue_line: A recent fire destroyed 85 homes.

title: Two Different States
dialogue_line: Still, it's safer than Florida.

title: Two Different States
dialogue_line: Florida doesn't have earthquakes or fires.

title: Two Different States
dialogue_line: No, Florida just has hurricanes every year from June to October.

title: Two Different States
dialogue_line: But most of those hurricanes are harmless.

title: Two Different States
dialogue_line: Excuse me. Hurricane Andrew destroyed 30,000 homes!

title: Beautiful Hawaii
dialogue_line: I went to Hawaii on vacation.

title: Beautiful Hawaii
dialogue_line: Did you like it?

title: Beautiful Hawaii
dialogue_line: I loved it. I want to live there.

title: Beautiful Hawaii
dialogue_line: What did you like?

title: Beautiful Hawaii
dialogue_line: The island is so green, and the water is so blue.

title: Beautiful Hawaii
dialogue_line: Did you go swimming?

title: Beautiful Hawaii
dialogue_line: I went to the beach every day.

title: Beautiful Hawaii
dialogue_line: How was the weather?

title: Beautiful Hawaii
dialogue_line: It was hot and sunny every day.

title: Beautiful Hawaii
dialogue_line: What did you do at night?

title: Beautiful Hawaii
dialogue_line: At night I went out to eat. The food was delicious.

title: Beautiful Hawaii
dialogue_line: People who live in Hawaii are lucky.

title: A Real Meal
dialogue_line: I like this hotel.

title: A Real Meal
dialogue_line: What do you like about it?

title: A Real Meal
dialogue_line: We get a free breakfast.

title: A Real Meal
dialogue_line: Coffee and a roll?

title: A Real Meal
dialogue_line: No, a real breakfast.

title: A Real Meal
dialogue_line: Bacon and eggs?

title: A Real Meal
dialogue_line: With toast, ham, sausage, fresh fruit, and juice.

title: A Real Meal
dialogue_line: Wow! That is nice. Let's stay for two nights.

title: A Real Meal
dialogue_line: And the rooms are clean, too.

title: A Real Meal
dialogue_line: Do they allow pets?

title: A Real Meal
dialogue_line: No pets, no smoking.

title: A Real Meal
dialogue_line: I like that. Let's stay three nights.

title: New Sheets
dialogue_line: I'm not sleeping here tonight.

title: New Sheets
dialogue_line: What's the matter? This is a nice room.

title: New Sheets
dialogue_line: Maybe the room is nice, but not the bed.

title: New Sheets
dialogue_line: What's wrong with the bed?

title: New Sheets
dialogue_line: Look at this sheet.

title: New Sheets
dialogue_line: Yes?

title: New Sheets
dialogue_line: See those stains?

title: New Sheets
