dialogue_line: I sure do.

title: New Sheets
dialogue_line: I'm not sleeping on that sheet.

title: New Sheets
dialogue_line: Well, just call the front desk. They'll give us new sheets.

title: New Sheets
dialogue_line: I want sheets without stains on them.

title: New Sheets
dialogue_line: From now on, let's bring our own sheets.

title: The Airport
dialogue_line: What time does your plane leave?

title: The Airport
dialogue_line: It leaves at 12:15.

title: The Airport
dialogue_line: When do you have to be at the airport?

title: The Airport
dialogue_line: I have to be there two hours early.

title: The Airport
dialogue_line: So we have to be at the airport at 10:15.

title: The Airport
dialogue_line: That means we have to leave the house at 9:15.

title: The Airport
dialogue_line: Well, it's an hour to get there, if there are no traffic problems.

title: The Airport
dialogue_line: So maybe we better leave at 8:15?

title: The Airport
dialogue_line: Yes, it's better to get there too early than too late.

title: The Airport
dialogue_line: I agree.

title: The Airport
dialogue_line: You never know what might happen on these freeways.

title: The Airport
dialogue_line: There's at least one huge accident every day.

title: A Christmas Flight
dialogue_line: I need to fly to New York.

title: A Christmas Flight
dialogue_line: When are you going?

title: A Christmas Flight
dialogue_line: During the Christmas holidays.

title: A Christmas Flight
dialogue_line: You'd better buy your ticket now.

title: A Christmas Flight
dialogue_line: You must be kidding.

title: A Christmas Flight
dialogue_line: No, I'm not. It's March. Time is running out. Seats are selling out right now.

title: A Christmas Flight
dialogue_line: I thought I would wait until October.

title: A Christmas Flight
dialogue_line: I'll bet this is the first time you've ever flown during Christmas.

title: A Christmas Flight
dialogue_line: You're right.

title: A Christmas Flight
dialogue_line: Well, listen to me. You need to buy a ticket now.

title: A Christmas Flight
dialogue_line: But maybe prices will be cheaper in October.

title: A Christmas Flight
dialogue_line: Cheaper prices won't do you any good if there are no seats.

title: Fear of Flying
dialogue_line: I hate flying.

title: Fear of Flying
dialogue_line: So do I.

title: Fear of Flying
dialogue_line: A long time ago, flying used to be okay.

title: Fear of Flying
dialogue_line: Now it's like riding a bus.

title: Fear of Flying
dialogue_line: You're jammed in with people all around you.

title: Fear of Flying
dialogue_line: Half of them are coughing, and the other half are sneezing.

title: Fear of Flying
dialogue_line: You don't have any elbow room or knee room.

title: Fear of Flying
dialogue_line: People are always getting up to use the bathroom.

title: Fear of Flying
dialogue_line: Kids are crying or climbing over you.

title: Fear of Flying
dialogue_line: It's a flying zoo!

title: Fear of Flying
dialogue_line: I wish I could afford first class seats.

title: Fear of Flying
dialogue_line: Doesn't everybody?

title: Row Your Boat
dialogue_line: Some guy rowed across the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Row Your Boat
dialogue_line: Good for him.

title: Row Your Boat
dialogue_line: Why would he do that?

title: Row Your Boat
dialogue_line: Did he set a new record?

title: Row Your Boat
dialogue_line: Yes, I think he did.

title: Row Your Boat
dialogue_line: Well, I guess that's why he did it.

title: Row Your Boat
dialogue_line: What's the point?

title: Row Your Boat
dialogue_line: Now he has the world record!

title: Row Your Boat
dialogue_line: But someone's going to break it, so what good is it?

title: Row Your Boat
dialogue_line: Well, he can enjoy it while it lasts.

title: Row Your Boat
dialogue_line: I don't think he even got paid for it.

title: Row Your Boat
dialogue_line: Some people do it just to do it.

title: A Cruise
dialogue_line: I want to go on a cruise ship.

title: A Cruise
dialogue_line: That sounds like fun. Where do you want to go?

title: A Cruise
dialogue_line: I want to cruise to Hawaii.

title: A Cruise
dialogue_line: That should be a nice trip. Lots of fun, and lots of food.

title: A Cruise
dialogue_line: I have no idea how much it will cost.

title: A Cruise
dialogue_line: I think it depends on the season and on your cabin.

title: A Cruise
dialogue_line: Well, of course I want to go when the weather is nice.

title: A Cruise
dialogue_line: Yes, you don't want to travel in winter storms.

title: A Cruise
dialogue_line: And I want to get a big cabin with a view.

title: A Cruise
dialogue_line: Are you going to travel alone?

title: A Cruise
dialogue_line: No, my sister and I will travel together.

title: A Cruise
dialogue_line: Well, you should go online and try to find a good deal.

title: Prepare for Takeoff
dialogue_line: I hate to fly.

title: Prepare for Takeoff
dialogue_line: Because of all the security?

title: Prepare for Takeoff
dialogue_line: No, because it hurts my ears.

title: Prepare for Takeoff
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: Prepare for Takeoff
dialogue_line: Every time we land or take off, my ears hurt so much.

title: Prepare for Takeoff
dialogue_line: That's just the altitude change, I think.

title: Prepare for Takeoff
dialogue_line: Whatever it is, it hurts.

title: Prepare for Takeoff
dialogue_line: Can't you take medicine or something for it?

title: Prepare for Takeoff
dialogue_line: I've tried everything, but nothing works.

title: Prepare for Takeoff
dialogue_line: Have you tried earplugs?

title: Prepare for Takeoff
dialogue_line: They don't work, either.

title: Prepare for Takeoff
dialogue_line: Well, be glad you're not a pilot.

title: The Grand Canyon
dialogue_line: Spring break starts tomorrow.

title: The Grand Canyon
dialogue_line: Are you going to go anywhere?

title: The Grand Canyon
dialogue_line: I was thinking of driving to Arizona.

title: The Grand Canyon
dialogue_line: To the Grand Canyon?

title: The Grand Canyon
dialogue_line: Yes. I've never been there.

title: The Grand Canyon
dialogue_line: I was there when I was a kid.

title: The Grand Canyon
dialogue_line: How did you like it?

title: The Grand Canyon
dialogue_line: I loved it. I still remember how amazing it was.

title: The Grand Canyon
dialogue_line: I'm sure I'll like it, too.

title: The Grand Canyon
dialogue_line: You should try riding a mule on a trail to the bottom.

title: The Grand Canyon
dialogue_line: No way! I don't want to fall to my death.

title: The Grand Canyon
dialogue_line: Don't worry. Only one person has ever fallen off a mule.

title: Hotel Hell
dialogue_line: That hotel was terrible.

title: Hotel Hell
dialogue_line: The worst in the whole world.

title: Hotel Hell
dialogue_line: The walls were so thin.

title: Hotel Hell
dialogue_line: All day long we heard TVs or telephones.

title: Hotel Hell
dialogue_line: All night long we heard people snoring.

title: Hotel Hell
dialogue_line: Housekeeping didn't give us fresh towels.

title: Hotel Hell
dialogue_line: Room service brought us a cold dinner.

title: Hotel Hell
dialogue_line: Our nonsmoking room stunk of cigarette smoke.

title: Hotel Hell
dialogue_line: Our room was right next to the elevator and the ice machine.

title: Hotel Hell
dialogue_line: They added phony charges to our bill.

title: Hotel Hell
dialogue_line: How did we end up in that terrible hotel?

title: Hotel Hell
dialogue_line: The travel agent gave us a 50-percent discount!

title: A Long Day
dialogue_line: I have to hang up. I'm so sleepy.

title: A Long Day
dialogue_line: It's not even 10 o'clock.

title: A Long Day
dialogue_line: I'm falling asleep on the phone.

title: A Long Day
dialogue_line: You got up real early.

title: A Long Day
dialogue_line: I had to take my friend to the airport.

title: A Long Day
dialogue_line: Why didn't you take a nap when you got home?

title: A Long Day
dialogue_line: I didn't get home until 30 minutes ago.

title: A Long Day
dialogue_line: Why is that?

title: A Long Day
dialogue_line: There was a bomb threat at the airport.

title: A Long Day
dialogue_line: Only a threat?

title: A Long Day
dialogue_line: Yes, but I was stuck there all day while they looked for the bomb.

title: A Long Day
dialogue_line: Someday the bomb is going to be for real.

title: A Free Trip
dialogue_line: My dad went to Washington, D.C.

title: A Free Trip
dialogue_line: Why did he do that?

title: A Free Trip
dialogue_line: He was invited, along with about 90 other veterans.

title: A Free Trip
dialogue_line: Who invited them?

title: A Free Trip
dialogue_line: Some private organization.

title: A Free Trip
dialogue_line: Why did they invite him?

title: A Free Trip
dialogue_line: To thank him and all the other soldiers who served in World War II.

title: A Free Trip
dialogue_line: That's very nice.

title: A Free Trip
dialogue_line: My dad got to see the beautiful new World War II Monument.

title: A Free Trip
dialogue_line: That trip must have cost a lot of money.

title: A Free Trip
dialogue_line: He said all the money came from private donations.

title: Serving Your Country
dialogue_line: That was a great trip to Washington, D.C.

title: Serving Your Country
dialogue_line: Tell me about it, Dad.

title: Serving Your Country
dialogue_line: About 90 of us World War II veterans got on the plane at 8 a.m.

title: Serving Your Country
dialogue_line: How long was the flight?

title: Serving Your Country
dialogue_line: It only took about two hours.

title: Serving Your Country
dialogue_line: Did you take pictures at the World War II Monument?

title: Serving Your Country
dialogue_line: Oh, yes. We all took lots of pictures.

title: Serving Your Country
dialogue_line: Then you flew back home that evening?

title: Serving Your Country
dialogue_line: Yes. When we landed, TV reporters and the Army band were there.

title: Serving Your Country
dialogue_line: That must have made you feel really special.

title: Serving Your Country
dialogue_line: Oh, it did. There were about 300 people there to honor us.

title: Serving Your Country
dialogue_line: Well, you all deserve it. You helped save our country.

title: I Need a Job
dialogue_line: I need a job.

title: I Need a Job
dialogue_line: I thought you had a job.

title: I Need a Job
dialogue_line: I did.

title: I Need a Job
dialogue_line: What happened?

title: I Need a Job
dialogue_line: I got laid off.

title: I Need a Job
dialogue_line: That's terrible! When did it happen?

title: I Need a Job
dialogue_line: I got laid off last week.

title: I Need a Job
dialogue_line: Just you?

title: I Need a Job
dialogue_line: No, ten of my coworkers got laid off, too.

title: I Need a Job
dialogue_line: What are you going to do?

title: I Need a Job
dialogue_line: I'm looking in the newspaper for a job.

title: I Need a Job
dialogue_line: Good luck!

title: Before Going to an Interview
dialogue_line: Before you go to that interview, check yourself.

title: Before Going to an Interview
dialogue_line: What's to check?

title: Before Going to an Interview
dialogue_line: Are your nails clean?

title: Before Going to an Interview
dialogue_line: Yes, they are.

title: Before Going to an Interview
dialogue_line: Did you double-check your nose and teeth?

title: Before Going to an Interview
dialogue_line: They are clean, too.

title: Before Going to an Interview
dialogue_line: Did you shine your shoes?

title: Before Going to an Interview
dialogue_line: My shoes are shined.

title: Before Going to an Interview
dialogue_line: Do your socks match?

title: Before Going to an Interview
dialogue_line: Of course they match.

title: Before Going to an Interview
dialogue_line: No, they don't. One is black and one is dark blue.

title: Before Going to an Interview
dialogue_line: Yikes! Thank you.

title: Work Is Hard
dialogue_line: Life is hard.

title: Work Is Hard
dialogue_line: It sure is.

title: Work Is Hard
dialogue_line: I thought school was hard.

title: Work Is Hard
dialogue_line: Me, too. I couldn't wait to graduate.

title: Work Is Hard
dialogue_line: But now work is hard, too.

title: Work Is Hard
dialogue_line: I agree. Work is just as hard as school.

title: Work Is Hard
dialogue_line: Sometimes I wish I was back in school.

title: Work Is Hard
dialogue_line: Me, too. School was fun.

title: Work Is Hard
dialogue_line: And it was only 12 years.

title: Work Is Hard
dialogue_line: It went by pretty fast.

title: Work Is Hard
dialogue_line: But work goes on forever!

title: Work Is Hard
dialogue_line: We have to work for 30 years!

title: Peas in a Pod
dialogue_line: I'm sleepy.

title: Peas in a Pod
dialogue_line: So am I.

title: Peas in a Pod
dialogue_line: I had a long day.

title: Peas in a Pod
dialogue_line: So did I.

title: Peas in a Pod
dialogue_line: I didn't even have lunch.

title: Peas in a Pod
dialogue_line: Neither did I.

title: Peas in a Pod
dialogue_line: I was busy the whole day.

title: Peas in a Pod
dialogue_line: So was I.

title: Peas in a Pod
dialogue_line: I had to bring work home with me.

title: Peas in a Pod
dialogue_line: I did too.

title: Peas in a Pod
dialogue_line: Your day was just like mine.

title: Peas in a Pod
dialogue_line: Of course it was. We work together!

title: I Am a Babysitter
dialogue_line: I don't like my job.

title: I Am a Babysitter
dialogue_line: What do you do?

title: I Am a Babysitter
dialogue_line: I'm a babysitter.

title: I Am a Babysitter
dialogue_line: Is that a lot of work?

title: I Am a Babysitter
dialogue_line: Babies cry all the time.

title: I Am a Babysitter
dialogue_line: You have to change their diapers.

title: I Am a Babysitter
dialogue_line: I have to feed them.

title: I Am a Babysitter
dialogue_line: Are you looking for another job?

title: I Am a Babysitter
dialogue_line: No, I'm looking for another family.

title: I Am a Babysitter
dialogue_line: Another family?

title: I Am a Babysitter
dialogue_line: A family with only one baby.

title: I Am a Babysitter
dialogue_line: That's a good idea.

title: Hire Me
dialogue_line: I need a job.

title: Hire Me
dialogue_line: What was your last job?

title: Hire Me
dialogue_line: I was a painter.

title: Hire Me
dialogue_line: What happened?

title: Hire Me
dialogue_line: I got laid off because there was no work.

title: Hire Me
dialogue_line: What else can you do?

title: Hire Me
dialogue_line: I'm a handyman.

title: Hire Me
dialogue_line: Can you fix a dripping faucet in a kitchen sink?

title: Hire Me
dialogue_line: Of course.

title: Hire Me
dialogue_line: Then I have a job for you in my kitchen.

title: Hire Me
dialogue_line: It will cost you only $20 plus parts.

title: Hire Me
dialogue_line: Okay. That sounds like a fair price.

title: What If?
dialogue_line: What would you do if you lost your job?

title: What If?
dialogue_line: I have no idea. I've been here for 20 years.

title: What If?
dialogue_line: Do you have any other skills?

title: What If?
dialogue_line: Well, I know how to flip hamburgers.

title: What If?
dialogue_line: No one would hire you to flip hamburgers.

title: What If?
dialogue_line: Have you heard something that you're not telling me?

title: What If?
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: What If?
dialogue_line: Are there going to be layoffs at this place?

title: What If?
dialogue_line: I certainly hope not!

title: What If?
dialogue_line: If you got laid off, you'd be flipping hamburgers, too.

title: What If?
dialogue_line: Oh great, we could both work at Burger King.

title: What If?
dialogue_line: Maybe we'd get laid off there, too.

title: Become a Teacher
dialogue_line: Do your students ever talk about their jobs?

title: Become a Teacher
dialogue_line: Yes, and they ask me what jobs are the best.

title: Become a Teacher
dialogue_line: I tell my students to become a teacher.

title: Become a Teacher
dialogue_line: Teaching is a great job.

title: Become a Teacher
dialogue_line: It's the best job I've ever had.

title: Become a Teacher
dialogue_line: What makes it so good?

title: Become a Teacher
dialogue_line: For me, it's the students.

title: Become a Teacher
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: Become a Teacher
dialogue_line: I mean I have wonderful students.

title: Become a Teacher
dialogue_line: That must be nice.

title: Become a Teacher
dialogue_line: Teaching is the best part of my whole day.

title: Become a Teacher
dialogue_line: You're a lucky man to have a job you love.

title: Over and Over
dialogue_line: Boy, I'm glad that job is finished.

title: Over and Over
dialogue_line: How long did it take?

title: Over and Over
dialogue_line: Four hours, without a break.

title: Over and Over
dialogue_line: It's always nice to finish a job.

title: Over and Over
dialogue_line: Well, it's good and bad.

title: Over and Over
dialogue_line: What's bad about it?

title: Over and Over
dialogue_line: When you finish, all you do is start another job!

title: Over and Over
dialogue_line: Yes, that's right. It does get boring.

title: Over and Over
dialogue_line: Especially if it's the same work, over and over.

title: Over and Over
dialogue_line: But that's what most people do.

title: Over and Over
dialogue_line: Yes, I guess most of us are stuck in a routine.

title: Over and Over
dialogue_line: I wonder if there is any job that you don't repeat over and over.

title: A Bad Boss
dialogue_line: I think I have the worst boss in the world.

title: A Bad Boss
dialogue_line: What makes him so bad?

title: A Bad Boss
dialogue_line: He's rude and he yells a lot.

title: A Bad Boss
dialogue_line: That's hard to take.

title: A Bad Boss
dialogue_line: I've never heard him say please or thank you.

title: A Bad Boss
dialogue_line: He sounds like a real jerk.

title: A Bad Boss
dialogue_line: No one at work likes him.

title: A Bad Boss
dialogue_line: Can't you report him to his supervisor?

title: A Bad Boss
dialogue_line: Of course not. If I do that, I'll lose my job.

title: A Bad Boss
dialogue_line: Yes, they don't like troublemakers or complainers.

title: A Bad Boss
dialogue_line: I can't quit, because I'm making a good salary.

title: A Bad Boss
dialogue_line: You shouldn't choose money over happiness.

title: Light My Fire
dialogue_line: What are we going to do?

title: Light My Fire
dialogue_line: About what?

title: Light My Fire
dialogue_line: About finding a job for me.

title: Light My Fire
dialogue_line: You don't need a job. I make enough money for both of us.

title: Light My Fire
dialogue_line: That doesn't matter. I don't want to sit around.

title: Light My Fire
dialogue_line: Okay, what kind of job do you want?

title: Light My Fire
dialogue_line: I'm not sure.

title: Light My Fire
dialogue_line: Well, you should do something that you enjoy.

title: Light My Fire
dialogue_line: I enjoy selling. I was born to sell.

title: Light My Fire
dialogue_line: Okay, what do you want to sell?

title: Light My Fire
dialogue_line: Cigarette lighters. I'll make a fortune.

title: Light My Fire
dialogue_line: But you hate cigarettes and you hate smoking!

title: Still Working
dialogue_line: A new hotel is looking for workers.

title: Still Working
dialogue_line: Yes, I saw it on the TV news.

title: Still Working
dialogue_line: They need 300 new workers.

title: Still Working
dialogue_line: And 4,000 people showed up.

title: Still Working
dialogue_line: So many people are out of work.

title: Still Working
dialogue_line: I still have my job, thank goodness.

title: Still Working
dialogue_line: So do I, but I'm worried.

title: Still Working
dialogue_line: Me too. There are no guarantees.

title: Still Working
dialogue_line: If you lose your job, you can move in with me.

title: Still Working
dialogue_line: Oh, thank you. That's very nice of you.

title: Still Working
dialogue_line: You would do the same for me.

title: Still Working
dialogue_line: Of course. What are friends for?

title: All His Eggs in One Basket
dialogue_line: I think I did something real stupid.

title: All His Eggs in One Basket
dialogue_line: What did you do?

title: All His Eggs in One Basket
dialogue_line: I bought some stock.

title: All His Eggs in One Basket
dialogue_line: Everybody buys stock.

title: All His Eggs in One Basket
dialogue_line: I bought it on a hunch.

title: All His Eggs in One Basket
dialogue_line: You didn't read about the company first?

title: All His Eggs in One Basket
dialogue_line: I didn't have to. It's been in business for 60 years.

title: All His Eggs in One Basket
dialogue_line: So what's the problem?

title: All His Eggs in One Basket
dialogue_line: I used all my savings on this one company.

title: All His Eggs in One Basket
dialogue_line: You put all your eggs into one basket.

title: All His Eggs in One Basket
dialogue_line: If the company goes out of business, I'll have nothing.

title: All His Eggs in One Basket
dialogue_line: Oh, you'll have somethingÂ—you'll have a lesson you'll never forget!

title: His Parents Are Disappointed
dialogue_line: I was going to be a doctor.

title: His Parents Are Disappointed
dialogue_line: What happened to your plans?

title: His Parents Are Disappointed
dialogue_line: I got a D in college chemistry.

title: His Parents Are Disappointed
dialogue_line: Well, a D is better than an F.

title: His Parents Are Disappointed
dialogue_line: A tutor helped me get the D!

title: His Parents Are Disappointed
dialogue_line: So, you didn't become a doctor.

title: His Parents Are Disappointed
dialogue_line: And now I'm glad that I didn't.

title: His Parents Are Disappointed
dialogue_line: Why's that?

title: His Parents Are Disappointed
dialogue_line: A hospital is the most dangerous place in the world.

title: His Parents Are Disappointed
dialogue_line: Oh, yes, because of all the killer germs.

title: His Parents Are Disappointed
dialogue_line: If you're a smart doctor, you stay away from hospitals.

title: His Parents Are Disappointed
dialogue_line: Yes, the smart doctors are those TV news doctorsÂ—no hospitals, no patients.

title: Nice Doggy
dialogue_line: I want to be a mail carrier when I grow up.

title: Nice Doggy
dialogue_line: Why?

title: Nice Doggy
dialogue_line: Because you get to meet a lot of people.

title: Nice Doggy
dialogue_line: You sure do.

title: Nice Doggy
dialogue_line: And you get a lot of exercise every day.

title: Nice Doggy
dialogue_line: That's the truth.

title: Nice Doggy
dialogue_line: And you get to play with a lot of dogs.

title: Nice Doggy
dialogue_line: Well, you're supposed to be working.

title: Nice Doggy
dialogue_line: Yes, but I will always pet the friendly dogs.

title: Nice Doggy
dialogue_line: What about the unfriendly dogs?

title: Nice Doggy
dialogue_line: I think if you are friendly to dogs, they are friendly to you.

title: Nice Doggy
dialogue_line: Dogs are like peopleÂ—not all of them are friendly.

title: Knock, Knock!
dialogue_line: I want to move to New York.

title: Knock, Knock!
dialogue_line: To the state or the city?

title: Knock, Knock!
dialogue_line: To the city, of course.

title: Knock, Knock!
dialogue_line: Why do you want to move there?

title: Knock, Knock!
dialogue_line: Because I want to make a lot of money.

title: Knock, Knock!
dialogue_line: There are a lot of poor people in New York.

title: Knock, Knock!
dialogue_line: There sure areÂ—at least a million.

title: Knock, Knock!
dialogue_line: So how do you plan to become rich?

title: Knock, Knock!
dialogue_line: I will knock on the doors of all the corporations.

title: Knock, Knock!
dialogue_line: That won't make you rich. Nobody will talk to you.

title: Knock, Knock!
dialogue_line: I will keep knocking on doors.

title: Knock, Knock!
dialogue_line: All you will get is sore knuckles.

title: A Good Salad
dialogue_line: I love salads.

title: A Good Salad
dialogue_line: Me too.

title: A Good Salad
dialogue_line: I usually eat a simple salad.

title: A Good Salad
dialogue_line: What do you put in it?

title: A Good Salad
dialogue_line: Just lettuce, tomato, and celery.

title: A Good Salad
dialogue_line: That's it?

title: A Good Salad
dialogue_line: I add some pepper and salt.

title: A Good Salad
dialogue_line: I always put cheese in my salads.

title: A Good Salad
dialogue_line: Yes, cheese is nice.

title: A Good Salad
dialogue_line: What kind of dressing do you use?

title: A Good Salad
dialogue_line: I pour lots of French dressing on top.

title: A Good Salad
dialogue_line: Me too. French dressing is so delicious! Who cares about calories?

title: We Get Cheese from Cows
dialogue_line: I love cheese.

title: We Get Cheese from Cows
dialogue_line: Me too.

title: We Get Cheese from Cows
dialogue_line: Where does cheese come from?

title: We Get Cheese from Cows
dialogue_line: It comes from cows.

title: We Get Cheese from Cows
dialogue_line: So we get cheese from cows, and we get milk, too?

title: We Get Cheese from Cows
dialogue_line: Yes, we do.

title: We Get Cheese from Cows
dialogue_line: What else do we get from cows?

title: We Get Cheese from Cows
dialogue_line: We get hamburgers and steak.

title: We Get Cheese from Cows
dialogue_line: Oh, that's so delicious.

title: We Get Cheese from Cows
dialogue_line: We also get leather.

title: We Get Cheese from Cows
dialogue_line: We get a lot of things from cows, don't we?

title: We Get Cheese from Cows
dialogue_line: Yes. A cow is man's best friend.

title: I Used to Work in a Deli
dialogue_line: I used to work in a deli.

title: I Used to Work in a Deli
dialogue_line: How did you like it?

title: I Used to Work in a Deli
dialogue_line: I loved it!

title: I Used to Work in a Deli
dialogue_line: Did you get free food?

title: I Used to Work in a Deli
dialogue_line: I ate free cheese and meat every day.

title: I Used to Work in a Deli
dialogue_line: That sounds like a great job.

title: I Used to Work in a Deli
dialogue_line: Whatever a customer ordered, I sliced off a little more for me.

title: I Used to Work in a Deli
dialogue_line: Did you get fat?

title: I Used to Work in a Deli
dialogue_line: No, but I did put on a few pounds.

title: I Used to Work in a Deli
dialogue_line: That sounds like a dream job.

title: I Used to Work in a Deli
dialogue_line: It was, until one day my manager caught me.

title: I Used to Work in a Deli
dialogue_line: No more free cheese for you, huh?

title: A New Diet
dialogue_line: I'm on a new diet.

title: A New Diet
dialogue_line: What are you eating now?

title: A New Diet
dialogue_line: I switched from pasta to potatoes.

title: A New Diet
dialogue_line: Why did you do that?

title: A New Diet
dialogue_line: Pasta is processed food. Potatoes are natural food.

title: A New Diet
dialogue_line: Natural food has more vitamins.

title: A New Diet
dialogue_line: And it's just as easy to prepare.

title: A New Diet
dialogue_line: How do you prepare the potatoes?

title: A New Diet
dialogue_line: I wash them, and then steam them for 15 minutes.

title: A New Diet
dialogue_line: That's pretty simple.

title: A New Diet
dialogue_line: Then I add butter, salt, and pepper.

title: A New Diet
dialogue_line: Can I have all those cans of tomato sauce you bought for your pasta?

title: Bad Manners
dialogue_line: My girlfriend's mom got mad at me at the dinner table.

title: Bad Manners
dialogue_line: Why was that?

title: Bad Manners
dialogue_line: I sprinkled salt and pepper on the food before I tasted it.

title: Bad Manners
dialogue_line: What's the matter with that?

title: Bad Manners
dialogue_line: Her mom is a great cook.

title: Bad Manners
dialogue_line: So, a little salt and pepper never hurt anything.

title: Bad Manners
dialogue_line: It hurt her feelings.

title: Bad Manners
dialogue_line: Oh.

title: Bad Manners
dialogue_line: I apologized to her, but I could tell she was still upset.

title: Bad Manners
dialogue_line: Maybe you shouldn't eat there again.

title: Bad Manners
dialogue_line: I'm sure everything will be okay in a day or two.

title: Bad Manners
dialogue_line: It's your girlfriend's fault. She should have warned you.

title: Same Old Diet
dialogue_line: I eat the same thing every day.

title: Same Old Diet
dialogue_line: You're kidding.

title: Same Old Diet
dialogue_line: No, I'm serious.

title: Same Old Diet
dialogue_line: Doesn't that get old?

title: Same Old Diet
dialogue_line: No, because I'm eating food that I like.

title: Same Old Diet
dialogue_line: But the same thing day after day gets old.

title: Same Old Diet
dialogue_line: Well, I guess if it ever does get old, I'll change to something different.

title: Same Old Diet
dialogue_line: Do you eat fruits and vegetables every day?

title: Same Old Diet
dialogue_line: No, I hate vegetables.

title: Same Old Diet
dialogue_line: But you eat fruits.

title: Same Old Diet
dialogue_line: I eat two apples, one banana, and one orange every day.

title: Same Old Diet
dialogue_line: Well, there's nothing wrong with that.

title: A Pink Orange
dialogue_line: There's something wrong with my orange.

title: A Pink Orange
dialogue_line: What's wrong?

title: A Pink Orange
dialogue_line: It's not orange!

title: A Pink Orange
dialogue_line: Your orange isn't orange?

title: A Pink Orange
dialogue_line: No, it's dark pink!

title: A Pink Orange
dialogue_line: Are you sure? I never heard of such a thing.

title: A Pink Orange
dialogue_line: I just peeled it, and I'm looking at it right now.

title: A Pink Orange
dialogue_line: Let me see. Yes, you're right. Your orange is pink.

title: A Pink Orange
dialogue_line: Who ever heard of such a thing?

title: A Pink Orange
dialogue_line: Oh, look. Here's the little sticker that was on it. It's called a Pink Navel.

title: A Pink Orange
dialogue_line: What is this world coming to?

title: A Pink Orange
dialogue_line: Who knows? Maybe soon we'll have pink bananas.

title: Roasted or Boiled
dialogue_line: I love peanuts.

title: Roasted or Boiled
dialogue_line: Me, too. I love them roasted and salted.

title: Roasted or Boiled
dialogue_line: I love boiled peanuts.

title: Roasted or Boiled
dialogue_line: Boiled? I never heard of that.

title: Roasted or Boiled
dialogue_line: Just boil raw peanuts in salt water until the shells are soft.

title: Roasted or Boiled
dialogue_line: I'll have to try them sometime.

title: Roasted or Boiled
dialogue_line: They're best when they're hot.

title: Roasted or Boiled
dialogue_line: My brother is allergic to peanuts.

title: Roasted or Boiled
dialogue_line: That's not good.

title: Roasted or Boiled
dialogue_line: No, it isn't. He almost died when he was little.

title: Roasted or Boiled
dialogue_line: I guess he has to be very careful about what he eats.

title: Roasted or Boiled
dialogue_line: He has a very strict diet.

title: A Pound a Week
dialogue_line: I'm gaining weight.

title: A Pound a Week
dialogue_line: How much have you gained?

title: A Pound a Week
dialogue_line: Three pounds just this month.

title: A Pound a Week
dialogue_line: Do you know why?

title: A Pound a Week
dialogue_line: I think it's the ice cream.

title: A Pound a Week
dialogue_line: You started eating ice cream?

title: A Pound a Week
dialogue_line: It was on sale.

title: A Pound a Week
dialogue_line: How much did you buy?

title: A Pound a Week
dialogue_line: I filled up my freezer with ice cream.

title: A Pound a Week
dialogue_line: Well, it won't last forever.

title: A Pound a Week
dialogue_line: No, I figure I'll finish it all by next week.

title: A Pound a Week
dialogue_line: Then you can start losing weight, if there isn't another sale.

title: No More for Me
dialogue_line: I'm stuffed.

title: No More for Me
dialogue_line: Of course you are. You ate everything on the table.

title: No More for Me
dialogue_line: I don't like to eat leftovers.

title: No More for Me
dialogue_line: I'm glad to hear there's something you don't like to eat.

title: No More for Me
dialogue_line: I like my food hot and fresh.

title: No More for Me
dialogue_line: You like to see it disappear.

title: No More for Me
dialogue_line: I don't like it reheated.

title: No More for Me
dialogue_line: Well, you'll have hot fresh food tomorrow night.

title: No More for Me
dialogue_line: I'm so full I'm going to burst.

title: No More for Me
dialogue_line: You should loosen your belt.

title: No More for Me
dialogue_line: I already loosened my belt and unbuttoned my pants.

title: No More for Me
dialogue_line: Well, don't stand up, please.

title: Don't Be Lazy
dialogue_line: I saw what you did.

title: Don't Be Lazy
dialogue_line: I didn't do anything.

title: Don't Be Lazy
dialogue_line: Oh yes, you did.

title: Don't Be Lazy
dialogue_line: What are you talking about?

title: Don't Be Lazy
dialogue_line: You know what I'm talking about.

title: Don't Be Lazy
dialogue_line: I don't have any idea.

title: Don't Be Lazy
dialogue_line: You know what you did.

title: Don't Be Lazy
dialogue_line: Maybe I know, but how could you know?

title: Don't Be Lazy
dialogue_line: Because I was watching you.

title: Don't Be Lazy
dialogue_line: Okay, I'm sorry I did it.

title: Don't Be Lazy
dialogue_line: Don't drink milk out of the carton. Use a glass!

title: Don't Be Lazy
dialogue_line: I promise I'll never drink out of the carton again.

title: I Like That Shirt
dialogue_line: I like that shirt.

title: I Like That Shirt
dialogue_line: So do I.

title: I Like That Shirt
dialogue_line: How much is it?

title: I Like That Shirt
dialogue_line: I don't know. The tag is missing.

title: I Like That Shirt
dialogue_line: Ask the clerk.

title: I Like That Shirt
dialogue_line: I will.

title: I Like That Shirt
dialogue_line: Oh, look. Here's another shirt just like it.

title: I Like That Shirt
dialogue_line: Does it have a price tag?

title: I Like That Shirt
dialogue_line: Yes, it does. It's only $20.

title: I Like That Shirt
dialogue_line: That's a great price.

title: I Like That Shirt
dialogue_line: I think I'll buy both of them.

title: I Like That Shirt
dialogue_line: You'd better try them on first.

title: Pants That Fit
dialogue_line: I bought you a pair of pants.

title: Pants That Fit
dialogue_line: Thank you.

title: Pants That Fit
dialogue_line: I hope they fit.

title: Pants That Fit
dialogue_line: I hope you kept the receipt.

title: Pants That Fit
dialogue_line: You think they won't fit?

title: Pants That Fit
dialogue_line: I think I've put on some weight.

title: Pants That Fit
dialogue_line: You think?

title: Pants That Fit
dialogue_line: Maybe a pound or two.

title: Pants That Fit
dialogue_line: Maybe four or five pounds?

title: Pants That Fit
dialogue_line: My waist is bigger than it was.

title: Pants That Fit
dialogue_line: No problem. These pants have an elastic waistband.

title: Pants That Fit
dialogue_line: You are so smart!

title: The Shopping List
dialogue_line: What do we need to buy?

title: The Shopping List
dialogue_line: Let me look at our list.

title: The Shopping List
dialogue_line: I know that we need milk.

title: The Shopping List
dialogue_line: Nonfat.

title: The Shopping List
dialogue_line: Of course. What else?

title: The Shopping List
dialogue_line: We need cheese, bread, and ham.

title: The Shopping List
dialogue_line: What kind of cheese?

title: The Shopping List
dialogue_line: Swiss.

title: The Shopping List
dialogue_line: Of course, the cheese with holes in it.

title: The Shopping List
dialogue_line: I never used to buy Swiss cheese.

title: The Shopping List
dialogue_line: Why not?

title: The Shopping List
dialogue_line: I didn't want to pay for the holes.

title: Poor Pockets
dialogue_line: I need some pants.

title: Poor Pockets
dialogue_line: I thought you just bought a pair.

title: Poor Pockets
dialogue_line: I did.

title: Poor Pockets
dialogue_line: What's wrong with them so soon?

title: Poor Pockets
dialogue_line: The pants are fine, but the pocket has a huge hole in it.

title: Poor Pockets
dialogue_line: You shouldn't carry your keys and pens in your pocket.

title: Poor Pockets
dialogue_line: But that's what pockets are for.

title: Poor Pockets
dialogue_line: You should carry them in a purse.

title: Poor Pockets
dialogue_line: I'm a man, and men don't carry purses!

title: Poor Pockets
dialogue_line: Well, you should buy pants with stronger pockets.

title: Poor Pockets
dialogue_line: I would if I could find someone who makes strong pockets.

title: Poor Pockets
dialogue_line: Try a Google search online.

title: Wipe Everything
dialogue_line: What are those wipes for?

title: Wipe Everything
dialogue_line: You use them to wipe the handle of the shopping cart.

title: Wipe Everything
dialogue_line: That's a great idea.

title: Wipe Everything
dialogue_line: Yes, all the markets just started offering wipes to shoppers.

title: Wipe Everything
dialogue_line: I'm going to take five wipes.

title: Wipe Everything
dialogue_line: What do you need five of them for?

title: Wipe Everything
dialogue_line: One to wipe the handle, and the others to wipe the produce.

title: Wipe Everything
dialogue_line: What's the matter with the produce?

title: Wipe Everything
dialogue_line: Do you think the bananas fell from the sky?

title: Wipe Everything
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: Wipe Everything
dialogue_line: I mean, someone used their dirty hands to pick the bananas, the apples, and the oranges.

title: Wipe Everything
dialogue_line: Well, you better save a wipe for the dirty dollar bills you're going to pay with.

title: The 99 Cents Store
dialogue_line: Did you go to the 99 Cents store?

title: The 99 Cents Store
dialogue_line: Yes, I did.

title: The 99 Cents Store
dialogue_line: What did you buy?

title: The 99 Cents Store
dialogue_line: Well, I got a lot of good deals, as usual.

title: The 99 Cents Store
dialogue_line: Like what?

title: The 99 Cents Store
dialogue_line: Well, a dozen large eggs were only 99 cents.

title: The 99 Cents Store
dialogue_line: That's a good deal.

title: The 99 Cents Store
dialogue_line: And a one-pound tub of soft butter was the same price.

title: The 99 Cents Store
dialogue_line: Another good deal.

title: The 99 Cents Store
dialogue_line: But the best deal was five pounds of potatoes for 99 cents.

title: The 99 Cents Store
dialogue_line: I don't know how that store makes money.

title: The 99 Cents Store
dialogue_line: Neither do I, but they're doing something right.

title: PC or Mac?
dialogue_line: I need a new computer.

title: PC or Mac?
dialogue_line: What's the matter with yours?

title: PC or Mac?
dialogue_line: It's six years old.

title: PC or Mac?
dialogue_line: That's pretty old.

title: PC or Mac?
dialogue_line: It still works, but I'm going to give it to a charity.

title: PC or Mac?
dialogue_line: Are you going to buy a desktop or laptop?

title: PC or Mac?
dialogue_line: Oh, a laptop, of course.

title: PC or Mac?
dialogue_line: A PC or a Mac?

title: PC or Mac?
dialogue_line: I haven't decided yet.

title: PC or Mac?
dialogue_line: More and more people are using Macs.

title: PC or Mac?
dialogue_line: But 90 percent of the world uses PCs.

title: PC or Mac?
dialogue_line: And that's not going to change anytime soon.

title: Bad Business
dialogue_line: I got ripped off.

title: Bad Business
dialogue_line: What happened?

title: Bad Business
dialogue_line: I had a car problem, so I went online.

title: Bad Business
dialogue_line: Did you find a solution?

title: Bad Business
dialogue_line: Yes, I did. A site I went to said they would send me the solution.

title: Bad Business
dialogue_line: So, what's the problem?

title: Bad Business
dialogue_line: I sent them $20 using my credit card, but they never sent me the solution.

title: Bad Business
dialogue_line: What are you going to do?

title: Bad Business
dialogue_line: I sent them an email asking for my money back.

title: Bad Business
dialogue_line: Have you heard from them?

title: Bad Business
dialogue_line: Not yet. It's been a week.

title: Bad Business
dialogue_line: Well, I guess that's a $20 lesson for you.

title: Sharpen the Pencil
dialogue_line: Where's the pencil sharpener?

title: Sharpen the Pencil
dialogue_line: Which one?

title: Sharpen the Pencil
dialogue_line: Any one. I need to sharpen this pencil.

title: Sharpen the Pencil
dialogue_line: I think there's one on the dining room table.

title: Sharpen the Pencil
dialogue_line: I already looked there.

title: Sharpen the Pencil
dialogue_line: Did you look in the desk drawer?

title: Sharpen the Pencil
dialogue_line: Yes, I looked there, too.

title: Sharpen the Pencil
dialogue_line: Don't we have about five sharpeners?

title: Sharpen the Pencil
dialogue_line: Yes, but they seem to have legs.

title: Sharpen the Pencil
dialogue_line: Tomorrow I'm going to buy an electric sharpener.

title: Sharpen the Pencil
dialogue_line: Get one with the rubber suction cups on the bottom.

title: Sharpen the Pencil
dialogue_line: Yes. That way it will stay where I put it.

title: To Save Money
dialogue_line: I'm trying to stretch my dollars.

title: To Save Money
dialogue_line: How are you doing that?

title: To Save Money
dialogue_line: I started shopping at the dollar store.

title: To Save Money
dialogue_line: That saves a lot of money.

title: To Save Money
dialogue_line: I bought three pounds of potatoes for a dollar.

title: To Save Money
dialogue_line: That's a good deal.

title: To Save Money
dialogue_line: Yes, even though some of the potatoes had eyes.

title: To Save Money
dialogue_line: Just put them in the fridge.

title: To Save Money
dialogue_line: Also, I bought a can of cheap coffee and a bag of good coffee.

title: To Save Money
dialogue_line: Why did you do that?

title: To Save Money
dialogue_line: I mixed them together.

title: To Save Money
dialogue_line: If the coffee still tastes okay, that's a good idea.

title: A New House
dialogue_line: I really like this house.

title: A New House
dialogue_line: Can we afford it?

title: A New House
dialogue_line: They want 20 percent down.

title: A New House
dialogue_line: That's a lot of money.

title: A New House
dialogue_line: But the house is so nice.

title: A New House
dialogue_line: It's in a great neighborhood.

title: A New House
dialogue_line: It's close to the beach.

title: A New House
dialogue_line: It's close to the freeways.

title: A New House
dialogue_line: It's got a big yard.

title: A New House
dialogue_line: The kids love the house, too.

title: A New House
dialogue_line: If we don't buy it, someone else will.

title: A New House
dialogue_line: You're right. Let's buy it now. We can worry later.

title: We Can't Afford This House
dialogue_line: We can't afford this house.

title: We Can't Afford This House
dialogue_line: Are you sure?

title: We Can't Afford This House
dialogue_line: We will be house rich, but cash poor.

title: We Can't Afford This House
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: We Can't Afford This House
dialogue_line: Our monthly payments will be too high.

title: We Can't Afford This House
dialogue_line: We won't have any money for other things?

title: We Can't Afford This House
dialogue_line: No, we won't have money for gas or food.

title: We Can't Afford This House
dialogue_line: We'll be eating peanut butter sandwiches?

title: We Can't Afford This House
dialogue_line: Without the peanut butter!

title: We Can't Afford This House
dialogue_line: That's no good!

title: We Can't Afford This House
dialogue_line: We have to find a cheaper house.

title: We Can't Afford This House
dialogue_line: Of course. We can't live without gas or peanut butter.

title: On the Corner
dialogue_line: That is a beautiful house.

title: On the Corner
dialogue_line: I don't like it.

title: On the Corner
dialogue_line: What's the matter with it?

title: On the Corner
dialogue_line: It's on the corner.

title: On the Corner
dialogue_line: So?

title: On the Corner
dialogue_line: That means it gets twice as much traffic.

title: On the Corner
dialogue_line: You're right.

title: On the Corner
dialogue_line: When you're inside, you will always hear cars stopping and stopping at the intersection.

title: On the Corner
dialogue_line: Or you'll hear the collision if someone doesn't stop.

title: On the Corner
dialogue_line: Or you'll see the collision if they crash into the house.

title: On the Corner
dialogue_line: Let's find a house that's at the end of a dead end.

title: On the Corner
dialogue_line: That's perfect. The less traffic, the better.

title: A Great Apartment
dialogue_line: I hate looking for an apartment.

title: A Great Apartment
dialogue_line: Me, too.

title: A Great Apartment
dialogue_line: We have a 2 o'clock appointment to see the one on Main Street.

title: A Great Apartment
dialogue_line: We'd better get ready to go.

title: A Great Apartment
dialogue_line: It's an upstairs unit.

title: A Great Apartment
dialogue_line: That's good, because I don't want to live under people with loud feet.

title: A Great Apartment
dialogue_line: And it's a corner unit.

title: A Great Apartment
dialogue_line: That's great. We won't have neighbors on both sides of us.

title: A Great Apartment
dialogue_line: No pets are allowed.

title: A Great Apartment
dialogue_line: Perfect. We don't have to listen to barking dogs.

title: A Great Apartment
dialogue_line: And there are only six units in the whole building.

title: A Great Apartment
dialogue_line: Where's the checkbook? I'm ready to rent it without even seeing it.

title: Fix the Doorbell
dialogue_line: Did you call the manager?

title: Fix the Doorbell
dialogue_line: Yes. He said he'd come over tomorrow.

title: Fix the Doorbell
dialogue_line: Did he say what time?

title: Fix the Doorbell
dialogue_line: Yes. He said he'd be here at 9 o'clock.

title: Fix the Doorbell
dialogue_line: Did he understand what the problem is?

title: Fix the Doorbell
dialogue_line: Yes. I told him our doorbell doesn't work.

title: Fix the Doorbell
dialogue_line: It shouldn't take him long to fix it.

title: Fix the Doorbell
dialogue_line: I don't even know why we need to fix it.

title: Fix the Doorbell
dialogue_line: In case we have visitors.

title: Fix the Doorbell
dialogue_line: But they can just knock on the door.

title: Fix the Doorbell
dialogue_line: Actually, I want him to look at our carpet, too.

title: Fix the Doorbell
dialogue_line: Yes, it would be nice if he'd give us a new carpet.

title: Almost Perfect
dialogue_line: Do you like this house?

title: Almost Perfect
dialogue_line: Yes, it's beautiful.

title: Almost Perfect
dialogue_line: It's perfect for us and the kids.

title: Almost Perfect
dialogue_line: Three bedrooms, three bathrooms, and a big back yard.

title: Almost Perfect
dialogue_line: And we can afford it!

title: Almost Perfect
dialogue_line: So are we going to buy it?

title: Almost Perfect
dialogue_line: I'm afraid not.

title: Almost Perfect
dialogue_line: It's too far from your job, isn't it?

title: Almost Perfect
dialogue_line: I can't spend four hours on the road every day.

title: Almost Perfect
dialogue_line: By the time you get home, you'll be too tired to even eat.

title: Almost Perfect
dialogue_line: I won't be able to play with the kids.

title: Almost Perfect
dialogue_line: No, we have to find something closer to your job.

title: Life Was Hard
dialogue_line: Boy, it's chilly outside, isn't it?

title: Life Was Hard
dialogue_line: It sure is.

title: Life Was Hard
dialogue_line: In fact, it's chilly in the apartment, too.

title: Life Was Hard
dialogue_line: Let's turn on the heat.

title: Life Was Hard
dialogue_line: I'll check to make sure that all the windows are shut.

title: Life Was Hard
dialogue_line: It should be warmer in a few minutes.

title: Life Was Hard
dialogue_line: It's so nice to have a heated apartment.

title: Life Was Hard
dialogue_line: How did they survive in the old days?

title: Life Was Hard
dialogue_line: They had fireplaces.

title: Life Was Hard
dialogue_line: Someone had to chop the wood.

title: Life Was Hard
dialogue_line: And carry it into the house.

title: Life Was Hard
dialogue_line: All we have to do is flip a switch.

title: Sell Now
dialogue_line: This is a nice neighborhood.

title: Sell Now
dialogue_line: The streets are clean and quiet.

title: Sell Now
dialogue_line: The neighbors don't party on the weekends.

title: Sell Now
dialogue_line: People take care of their lawns.

title: Sell Now
dialogue_line: No rusty old cars are sitting in the front yards.

title: Sell Now
dialogue_line: We never have to call the police about anything.

title: Sell Now
dialogue_line: Our kids are completely safe.

title: Sell Now
dialogue_line: So why are we selling our house?

title: Sell Now
dialogue_line: They're building a 3-story apartment building on the corner.

title: Sell Now
dialogue_line: So we've got to sell before property values go down?

title: Sell Now
dialogue_line: Yes. I still can't believe our city council allowed this building.

title: Sell Now
dialogue_line: They're probably getting something under the table.

title: Who Cares?
dialogue_line: That was a huge fire in Santa Barbara.

title: Who Cares?
dialogue_line: Yes, it was.

title: Who Cares?
dialogue_line: They said about 30 houses burned to the ground.

title: Who Cares?
dialogue_line: And they were expensive houses.

title: Who Cares?
dialogue_line: I feel so sorry for those people.

title: Who Cares?
dialogue_line: Why feel sorry for rich people?

title: Who Cares?
dialogue_line: I feel sorry for anyone who loses their home.

title: Who Cares?
dialogue_line: So do I, but not if they're rich.

title: Who Cares?
dialogue_line: What does that have to do with it?

title: Who Cares?
dialogue_line: Rich people think they're better than us.

title: Who Cares?
dialogue_line: How many rich people do you know?

title: Who Cares?
dialogue_line: None.

title: Hungry Bears
dialogue_line: Bears are invading our neighborhoods.

title: Hungry Bears
dialogue_line: Of course they are. They're starving to death.

title: Hungry Bears
dialogue_line: They should stay in the woods where they belong.

title: Hungry Bears
dialogue_line: There's no food in the woods.

title: Hungry Bears
dialogue_line: Can't they eat grass?

title: Hungry Bears
dialogue_line: Do you think a bear is a cow?

title: Hungry Bears
dialogue_line: Well, I've seen them eating berries.

title: Hungry Bears
dialogue_line: Berries aren't in season all year round.

title: Hungry Bears
dialogue_line: It's too dangerous for kids and pets.

title: Hungry Bears
dialogue_line: People need to cover their trash cans.

title: Hungry Bears
dialogue_line: The police need to shoot all the bears.

title: Hungry Bears
dialogue_line: You don't solve a problem by shooting it.

title: Yes, We Can
dialogue_line: Who did you vote for?

title: Yes, We Can
dialogue_line: I voted for Obama.

title: Yes, We Can
dialogue_line: Me too.

title: Yes, We Can
dialogue_line: He will be a great president.

title: Yes, We Can
dialogue_line: Everyone likes him.

title: Yes, We Can
dialogue_line: He's a good speaker.

title: Yes, We Can
dialogue_line: And he's really smart.

title: Yes, We Can
dialogue_line: He will solve our problems.

title: Yes, We Can
dialogue_line: He will end the war.

title: Yes, We Can
dialogue_line: The next four years will be good years.

title: Yes, We Can
dialogue_line: I'll vote for him next time, too.

title: Yes, We Can
dialogue_line: I think everyone will.

title: Don't Vote for Him
dialogue_line: The election is next week.

title: Don't Vote for Him
dialogue_line: Who are you voting for?

title: Don't Vote for Him
dialogue_line: I'm not voting for the mayor.

title: Don't Vote for Him
dialogue_line: Why not?

title: Don't Vote for Him
dialogue_line: He made promises that he didn't keep.

title: Don't Vote for Him
dialogue_line: Like what?

title: Don't Vote for Him
dialogue_line: He promised to hire 1,000 more police officers.

title: Don't Vote for Him
dialogue_line: How many did he hire?

title: Don't Vote for Him
dialogue_line: One hundred!

title: Don't Vote for Him
dialogue_line: Maybe he had a good reason.

title: Don't Vote for Him
dialogue_line: Maybe he's just a liar.

title: Don't Vote for Him
dialogue_line: Maybe I'll vote for someone else, too.

title: He Got Reelected
dialogue_line: I can't believe he won the election.

title: He Got Reelected
dialogue_line: Only 15 percent of the voters turned out.

title: He Got Reelected
dialogue_line: That is a joke.

title: He Got Reelected
dialogue_line: Voting is so important, but people don't bother.

title: He Got Reelected
dialogue_line: Many people think their vote doesn't matter.

title: He Got Reelected
dialogue_line: The mayor won by only 2,000 votes.

title: He Got Reelected
dialogue_line: We're stuck with him for four more years.

title: He Got Reelected
dialogue_line: Voting is so easy. You can even mail your ballot in.

title: He Got Reelected
dialogue_line: All you have to do is vote and put a stamp on it.

title: He Got Reelected
dialogue_line: How easy is that?

title: He Got Reelected
dialogue_line: I guess people just don't care.

title: He Got Reelected
dialogue_line: They'll care when they see their taxes go up.

title: Change Is Good
dialogue_line: Well, we have a new president.

title: Change Is Good
dialogue_line: But we have the same old problems.

title: Change Is Good
dialogue_line: Well, he's made a few changes.

title: Change Is Good
dialogue_line: Like what?

title: Change Is Good
dialogue_line: I think he closed the bowling alley in the White House.

title: Change Is Good
dialogue_line: Oh, yeah. He's changing it to a basketball court.

title: Change Is Good
dialogue_line: Who's paying for that?

title: Change Is Good
dialogue_line: I think we are!

title: Change Is Good
dialogue_line: Well, that's okay, as long as it helps him relax and think more clearly.

title: Change Is Good
dialogue_line: Yes, we need a relaxed president who thinks clearly.

title: Change Is Good
dialogue_line: Do any other world leaders have a basketball court?

title: Change Is Good
dialogue_line: They will. You know America always leads the way.

title: A Powerful Position
dialogue_line: People say that everybody loves Obama.

title: A Powerful Position
dialogue_line: Well, more than 50 million people voted for McCain.

title: A Powerful Position
dialogue_line: That's 50 million people who don't love Obama.

title: A Powerful Position
dialogue_line: Obama's got four years to make everyone happy.

title: A Powerful Position
dialogue_line: He's never going to make everyone happy.

title: A Powerful Position
dialogue_line: Can you imagine being President?

title: A Powerful Position
dialogue_line: Everyone wants you to solve their problems.

title: A Powerful Position
dialogue_line: I have enough stress from trying to solve my own problems.

title: A Powerful Position
dialogue_line: You and everybody else.

title: A Powerful Position
dialogue_line: I would never want to be President.

title: A Powerful Position
dialogue_line: But think about all the power you'd have.

title: A Powerful Position
dialogue_line: I prefer my quiet little life to all the power in the world.

title: A Traveling Man
dialogue_line: Did you read this article?

title: A Traveling Man
dialogue_line: What article?

title: A Traveling Man
dialogue_line: It says the mayor spends only 11 percent of his time on city duties.

title: A Traveling Man
dialogue_line: Only 11 percent?

title: A Traveling Man
dialogue_line: About 50 percent of the time he's traveling.

title: A Traveling Man
dialogue_line: Where does he travel to?

title: A Traveling Man
dialogue_line: Oh, all over the world.

title: A Traveling Man
dialogue_line: But he's supposed to be making our city a better place.

title: A Traveling Man
dialogue_line: He's visiting other cities to get ideas.

title: A Traveling Man
dialogue_line: Can't he just go online?

title: A Traveling Man
dialogue_line: The rest of the time he's raising money for his reelection.

title: A Traveling Man
dialogue_line: Well, he'll never get reelected once this news gets out.

title: Vote for Ralph
dialogue_line: Who did you vote for for president?

title: Vote for Ralph
dialogue_line: I voted for Ralph Nader.

title: Vote for Ralph
dialogue_line: Who in the world is Ralph Nader?

title: Vote for Ralph
dialogue_line: He's the best man for president.

title: Vote for Ralph
dialogue_line: Why's that?

title: Vote for Ralph
dialogue_line: He hates corporations.

title: Vote for Ralph
dialogue_line: Well, most corporations do think only about money.

title: Vote for Ralph
dialogue_line: He hates Democrats and Republicans.

title: Vote for Ralph
dialogue_line: Well, they do put their party before their country.

title: Vote for Ralph
dialogue_line: He's the only candidate that I trust.

title: Vote for Ralph
dialogue_line: But he didn't have a chance. Nobody voted for him!

title: Vote for Ralph
dialogue_line: Sooner or later, voters will wake up.

title: Why Vote?
dialogue_line: I don't know why I bother to vote.

title: Why Vote?
dialogue_line: Why's that?

title: Why Vote?
dialogue_line: What good does it do?

title: Why Vote?
dialogue_line: You get to put someone in power that you like.

title: Why Vote?
dialogue_line: Only if my candidate wins.

title: Why Vote?
dialogue_line: Well, he can't win unless you and others vote for him.

title: Why Vote?
dialogue_line: But even if my candidate wins, he'll break his promises.

title: Why Vote?
dialogue_line: That's true. They promise anything just so they get elected.

title: Why Vote?
dialogue_line: And when elected, they go their own way.

title: Why Vote?
dialogue_line: They forget who put them in power.

title: Why Vote?
dialogue_line: They forget where they came from.

title: Why Vote?
dialogue_line: Maybe you should run for office.

title: Every Vote Counts
dialogue_line: That election for U.S. Senator stunk.

title: Every Vote Counts
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: Every Vote Counts
dialogue_line: There were more votes than voters!

title: Every Vote Counts
dialogue_line: But that's impossible.

title: Every Vote Counts
dialogue_line: Officials said that it's possible.

title: Every Vote Counts
dialogue_line: Did they explain how it's possible?

title: Every Vote Counts
dialogue_line: No. They said there are some things you can't explain.

title: Every Vote Counts
dialogue_line: So are they going to hold another election?

title: Every Vote Counts
dialogue_line: No. That will cost too much money.

title: Every Vote Counts
dialogue_line: So it's better to save money than to have an honest election?

title: Every Vote Counts
dialogue_line: Well, the Democratic Party says it was an honest election.

title: Every Vote Counts
dialogue_line: Of course they say thatÂ—their man won!

title: George Tells Jokes
dialogue_line: I see that former President Bush is at a conference.

title: George Tells Jokes
dialogue_line: Yes. He's telling jokes about his eight years as president.

title: George Tells Jokes
dialogue_line: Yes, those eight years were a lot of fun for everyone.

title: George Tells Jokes
dialogue_line: Only 4,000 American soldiers were killed overseas.

title: George Tells Jokes
dialogue_line: Not to mention 40,000 wounded soldiers.

title: George Tells Jokes
dialogue_line: But Bush visited some of them in the hospital once.

title: George Tells Jokes
dialogue_line: That's nice that he found the time to make a visit.

title: George Tells Jokes
dialogue_line: He spoke to them and made them feel better.

title: George Tells Jokes
dialogue_line: Did he speak to every family that lost a soldier?

title: George Tells Jokes
dialogue_line: No, he didn't have time to do that.

title: George Tells Jokes
dialogue_line: Well, he's got plenty of time now!

title: George Tells Jokes
dialogue_line: No, he's too busy writing a book about how hard it was to be president.

title: Give Them More
dialogue_line: Did you get your Official Sample Ballot?

title: Give Them More
dialogue_line: Yes, with the Voter Instructions.

title: Give Them More
dialogue_line: How are you going to vote?

title: Give Them More
dialogue_line: Same as ever, by mail. All it costs me is a 42-cent stamp.

title: Give Them More
dialogue_line: I meant, are you going to vote for or against the new taxes?

title: Give Them More
dialogue_line: Against all of them, of course.

title: Give Them More
dialogue_line: But we need new taxes to pay for highways, schools, and prisons.

title: Give Them More
dialogue_line: We've already voted for new taxes to pay for all that stuff!

title: Give Them More
dialogue_line: That's true. Where did that money go?

title: Give Them More
dialogue_line: Our legislators spent it on first-class travel all over the world.

title: Give Them More
dialogue_line: They are having a good time with our money.

title: Give Them More
dialogue_line: So when are we going to stop giving them more?

title: They're Lying
dialogue_line: Have you decided how you are going to vote?

title: They're Lying
dialogue_line: Do you mean on Measures 1, 2, and 3?

title: They're Lying
dialogue_line: Yes. The ones that will improve our schools, roads, and hospitals.

title: They're Lying
dialogue_line: You mean the measures that will raise our taxes.

title: They're Lying
dialogue_line: But the TV ads say that our taxes will not increase.

title: They're Lying
dialogue_line: Do you believe the TV ads?

title: They're Lying
dialogue_line: I like the one where the fireman tells us why we should vote Yes.

title: They're Lying
dialogue_line: Don't believe him! Whatever the TV ads tell you, the opposite is true.

title: They're Lying
dialogue_line: But the title of Measure 1 is "Better Schools at No Cost."

title: They're Lying
dialogue_line: The title should be "Better Schools at Huge Cost."

title: They're Lying
dialogue_line: I can't believe that they would lie to us.

title: They're Lying
dialogue_line: Of course they lieÂ—that's what politicians do!

title: A Stomachache
dialogue_line: I have a stomachache.

title: A Stomachache
dialogue_line: Is it something you ate?

title: A Stomachache
dialogue_line: Maybe. I'm not sure.

title: A Stomachache
dialogue_line: What did you have for breakfast?

title: A Stomachache
dialogue_line: The usual, cereal with milk and a banana.

title: A Stomachache
dialogue_line: Maybe the milk was bad.

title: A Stomachache
dialogue_line: It didn't smell bad.

title: A Stomachache
dialogue_line: Maybe the banana was bad.

title: A Stomachache
dialogue_line: No, the banana was delicious.

title: A Stomachache
dialogue_line: Maybe you just need to go to the bathroom.

title: A Stomachache
dialogue_line: No, that's not the problem.

title: A Stomachache
dialogue_line: Maybe it will go away in a little while.

title: A Blood Stain
dialogue_line: What's this stain?

title: A Blood Stain
dialogue_line: I don't know.

title: A Blood Stain
dialogue_line: It looks like blood.

title: A Blood Stain
dialogue_line: I think my nose was bleeding.

title: A Blood Stain
dialogue_line: You should wet your shirt immediately.

title: A Blood Stain
dialogue_line: Why?

title: A Blood Stain
dialogue_line: Because that gets the blood out of the shirt.

title: A Blood Stain
dialogue_line: What's a little blood?

title: A Blood Stain
dialogue_line: Your white shirt is ruined.

title: A Blood Stain
dialogue_line: So, I'll just buy another one.

title: A Blood Stain
dialogue_line: You can wear this one around the house.

title: A Blood Stain
dialogue_line: Next time I'll soak it immediately.

title: Sore Fingers
dialogue_line: My fingers hurt.

title: Sore Fingers
dialogue_line: Why do they hurt?

title: Sore Fingers
dialogue_line: I type too much.

title: Sore Fingers
dialogue_line: You should take a break.

title: Sore Fingers
dialogue_line: I need to type to make money.

title: Sore Fingers
dialogue_line: But typing is causing you pain.

title: Sore Fingers
dialogue_line: Maybe I should see a doctor.

title: Sore Fingers
dialogue_line: Doctors are too expensive.

title: Sore Fingers
dialogue_line: He might tell me to rest for a while.

title: Sore Fingers
dialogue_line: He might want to cut you open.

title: Sore Fingers
dialogue_line: He might say I'm okay.

title: Sore Fingers
dialogue_line: He might say you have bone cancer.

title: Too Much Stress
dialogue_line: What did the doctor say?

title: Too Much Stress
dialogue_line: He thinks I have too much stress.

title: Too Much Stress
dialogue_line: Stress causes your stomachaches?

title: Too Much Stress
dialogue_line: Stress causes different problems with different people.

title: Too Much Stress
dialogue_line: So what did he tell you to do?

title: Too Much Stress
dialogue_line: He said I need to think positive.

title: Too Much Stress
dialogue_line: He didn't give you any medication?

title: Too Much Stress
dialogue_line: I hate medication. It makes me feel different.

title: Too Much Stress
dialogue_line: So how do you think positive?

title: Too Much Stress
dialogue_line: I think about nice things.

title: Too Much Stress
dialogue_line: Like what?

title: Too Much Stress
dialogue_line: Like a day at the beach, with my toes in the sand.

title: A Paper Cut
dialogue_line: I cut my finger.

title: A Paper Cut
dialogue_line: How did you do that?

title: A Paper Cut
dialogue_line: It's a paper cut.

title: A Paper Cut
dialogue_line: Paper can be dangerous.

title: A Paper Cut
dialogue_line: It hurts, too.

title: A Paper Cut
dialogue_line: Paper cuts can hurt a lot.

title: A Paper Cut
dialogue_line: Where are the band-aids?

title: A Paper Cut
dialogue_line: I think they're in the medicine cabinet.

title: A Paper Cut
dialogue_line: It's on the tip of my finger.

title: A Paper Cut
dialogue_line: A band-aid might not work.

title: A Paper Cut
dialogue_line: I must not use this finger until the cut heals.

title: A Paper Cut
dialogue_line: It might take a day or two to heal.

title: Cigarette Smoke
dialogue_line: Do you smell that?

title: Cigarette Smoke
dialogue_line: Oh, yes.

title: Cigarette Smoke
dialogue_line: I can't stand cigarette smoke.

title: Cigarette Smoke
dialogue_line: It smells so bad.

title: Cigarette Smoke
dialogue_line: One cigarette stinks up the whole sidewalk.

title: Cigarette Smoke
dialogue_line: Smokers think they are so cool.

title: Cigarette Smoke
dialogue_line: They are so weak.

title: Cigarette Smoke
dialogue_line: A little cigarette controls them.

title: Cigarette Smoke
dialogue_line: They look so stupid taking a puff.

title: Cigarette Smoke
dialogue_line: And then they blow smoke out of their mouth.

title: Cigarette Smoke
dialogue_line: They think it's cool.

title: Cigarette Smoke
dialogue_line: Cigarettes stink.

title: Nose Drops
dialogue_line: Do you have a cold?

title: Nose Drops
dialogue_line: Yes, I do.

title: Nose Drops
dialogue_line: How did you get it?

title: Nose Drops
dialogue_line: My sister had a cold. She gave it to me.

title: Nose Drops
dialogue_line: Have you taken anything for your cold?

title: Nose Drops
dialogue_line: No, I just blow my nose a lot.

title: Nose Drops
dialogue_line: Your nose is stopped up?

title: Nose Drops
dialogue_line: Yes. I have to breathe through my mouth.

title: Nose Drops
dialogue_line: Have you tried nose drops?

title: Nose Drops
dialogue_line: No, I don't like nose drops.

title: Nose Drops
dialogue_line: They work great.

title: Nose Drops
dialogue_line: I don't care. I don't like to put drops in my nose.

title: Skin Cancer
dialogue_line: Would you put suntan lotion on my back, please?

title: Skin Cancer
dialogue_line: Sure.

title: Skin Cancer
dialogue_line: Thank you.

title: Skin Cancer
dialogue_line: You shouldn't lie in the sun for too long.

title: Skin Cancer
dialogue_line: I want to get a tan. I don't want to look so pale.

title: Skin Cancer
dialogue_line: What's wrong with looking pale?

title: Skin Cancer
dialogue_line: People think you might be sick.

title: Skin Cancer
dialogue_line: Who thinks that?

title: Skin Cancer
dialogue_line: I don't know.

title: Skin Cancer
dialogue_line: It's better to be pale than to have skin cancer.

title: Skin Cancer
dialogue_line: I know that.

title: Skin Cancer
dialogue_line: So why are you arguing with me? Don't lie in the sun too long!

title: Quitting Smoking
dialogue_line: I can't quit smoking.

title: Quitting Smoking
dialogue_line: Of course you can.

title: Quitting Smoking
dialogue_line: I don't have enough will power.

title: Quitting Smoking
dialogue_line: Of course you do.

title: Quitting Smoking
dialogue_line: I wish I had never started.

title: Quitting Smoking
dialogue_line: So does every smoker.

title: Quitting Smoking
dialogue_line: I've tried to quit so many times.

title: Quitting Smoking
dialogue_line: So has everyone else.

title: Quitting Smoking
dialogue_line: Nothing seems to work.

title: Quitting Smoking
dialogue_line: All it takes is will power, and you have it.

title: Quitting Smoking
dialogue_line: Then why can't I quit?

title: Quitting Smoking
dialogue_line: You have to believe in yourself.

title: A Bad Back
dialogue_line: My back is killing me.

title: A Bad Back
dialogue_line: What did you do?

title: A Bad Back
dialogue_line: I got out of my car.

title: A Bad Back
dialogue_line: That's it?

title: A Bad Back
dialogue_line: I injured my back one time just by sneezing.

title: A Bad Back
dialogue_line: You should see a doctor.

title: A Bad Back
dialogue_line: My doctor said I need surgery.

title: A Bad Back
dialogue_line: So?

title: A Bad Back
dialogue_line: So, forget it.

title: A Bad Back
dialogue_line: You don't have the money?

title: A Bad Back
dialogue_line: I have no insurance.

title: A Bad Back
dialogue_line: Maybe a back rub would help.

title: Three a Day
dialogue_line: My brother smokes three packs a day.

title: Three a Day
dialogue_line: Three packs of what?

title: Three a Day
dialogue_line: Cigarettes, of course.

title: Three a Day
dialogue_line: How can he do that?

title: Three a Day
dialogue_line: When he is almost finished with one cigarette, he uses it to light another.

title: Three a Day
dialogue_line: He's a chain smoker.

title: Three a Day
dialogue_line: He's been a chain smoker for 30 years.

title: Three a Day
dialogue_line: That's unbelievable. Can he still breathe?

title: Three a Day
dialogue_line: He can, but the people around him can't.

title: Three a Day
dialogue_line: How can he still be alive?

title: Three a Day
dialogue_line: His doctor says his heart and lungs are strong and healthy.

title: Three a Day
dialogue_line: Maybe I should start smoking.

title: Brush, Brush
dialogue_line: I hate brushing my teeth.

title: Brush, Brush
dialogue_line: It's such a chore.

title: Brush, Brush
dialogue_line: Brush, brush. Spit, spit.

title: Brush, Brush
dialogue_line: What did they do in the old days?

title: Brush, Brush
dialogue_line: They brushed with their fingers.

title: Brush, Brush
dialogue_line: They also ate with their fingers!

title: Brush, Brush
dialogue_line: Why do they call it the good old days?

title: Brush, Brush
dialogue_line: Maybe because they didn't have to brush and floss.

title: Brush, Brush
dialogue_line: Who invented flossing?

title: Brush, Brush
dialogue_line: A dentist, I'm sure.

title: Brush, Brush
dialogue_line: I hate flossing more than brushing!

title: Brush, Brush
dialogue_line: I can't wait till all my teeth fall out.

title: A Hot Hike
dialogue_line: Let's stop for a while. I need a break and some water.

title: A Hot Hike
dialogue_line: This trail is hard to climb.

title: A Hot Hike
dialogue_line: Especially on a hot day like this.

title: A Hot Hike
dialogue_line: I can't believe we haven't seen any animals.

title: A Hot Hike
dialogue_line: Thank goodness! I don't want to see any wild animals.

title: A Hot Hike
dialogue_line: All we've seen so far is a couple of lizards.

title: A Hot Hike
dialogue_line: We're hiking to lose weight, not to see goats and bears.

title: A Hot Hike
dialogue_line: I bet I've lost a couple of pounds already.

title: A Hot Hike
dialogue_line: All you've lost is some sweat.

title: A Hot Hike
dialogue_line: I haven't even lost one pound of fat?

title: A Hot Hike
dialogue_line: If you want to lose fat, you've got to do this hike every day.

title: A Hot Hike
dialogue_line: Okay, but let's hike in town. At least there are cats and dogs to see.

title: Another Pimple
dialogue_line: Oh no, another pimple on my face.

title: Another Pimple
dialogue_line: Pimples suck.

title: Another Pimple
dialogue_line: It seems like I get a new pimple almost every day.

title: Another Pimple
dialogue_line: Maybe it's something in your diet.

title: Another Pimple
dialogue_line: No, I eat the same things day after day.

title: Another Pimple
dialogue_line: Then maybe it's in your genes.

title: Another Pimple
dialogue_line: You might be right.

title: Another Pimple
dialogue_line: Do pimples run in your family?

title: Another Pimple
dialogue_line: Not that I've noticed.

title: Another Pimple
dialogue_line: Well, maybe it's from the pollution in the air.

title: Another Pimple
dialogue_line: Whatever the cause, I hate seeing them on my face.

title: Another Pimple
dialogue_line: Well, on the bright side, they're fun to pop.

title: No Need to Worry
dialogue_line: Do you believe everything you hear?

title: No Need to Worry
dialogue_line: I don't believe anything I don't see with my own eyes.

title: No Need to Worry
dialogue_line: You can't believe what you hear on TV or radio.

title: No Need to Worry
dialogue_line: You can't believe what you read in the newspapers.

title: No Need to Worry
dialogue_line: Everyone tells you a different story about the same thing.

title: No Need to Worry
dialogue_line: Three different people will give you three different stories.

title: No Need to Worry
dialogue_line: And the government will give you a fourth story.

title: No Need to Worry
dialogue_line: Yes, like the government says not to worry about the swine flu.

title: No Need to Worry
dialogue_line: But the swine flu just killed 20 people in Mexico.

title: No Need to Worry
dialogue_line: The government says we have nothing to worry about.

title: No Need to Worry
dialogue_line: Then why are some schools telling the kids to stay home?

title: No Need to Worry
dialogue_line: The government says to wash our hands frequently, and we'll all be okay.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: Don't pick your nose.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: I wasn't picking my nose.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: What were you doing?

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: I was scratching my nose.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: I think I know the difference between picking and scratching.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: Okay, mom, maybe I was picking it a little bit.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: Use a tissue next time.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: I didn't have a tissue.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: Then wait till you find a tissue.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: I couldn't wait. It was an emergency.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: Oh, really? Maybe you should have called 911.

title: Use a Tissue
dialogue_line: It wasn't that kind of emergency.

title: A Dirty Remote
dialogue_line: Our TV remote is filthy.

title: A Dirty Remote
dialogue_line: Yes, it's covered with crud.

title: A Dirty Remote
dialogue_line: I'm going to clean it.

title: A Dirty Remote
dialogue_line: Don't use water on it!

title: A Dirty Remote
dialogue_line: I'll use a damp cloth.

title: A Dirty Remote
dialogue_line: Don't let water get into any of the cracks.

title: A Dirty Remote
dialogue_line: I'll squeeze the cloth so it's almost dry.

title: A Dirty Remote
dialogue_line: Don't rub the numbers off the remote.

title: A Dirty Remote
dialogue_line: I will rub gently but firmly.

title: A Dirty Remote
dialogue_line: Do it quickly, please, so I can change channels during commercials.

title: A Dirty Remote
dialogue_line: I'll give it back to you in a couple of minutes.

title: A Dirty Remote
dialogue_line: Maybe we should put it in a plastic bag to keep it clean.

title: An Earful of Pain
dialogue_line: My ear is killing me.

title: An Earful of Pain
dialogue_line: What's the matter?

title: An Earful of Pain
dialogue_line: I was on a plane.

title: An Earful of Pain
dialogue_line: So?

title: An Earful of Pain
dialogue_line: So, every time the plane goes up, my ear starts to hurt.

title: An Earful of Pain
dialogue_line: That's no good.

title: An Earful of Pain
dialogue_line: Sometimes the pain goes away, and sometimes it doesn't.

title: An Earful of Pain
dialogue_line: Have you seen a doctor?

title: An Earful of Pain
dialogue_line: I've been to two doctors.

title: An Earful of Pain
dialogue_line: And they couldn't fix your problem?

title: An Earful of Pain
dialogue_line: They both said I have to live with it.

title: An Earful of Pain
dialogue_line: Or you can stay off planes.

title: A New Face
dialogue_line: Did you see the woman with the new face?

title: A New Face
dialogue_line: Did she get a nice job?

title: A New Face
dialogue_line: She got an "everything" job!

title: A New Face
dialogue_line: What do you mean?

title: A New Face
dialogue_line: A team of doctors gave her a whole new face.

title: A New Face
dialogue_line: Why did they do that?

title: A New Face
dialogue_line: A mad dog bit most of her face off.

title: A New Face
dialogue_line: Oh, that's terrible. What does she look like now?

title: A New Face
dialogue_line: Her face is really fat, but they say the swelling will go down.

title: A New Face
dialogue_line: And then will she look normal again?

title: A New Face
dialogue_line: I guess so.

title: A New Face
dialogue_line: God bless modern medicine.

title: A Sore Hand
dialogue_line: There's something wrong with my right hand.

title: A Sore Hand
dialogue_line: What's wrong with it?

title: A Sore Hand
dialogue_line: It aches most of the time.

title: A Sore Hand
dialogue_line: What do you think it is?

title: A Sore Hand
dialogue_line: I don't know. I think it's old age.

title: A Sore Hand
dialogue_line: If it's old age, why don't both of your hands hurt?

title: A Sore Hand
dialogue_line: That's a good question. Maybe it's not old age.

title: A Sore Hand
dialogue_line: Are you right-handed?

title: A Sore Hand
dialogue_line: Yes. All my life.

title: A Sore Hand
dialogue_line: You're wearing out your right hand. Stop using it so much.

title: A Sore Hand
dialogue_line: But I do all my writing with my right hand.

title: A Sore Hand
dialogue_line: Start typing instead. That way your left hand will do half the work.

title: Calling Credit Card Company
dialogue_line: Hi, I would like to know my credit balance.

title: Calling Credit Card Company
dialogue_line: Of course. May I have your credit card number?

title: Calling Credit Card Company
dialogue_line: Yes, it's 512879346. My name is John.

title: Calling Credit Card Company
dialogue_line: Alright, John. You currently have no dues on your credit card.

title: Calling Credit Card Company
dialogue_line: Really? I finally paid it off?

title: Calling Credit Card Company
dialogue_line: Yes, sir. Your balance is officially zero.

title: Calling Credit Card Company
dialogue_line: I must admit I am proud of myself!

title: Calling Credit Card Company
dialogue_line: Is there anything else you'd like me to check, sir?

title: Calling Credit Card Company
dialogue_line: Yes, can you change my card status from a college to normal account?

title: Calling Credit Card Company
dialogue_line: Of course, but you'll have to come to the bank to do that.

title: Calling Credit Card Company
dialogue_line: Alright, I'll be down first thing tomorrow.

title: Calling Credit Card Company
