dialogue_line: Sounds good, sir. Have a good day.

title: Disputing a Charge
dialogue_line: Hello, is this the Smith residence?

title: Disputing a Charge
dialogue_line: Yes it is, may I ask who is calling?

title: Disputing a Charge
dialogue_line: This is your bank calling in regards to an overcharge on your credit card.

title: Disputing a Charge
dialogue_line: I'm sorry, there must be some mistake.

title: Disputing a Charge
dialogue_line: It says here that you charged over $500 on it yesterday.

title: Disputing a Charge
dialogue_line: That can't be right; I have not used it in months!

title: Disputing a Charge
dialogue_line: Are you saying you did not make that charge?

title: Disputing a Charge
dialogue_line: That's exactly what I am saying.

title: Disputing a Charge
dialogue_line: Looking closer, this charge was made in a different city.

title: Disputing a Charge
dialogue_line: I am looking for my card now and I cannot find it.

title: Disputing a Charge
dialogue_line: This calls for further investigation.

title: Disputing a Charge
dialogue_line: I assure you I did not make the purchase.

title: Ordering Services
dialogue_line: I'm interested in signing up for your cable service.

title: Ordering Services
dialogue_line: Alright, please choose the package you'd like.

title: Ordering Services
dialogue_line: Does this package get me all the movie channels?

title: Ordering Services
dialogue_line: I'm afraid not. This is the basic package.

title: Ordering Services
dialogue_line: How much is it for the movie channels?

title: Ordering Services
dialogue_line: That package is an extra $20 a month.

title: Ordering Services
dialogue_line: That's going to cost me an arm and a leg!

title: Ordering Services
dialogue_line: You'll also get the premium sports channels.

title: Ordering Services
dialogue_line: Well, that does sound tempting.

title: Ordering Services
dialogue_line: If you sign up for our email updates, I'll give you a discount.

title: Ordering Services
dialogue_line: Alright, I'll take the premium package.

title: Ordering Services
dialogue_line: You've made a wonderful choice.

title: Making Inquiries
dialogue_line: Hello, how may I help you today?

title: Making Inquiries
dialogue_line: Hi. I would like to increase my Internet data.

title: Making Inquiries
dialogue_line: I'll be glad to help you with that. What's your account number?

title: Making Inquiries
dialogue_line: I don't have my account number with me, but my phone number is 310-865-9274.

title: Making Inquiries
dialogue_line: Alright. I see you use our mobile service.

title: Making Inquiries
dialogue_line: Yes. I also have a landline.

title: Making Inquiries
dialogue_line: According to my file, you are eligible for an upgrade to our new service.

title: Making Inquiries
dialogue_line: What does this new service include?

title: Making Inquiries
dialogue_line: It makes the Internet connection twice as fast.

title: Making Inquiries
dialogue_line: That sounds perfect! Is there a price increase?

title: Making Inquiries
dialogue_line: Yes, that will be $5 more per month.

title: Making Inquiries
dialogue_line: Sign me up right away!

title: Reporting a Service Problem
dialogue_line: Hello, please connect me to Tech Support.

title: Reporting a Service Problem
dialogue_line: This is Tech Support, how may I help you?

title: Reporting a Service Problem
dialogue_line: I am having problems with my Internet service.

title: Reporting a Service Problem
dialogue_line: What seems to be the problem?

title: Reporting a Service Problem
dialogue_line: None of my wireless devices are connecting to the Wi-Fi.

title: Reporting a Service Problem
dialogue_line: I see. Have you tried disconnecting and reconnecting the modem?

title: Reporting a Service Problem
dialogue_line: No, how do I do that?

title: Reporting a Service Problem
dialogue_line: Simply unplug the modem for fifteen seconds.

title: Reporting a Service Problem
dialogue_line: Alright. I plugged it in again.

title: Reporting a Service Problem
dialogue_line: Are all of the lights back on the modem?

title: Reporting a Service Problem
dialogue_line: Yes, they're all green!

title: Reporting a Service Problem
dialogue_line: Your devices should be able to connect easily now.

title: Reporting a Service Problem
dialogue_line: Oh, they're working perfectly! Thank you!

title: Asking for Credit
dialogue_line: Hello, is this the Smith residence?

title: Asking for Credit
dialogue_line: Hello, how can I help you today?

title: Asking for Credit
dialogue_line: I am very upset with the quality of your service.

title: Asking for Credit
dialogue_line: I'm sorry, what seems to be the problem?

title: Asking for Credit
dialogue_line: My Internet service did not work for three days.

title: Asking for Credit
dialogue_line: My records say a technician visited your area yesterday?

title: Asking for Credit
dialogue_line: Yes, he installed a new modem.

title: Asking for Credit
dialogue_line: Did it solve the problem?

title: Asking for Credit
dialogue_line: Yes, but I was overcharged for Internet service.

title: Asking for Credit
dialogue_line: Sorry about that. I'll give you credit for the three days.

title: Asking for Credit
dialogue_line: I was sold a wireless service unavailable in my area.

title: Asking for Credit
dialogue_line: I see it here; we charged you $5 extra a month.

title: Asking for Credit
dialogue_line: Yes. Kindly return my money, please.

title: Troubleshooting a Computer Problem
dialogue_line: How may I help you?

title: Troubleshooting a Computer Problem
dialogue_line: My computer is not letting me run JavaScript.

title: Troubleshooting a Computer Problem
dialogue_line: That can easily be fixed.

title: Troubleshooting a Computer Problem
dialogue_line: I've tried fixing it myself, but nothing worked.

title: Troubleshooting a Computer Problem
dialogue_line: If you'd kindly go to our website, I'll fix the problem.

title: Troubleshooting a Computer Problem
dialogue_line: I've logged in, now what?

title: Troubleshooting a Computer Problem
dialogue_line: I will now access your computer from my location.

title: Troubleshooting a Computer Problem
dialogue_line: Oh, I see what you are doing.

title: Troubleshooting a Computer Problem
dialogue_line: That should just about fix the problem!

title: Troubleshooting a Computer Problem
dialogue_line: Thank you so much! It was such an easy solution.

title: Troubleshooting a Computer Problem
dialogue_line: I'm happy to help.

title: Troubleshooting a Computer Problem
dialogue_line: Again, thank you and have a good day!

title: Making an Appointment
dialogue_line: Hello? I'd like to schedule an appointment.

title: Making an Appointment
dialogue_line: Hello! What time would you like to come in?

title: Making an Appointment
dialogue_line: Well, I only like Jane cutting my hair.

title: Making an Appointment
dialogue_line: Jane comes in to work at 3 p.m. today.

title: Making an Appointment
dialogue_line: That sounds perfect! Sign me up.

title: Making an Appointment
dialogue_line: You'll be coming in for a haircut, yes?

title: Making an Appointment
dialogue_line: I'd also like to redo my highlights.

title: Making an Appointment
dialogue_line: That will be no problem. Can I have your name?

title: Making an Appointment
dialogue_line: My name is Sarah.

title: Making an Appointment
dialogue_line: Alright, Sarah, we'll be expecting you!

title: Making an Appointment
dialogue_line: Alright, thank you!

title: Making an Appointment
dialogue_line: See you soon!

title: Making Requests
dialogue_line: Can you cut my hair a little differently this time?

title: Making Requests
dialogue_line: Sure! How would you like it cut?

title: Making Requests
dialogue_line: Well, last time it was a little too long.

title: Making Requests
dialogue_line: I see what you mean. How about a bob cut?

title: Making Requests
dialogue_line: Can you work some layers into it?

title: Making Requests
dialogue_line: Of course! It's easy.

title: Making Requests
dialogue_line: I would also like to keep some bangs.

title: Making Requests
dialogue_line: How long would you like them?

title: Making Requests
dialogue_line: Maybe down to my eyebrows?

title: Making Requests
dialogue_line: Sounds good!

title: Making Requests
dialogue_line: I trust you to make me look beautiful.

title: Making Requests
dialogue_line: Oh, trust me, you'll look gorgeous!

title: Paying for the Service
dialogue_line: I love my new hairstyle!

title: Paying for the Service
dialogue_line: Beauty takes work!

title: Paying for the Service
dialogue_line: And this is your best work yet!

title: Paying for the Service
dialogue_line: Thank you, I'm glad you're satisfied!

title: Paying for the Service
dialogue_line: How much do I owe you?

title: Paying for the Service
dialogue_line: Well, there was the haircut, and you also got the highlights.

title: Paying for the Service
dialogue_line: Not to mention the lowlights.

title: Paying for the Service
dialogue_line: That'll be $45.

title: Paying for the Service
dialogue_line: Prices have sure gone up over time!

title: Paying for the Service
dialogue_line: Yes, but beauty is worth it!

title: Paying for the Service
dialogue_line: When I look this good, I guess you're right.

title: Paying for the Service
dialogue_line: Thank you for letting me cut your hair.

title: Making a Complaint
dialogue_line: What have you done to my hair?

title: Making a Complaint
dialogue_line: I did exactly what you told me to do.

title: Making a Complaint
dialogue_line: I asked for a light trim, not for a butchering!

title: Making a Complaint
dialogue_line: I had to cut out all the split ends.

title: Making a Complaint
dialogue_line: I look like a grapefruit! My head is too round!

title: Making a Complaint
dialogue_line: It's a short bob, very stylish.

title: Making a Complaint
dialogue_line: It looks more like a bowl cut to me!

title: Making a Complaint
dialogue_line: It looks fantastic, don't exaggerate.

title: Making a Complaint
dialogue_line: I hate it! I'm not paying for this!

title: Making a Complaint
dialogue_line: You have to pay me for my labor!

title: Making a Complaint
dialogue_line: I'm never coming here ever again!

title: Making a Complaint
dialogue_line: Trust me, you won't be missed.

title: Time to Do Your Laundry
dialogue_line: I don't have any clean laundry for tomorrow!

title: Time to Do Your Laundry
dialogue_line: Well, you should do your laundry then.

title: Time to Do Your Laundry
dialogue_line: Laundry is such a hassle!

title: Time to Do Your Laundry
dialogue_line: Pack the laundry bags and let's go to the Laundromat.

title: Time to Do Your Laundry
dialogue_line: Oh, alright. I don't have much, though.

title: Time to Do Your Laundry
dialogue_line: Do you have any quarters?

title: Time to Do Your Laundry
dialogue_line: Yes. I have enough for the washer and dryer.

title: Time to Do Your Laundry
dialogue_line: Alright then, let's get going.

title: Time to Do Your Laundry
dialogue_line: This is going to take forever.

title: Time to Do Your Laundry
dialogue_line: The longer you keep complaining, the longer it'll feel.

title: Time to Do Your Laundry
dialogue_line: I'd rather be playing video games.

title: Time to Do Your Laundry
dialogue_line: I'd rather you wore a clean shirt to school tomorrow.

title: Operating a Dryer
dialogue_line: Put your wet clothes into the dryer, please!

title: Operating a Dryer
dialogue_line: How long should I put them in for?

title: Operating a Dryer
dialogue_line: Put them on low heat for thirty minutes.

title: Operating a Dryer
dialogue_line: Why low heat?

title: Operating a Dryer
dialogue_line: If the air is too hot, the clothes will shrink.

title: Operating a Dryer
dialogue_line: I need to wash another load of laundry.

title: Operating a Dryer
dialogue_line: If they're colored, wash them in cold water.

title: Operating a Dryer
dialogue_line: Does warm water make them fade?

title: Operating a Dryer
dialogue_line: Yes. Put the detergent here, and don't use bleach.

title: Operating a Dryer
dialogue_line: Oh, that's where to put the detergent.

title: Operating a Dryer
dialogue_line: Don't forget to add fabric softener after the first rinse.

title: Operating a Dryer
dialogue_line: Okay, I won't. Thanks.

title: Fabric Softener
dialogue_line: Excuse me. Can I borrow your fabric softener?

title: Fabric Softener
dialogue_line: Of course, take as much as you need.

title: Fabric Softener
dialogue_line: Thank you. You're very kind.

title: Fabric Softener
dialogue_line: It's no problem at all.

title: Fabric Softener
dialogue_line: I love the subtle smell of this brand!

title: Fabric Softener
dialogue_line: Me too! It's not overpowering or strong.

title: Fabric Softener
dialogue_line: I think maybe I'll buy it for myself, too.

title: Fabric Softener
dialogue_line: What I like about it is that it's hypoallergenic.

title: Fabric Softener
dialogue_line: No kidding? That's really something.

title: Fabric Softener
dialogue_line: It's perfect for washing delicate clothing.

title: Fabric Softener
dialogue_line: Well, thank you for introducing me to this brand!

title: Fabric Softener
dialogue_line: Anytime, no problem!

title: Waking Up for School
dialogue_line: Hello, is this the Smith residence?

title: Waking Up for School
dialogue_line: Sarah! Hurry up and get out of bed!

title: Waking Up for School
dialogue_line: I can't, the blankets won't let me go.

title: Waking Up for School
dialogue_line: Quit being lazy and get up!

title: Waking Up for School
dialogue_line: No, I have to finish my awesome dream!

title: Waking Up for School
dialogue_line: I can't believe you turned off your alarm this morning.

title: Waking Up for School
dialogue_line: Why? I do it every morning.

title: Waking Up for School
dialogue_line: If you don't get out of bed, you'll get to school late.

title: Waking Up for School
dialogue_line: That's not so bad.

title: Waking Up for School
dialogue_line: How is it not so bad?

title: Waking Up for School
dialogue_line: Sleep is good for growing children.

title: Waking Up for School
dialogue_line: Yes, but you have a math test this morning!

title: Waking Up for School
dialogue_line: I completely forgot! I'm up, I'm up!

title: Returning a Call
dialogue_line: Hello, is this Mr. Smith? I'm Mrs. Jones.

title: Returning a Call
dialogue_line: Hello, Mrs. Jones. Did you get my message?

title: Returning a Call
dialogue_line: Yes, I did, I'm returning your call.

title: Returning a Call
dialogue_line: Oh, right, of course.

title: Returning a Call
dialogue_line: What's the problem? Is James in trouble?

title: Returning a Call
dialogue_line: I caught him copying a classmate's test today.

title: Returning a Call
dialogue_line: Oh, that child is incorrigible!

title: Returning a Call
dialogue_line: I'm afraid I'll have to give him detention this time.

title: Returning a Call
dialogue_line: It's alright, I understand.

title: Returning a Call
dialogue_line: James certainly is strong-willed.

title: Returning a Call
dialogue_line: Yes, he needs a firm hand and discipline!

title: Returning a Call
dialogue_line: He's a good boy. Now if only he'd stop cheating!

title: Meeting Teacher at School
dialogue_line: Hello, Mr. Smith. It's nice to finally meet you.

title: Meeting Teacher at School
dialogue_line: Likewise, Mrs. Jones. Please sit down.

title: Meeting Teacher at School
dialogue_line: Is James in trouble again?

title: Meeting Teacher at School
dialogue_line: Actually, no, he's not.

title: Meeting Teacher at School
dialogue_line: What's the purpose of this meeting exactly?

title: Meeting Teacher at School
dialogue_line: I just wanted to let you know that James is doing very well.

title: Meeting Teacher at School
dialogue_line: Oh, is that right? I'm so proud!

title: Meeting Teacher at School
dialogue_line: He has been staying for tutoring and his marks have skyrocketed!

title: Meeting Teacher at School
dialogue_line: I always knew he had it in him!

title: Meeting Teacher at School
dialogue_line: He behaves better in the classroom, too.

title: Meeting Teacher at School
dialogue_line: I do believe my James is growing up!

title: Meeting Teacher at School
dialogue_line: All children need to mature is motivation!

title: An Angry Parent
dialogue_line: You need to try harder in school!

title: An Angry Parent
dialogue_line: I am doing well in school.

title: An Angry Parent
dialogue_line: Then why are your marks in science so low?

title: An Angry Parent
dialogue_line: I don't understand science, that's all.

title: An Angry Parent
dialogue_line: Is that the same reasoning you have for math?

title: An Angry Parent
dialogue_line: Yes, and English, too.

title: An Angry Parent
dialogue_line: Tell me one single subject you're doing well in.

title: An Angry Parent
dialogue_line: Well, I'm doing wonderfully in my music class.

title: An Angry Parent
dialogue_line: What about history?

title: An Angry Parent
dialogue_line: Only the parts about Woodstock.

title: An Angry Parent
dialogue_line: That's it! You're grounded! No guitar for a month.

title: An Angry Parent
dialogue_line: Great, now I'll surely have a low GPA.

title: Time for Bed
dialogue_line: Hello, is this the Smith residence?

title: Time for Bed
dialogue_line: Children, it's time to go to bed!

title: Time for Bed
dialogue_line: But we're not sleepy yet!

title: Time for Bed
dialogue_line: If you get into bed right now, I'll read you a fairytale.

title: Time for Bed
dialogue_line: One with a princess and a prince?

title: Time for Bed
dialogue_line: Of course, and a magical dragon, too.

title: Time for Bed
dialogue_line: Why do we hear fairytales before bed?

title: Time for Bed
dialogue_line: So that the magic from stories can grow while you're sleeping.

title: Time for Bed
dialogue_line: What does it grow into?

title: Time for Bed
dialogue_line: Why, magical dreams, of course!

title: Time for Bed
dialogue_line: Please read us two tonight!

title: Time for Bed
dialogue_line: Alright, but only if you sleep as soon as I'm done!

title: Time for Bed
dialogue_line: We will. It's a promise!

title: Cleaning up the Room
dialogue_line: Hello, is this the Smith residence?

title: Cleaning up the Room
dialogue_line: David! Clean your room. It's filthy!

title: Cleaning up the Room
dialogue_line: It's not so bad, mom.

title: Cleaning up the Room
dialogue_line: I don't even remember what color the carpet is!

title: Cleaning up the Room
dialogue_line: It's blue, I remember.

title: Cleaning up the Room
dialogue_line: Have you no shame?

title: Cleaning up the Room
dialogue_line: What should I be ashamed of?

title: Cleaning up the Room
dialogue_line: There are clothes all over the ground!

title: Cleaning up the Room
dialogue_line: It's just easier to leave them there.

title: Cleaning up the Room
dialogue_line: Your floor is not a gigantic closet.

title: Cleaning up the Room
dialogue_line: I never said it was.

title: Cleaning up the Room
dialogue_line: Clean your room or you can't go out today.

title: Cleaning up the Room
dialogue_line: Fine, fine. I'll clean it now.

title: Caring for Puppies
dialogue_line: I think these puppies are hungry!

title: Caring for Puppies
dialogue_line: They've done nothing but play all day.

title: Caring for Puppies
dialogue_line: Do you think they're old enough to eat kibble?

title: Caring for Puppies
dialogue_line: They're six weeks old; I think they're old enough.

title: Caring for Puppies
dialogue_line: Look! They're digging right in!

title: Caring for Puppies
dialogue_line: Now they're settling for a nap.

title: Caring for Puppies
dialogue_line: Between keeping them from chewing things and cleaning, they're a hassle.

title: Caring for Puppies
dialogue_line: Yeah, they are. But look how cute they are while asleep!

title: Caring for Puppies
dialogue_line: Suddenly, I don't mind the chores so much.

title: Caring for Puppies
dialogue_line: Yeah, neither do I.

title: Caring for Puppies
dialogue_line: These puppies are truly worth it.

title: Caring for Puppies
dialogue_line: I wouldn't lose a single minute with them.

title: Cooking Dinner
dialogue_line: Hello, is this the Smith residence?

title: Cooking Dinner
dialogue_line: What's for dinner?

title: Cooking Dinner
dialogue_line: I should be asking you that.

title: Cooking Dinner
dialogue_line: What? Why do you say that?

title: Cooking Dinner
dialogue_line: You're old enough to cook dinner.

title: Cooking Dinner
dialogue_line: Are you saying it's my turn now?

title: Cooking Dinner
dialogue_line: Actually, that's exactly what I'm saying.

title: Cooking Dinner
dialogue_line: What would you like to eat, then?

title: Cooking Dinner
dialogue_line: I'm craving some spaghetti, bread, and even a salad.

title: Cooking Dinner
dialogue_line: Frozen pizza it is, then!

title: Cooking Dinner
dialogue_line: You are so lazy! Can you even cook?

title: Cooking Dinner
dialogue_line: Of course I can cook! I choose not to.

title: Cooking Dinner
dialogue_line: You're having hot pockets for dinner tomorrow.

title: Greetings (1)
dialogue_line: Hello, how are you doing?

title: Greetings (1)
dialogue_line: I am doing quite well, how are you?

title: Greetings (1)
dialogue_line: I've been better. I'm completely swamped with work.

title: Greetings (1)
dialogue_line: I know the feeling. My boss works me hard, too.

title: Greetings (1)
dialogue_line: Enough about work. How are the kids?

title: Greetings (1)
dialogue_line: They are good. The oldest is about to graduate from high school.

title: Greetings (1)
dialogue_line: You're kidding me! That's great, man.

title: Greetings (1)
dialogue_line: The youngest is about to start middle school soon.

title: Greetings (1)
dialogue_line: My son is about to start middle school as well.

title: Greetings (1)
dialogue_line: Hey, maybe they will be classmates.

title: Greetings (1)
dialogue_line: It's a strong possibility.

title: Greetings (1)
dialogue_line: Yeah. Well, I want to try and beat the traffic. Good-bye.

title: Greetings (1)
dialogue_line: Have a good one.

title: Greetings (2)
dialogue_line: Good morning. How are you today?

title: Greetings (2)
dialogue_line: I'm fantastic. How about yourself?

title: Greetings (2)
dialogue_line: That's great! I'm good, but I feel a little sick.

title: Greetings (2)
dialogue_line: That's not good. I heard there is a flu going around.

title: Greetings (2)
dialogue_line: Well, I have to be sure to take good care of myself.

title: Greetings (2)
dialogue_line: Sucks that you aren't feeling well, it's a nice day.

title: Greetings (2)
dialogue_line: It is. The sunshine makes me want to go to the beach.

title: Greetings (2)
dialogue_line: That's a great idea, but I think you'll get sicker if you go.

title: Greetings (2)
dialogue_line: True. Perhaps we can go some other time?

title: Greetings (2)
dialogue_line: For sure. Let's get together next week and go if you're better.

title: Greetings (2)
dialogue_line: Sounds like a plan. I'll talk to you later.

title: Greetings (2)
dialogue_line: Cool, see you later.

title: Weather (1)
dialogue_line: Everything is going wrong today.

title: Weather (1)
dialogue_line: Well, at least the weather is nice.

title: Weather (1)
dialogue_line: Oh, yeah. Imagine if it had rained like they said it would.

title: Weather (1)
dialogue_line: I know, I would have gotten soaked walking home.

title: Weather (1)
dialogue_line: Yeah, I love when the sun is shining, but it's not too hot.

title: Weather (1)
dialogue_line: I do, too. This weather is pretty sweet.

title: Weather (1)
dialogue_line: I guess everything will be okay in the end.

title: Weather (1)
dialogue_line: So all you needed was some sunshine.

title: Weather (1)
dialogue_line: Yeah, I guess you were right Â– for once.

title: Weather (1)
dialogue_line: Hey! I'm always right.

title: Weather (2)
dialogue_line: Quick! Get in here and wait out the storm!

title: Weather (2)
dialogue_line: Oh, my word. Thank you so much.

title: Weather (2)
dialogue_line: It's raining cats and dogs out there.

title: Weather (2)
dialogue_line: More like lions and wolves!

title: Weather (2)
dialogue_line: I was watching the news.

title: Weather (2)
dialogue_line: What did they say?

title: Weather (2)
dialogue_line: This is going to be one heck of a storm.

title: Weather (2)
dialogue_line: Should we be worried?

title: Weather (2)
dialogue_line: I don't think so. The emergency alert system would have gone up.

title: Weather (2)
dialogue_line: True. Well, thank you for saving me from this storm.

title: Weather (2)
dialogue_line: No problem. I'm making some tea; would you like some?

title: Weather (2)
dialogue_line: Please. Something warm would be great at the moment!

title: Weather (3)
dialogue_line: Heard it's supposed to rain.

title: Weather (3)
dialogue_line: Where did you hear that from?

title: Weather (3)
dialogue_line: The news. The weatherman said there is a high probability of rain.

title: Weather (3)
dialogue_line: Since when have you started watching the news?

title: Weather (3)
dialogue_line: I've always watched the news. Well, at least to check out the weather.

title: Weather (3)
dialogue_line: What else did they say about the weekend?

title: Weather (3)
dialogue_line: I think they said it was going to rain throughout the weekend.

title: Weather (3)
dialogue_line: Throughout the weekend? Don't pull my chain.

title: Weather (3)
dialogue_line: I'm not. They said it, not me. I know you had plans.

title: Weather (3)
dialogue_line: Well, I don't believe it. Just like I don't believe you watch the news.

title: Weather (3)
dialogue_line: Okay, suit yourself. I'd take an umbrella though.

title: Weather (3)
dialogue_line: I won't. I'd rather get wet than listen to you.

title: Calling a Friend
dialogue_line: Why don't you ever answer your phone?

title: Calling a Friend
dialogue_line: I'm usually busy. What's up?

title: Calling a Friend
dialogue_line: I wanted to see if you were down to kick it.

title: Calling a Friend
dialogue_line: Where do you want to go? I don't have that much money.

title: Calling a Friend
dialogue_line: Let's go for a drink at the bar where we went last week.

title: Calling a Friend
dialogue_line: Okay, but I only have enough for three beers.

title: Calling a Friend
dialogue_line: It's fine. I'll pay for the rest, but you owe me.

title: Calling a Friend
dialogue_line: Screw that, I paid for you last time. You owe me!

title: Calling a Friend
dialogue_line: Well, then we can call it even.

title: Calling a Friend
dialogue_line: I guess so. Where should we meet?

title: Calling a Friend
dialogue_line: How about at the train station by the bar?

title: Calling a Friend
dialogue_line: Sounds good. I'll see you in an hour.

title: Calling a Friend
dialogue_line: Great. See you then, laters.

title: Describing People (1)
dialogue_line: Dude, I forgot to tell you Â– I'm going out with Sarah.

title: Describing People (1)
dialogue_line: Which one is Sarah? You date so many girls that I get confused.

title: Describing People (1)
dialogue_line: First off, I don't date that many girls, and secondly you're always confused.

title: Describing People (1)
dialogue_line: True. So, which one is she? Is she in your class?

title: Describing People (1)
dialogue_line: Nope. She's the girl from the restaurant we go to in downtown.

title: Describing People (1)
dialogue_line: From Green Bamboo? Which girl?

title: Describing People (1)
dialogue_line: The cute one. You know the one with the tattoo up her thigh?

title: Describing People (1)
dialogue_line: I think I would have noticed that.

title: Describing People (1)
dialogue_line: She's the only one with blonde hair.

title: Describing People (1)
dialogue_line: Well, why didn't you just say that? That's Sarah?

title: Describing People (1)
dialogue_line: Well, I know you check her out. I assumed you saw the tattoo.

title: Describing People (1)
dialogue_line: I'm not that big of a pervert.

title: Describing People (2)
dialogue_line: I have a new co-worker at work. She's pretty.

title: Describing People (2)
dialogue_line: Oh, yeah? Is she prettier than your ex-girlfriend?

title: Describing People (2)
dialogue_line: Yeah, she is. She's tall, thin, and wears glasses.

title: Describing People (2)
dialogue_line: Oh, boy. What is it with you and girls with glasses?

title: Describing People (2)
dialogue_line: You know what? I don't know.

title: Describing People (2)
dialogue_line: Well, tell me about her.

title: Describing People (2)
dialogue_line: She likes music. She is always wearing band t-shirts.

title: Describing People (2)
dialogue_line: Really? Are they any bands you like?

title: Describing People (2)
dialogue_line: Yeah, actually a lot of them are.

title: Describing People (2)
dialogue_line: How does she act? Is she nice?

title: Describing People (2)
dialogue_line: She is. I dropped my wallet, and didn't notice. She took it to me.

title: Describing People (2)
dialogue_line: Well, ask her out tomorrow, or somebody will.

title: Expressing Concern
dialogue_line: I heard that your brother is in the hospital.

title: Expressing Concern
dialogue_line: Yeah. He's been there since last week.

title: Expressing Concern
dialogue_line: Oh, no. What happened? Is he alright?

title: Expressing Concern
dialogue_line: He got in a car accident. He should be alright.

title: Expressing Concern
dialogue_line: The doctors told you he would be alright?

title: Expressing Concern
dialogue_line: Yes, but they need to keep him for further tests.

title: Expressing Concern
dialogue_line: Oh, okay. I was so worried when I heard this.

title: Expressing Concern
dialogue_line: Thanks, but everything should be fine. He was lucky.

title: Expressing Concern
dialogue_line: Really lucky. Did anyone else get injured?

title: Expressing Concern
dialogue_line: His girlfriend broke her arm, but that's all.

title: Expressing Concern
dialogue_line: Oh, that's not good. Is she at the hospital?

title: Expressing Concern
dialogue_line: Yes, she is taking care of my brother.

title: Expressing Joy
dialogue_line: C'mon, guess what?

title: Expressing Joy
dialogue_line: I don't know, chicken butt?

title: Expressing Joy
dialogue_line: Stop playing games. I got the part in the school play!

title: Expressing Joy
dialogue_line: Really? That's great!

title: Expressing Joy
dialogue_line: All this practice is finally paying off.

title: Expressing Joy
dialogue_line: Yes, it is. I can't believe it!

title: Expressing Joy
dialogue_line: Same here. I'm going to be the main character!

title: Expressing Joy
dialogue_line: I'm so proud of you. I can't wait to see the play.

title: Expressing Joy
dialogue_line: It's going to be a lot of hard work, but I'm glad I got the part.

title: Expressing Joy
dialogue_line: When does the play open?

title: Expressing Joy
dialogue_line: It opens in three weeks.

title: Expressing Joy
dialogue_line: Great. Get me a ticket. I want to be sitting in the front row.

title: Compliment
dialogue_line: That's an awesome shirt.

title: Compliment
dialogue_line: Thank you. It's so nice of you to say.

title: Compliment
dialogue_line: Where did you get it?

title: Compliment
dialogue_line: I got it at a store at the mall.

title: Compliment
dialogue_line: The mall? Did it cost a lot? Things are usually overpriced there.

title: Compliment
dialogue_line: Actually, it was quite cheap. I got it for $15.99.

title: Compliment
dialogue_line: That is pretty cheap. Do they have it in other colors?

title: Compliment
dialogue_line: You want to go get one?

title: Compliment
dialogue_line: Yeah, I like how it looks. Would you want to come with me?

title: Compliment
dialogue_line: We can go after school, if you want?

title: Compliment
dialogue_line: That would be great. I need new clothes, but I don't know what to buy.

title: Compliment
dialogue_line: I'll help you pick out something cute.

title: Leisure Activities
dialogue_line: I'm bored. Do you want to do something?

title: Leisure Activities
dialogue_line: What did you have in mind?

title: Leisure Activities
dialogue_line: Do you want to go drink?

title: Leisure Activities
dialogue_line: No, I have work tomorrow, and I don't want to be hung over.

title: Leisure Activities
dialogue_line: You don't have to get wasted.

title: Leisure Activities
dialogue_line: I know you. You won't shut your mouth until I get wasted.

title: Leisure Activities
dialogue_line: Fine. Let's go to the record store. I hear they have new vinyl.

title: Leisure Activities
dialogue_line: I'm down to go to the record store. I haven't been there in a while.

title: Leisure Activities
dialogue_line: Actually, I don't feel like going to the record store.

title: Leisure Activities
dialogue_line: Well, what do you want to do?

title: Leisure Activities
dialogue_line: Let's go to the movies instead?

title: Leisure Activities
dialogue_line: Yeah, that new movie that I want to see is out. Let's go.

title: Favorite Movie
dialogue_line: What's your favorite movie?

title: Favorite Movie
dialogue_line: "The Grand Budapest Hotel." Why do you ask?

title: Favorite Movie
dialogue_line: I was wondering what types of movies you liked.

title: Favorite Movie
dialogue_line: Well, that's my favorite movie, but I like all sorts of movies.

title: Favorite Movie
dialogue_line: Oh, okay, but why do you like that movie so much?

title: Favorite Movie
dialogue_line: Because it has action, adventure, comedy, and wonderful acting.

title: Favorite Movie
dialogue_line: How many times would you say you have seen it?

title: Favorite Movie
dialogue_line: Too many to say. I watch it at least twice a month.

title: Favorite Movie
dialogue_line: Really, you like it that much?

title: Favorite Movie
dialogue_line: It's a really good movie. You should watch it.

title: Favorite Movie
dialogue_line: Could I borrow it? I don't have money to buy it.

title: Favorite Movie
dialogue_line: Yes, I could lend you the movie, but be careful with it.

title: Favorite Music
dialogue_line: Do you have a favorite genre of music?

title: Favorite Music
dialogue_line: No, but I have favorite bands.

title: Favorite Music
dialogue_line: What bands would you consider your favorites?

title: Favorite Music
dialogue_line: The Beatles are the first. Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros are the second.

title: Favorite Music
dialogue_line: Is that all?

title: Favorite Music
dialogue_line: No, I really like The Clash. They are third.

title: Favorite Music
dialogue_line: I've only heard of The Beatles.

title: Favorite Music
dialogue_line: You should check out the other two bands. They are good.

title: Favorite Music
dialogue_line: Do you have any of their music that you could show me?

title: Favorite Music
dialogue_line: Sure, come over to my house after school, and I will show you their music.

title: Favorite Music
dialogue_line: Great! I've been looking for new music to listen to.

title: Favorite Music
dialogue_line: Don't worry; I will get you into a lot of new stuff.

title: Sports (1)
dialogue_line: Do you know who won against the Dodgers and the Cubs?

title: Sports (1)
dialogue_line: I'm sorry, but I don't follow baseball.

title: Sports (1)
dialogue_line: Oh, really? Why not?

title: Sports (1)
dialogue_line: I've never really got into baseball. I like basketball better.

title: Sports (1)
dialogue_line: Oh, okay. Do you have a cell phone?

title: Sports (1)
dialogue_line: Yes, why do you ask?

title: Sports (1)
dialogue_line: Could you check to see who won the baseball game?

title: Sports (1)
dialogue_line: Sure, let me check. It'll take one minute. It looks like the Chicago Cubs won seven to three.

title: Sports (1)
dialogue_line: Yes! I was rooting for the Cubs.

title: Sports (1)
dialogue_line: Well, they won. Glad I could be of some service.

title: Sports (1)
dialogue_line: Thanks again. Have a nice day.

title: Sports (2)
dialogue_line: My baseball game starts at 2 p.m. today. Will you be there?

title: Sports (2)
dialogue_line: Yes, I will definitely be there.

title: Sports (2)
dialogue_line: Great! I will tell my family to save you a seat.

title: Sports (2)
dialogue_line: What position will you be playing?

title: Sports (2)
dialogue_line: I will be playing first base, but the coach may switch me.

title: Sports (2)
dialogue_line: If he switches you, what position will you play?

title: Sports (2)
dialogue_line: I think he wants me to pitch.

title: Sports (2)
dialogue_line: You are a pitcher as well?

title: Sports (2)
dialogue_line: Yes, I am. I'm still training, but I can throw.

title: Sports (2)
dialogue_line: I didn't know that about you.

title: Sports (2)
dialogue_line: Well, hopefully you can see me pitch today.

title: Sports (2)
dialogue_line: Awesome! I can't wait.

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: Can you explain baseball to me?

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: I can try to explain the basics. What do you want to know?

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: What are strikes?

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: Every batter has three strikes. When they get three strikes, they are out.

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: Okay, but what about when the umpire calls a ball?

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: Once an umpire calls four balls, then the batter goes to first base.

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: What happens when a pitcher hits a batter with the ball?

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: The batter goes to first base.

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: What if someone is on first base?

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: Then whoever was on first base goes to second base.

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: Oh, okay. What's a no-hitter?

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: A no-hitter is when a team doesn't get a hit throughout the game.

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: So, that's a good thing for the pitcher?

title: Sports (3)
dialogue_line: Yes, because that means he pitched really well.

title: Invitation
dialogue_line: Would you like to go see a movie tomorrow night?

title: Invitation
dialogue_line: I am busy tomorrow night, but I am free the night after.

title: Invitation
dialogue_line: That's great! What time should I pick you up?

title: Invitation
dialogue_line: 8 p.m. would be great.

title: Invitation
dialogue_line: Well, 8 p.m. it is. What movie would you like to see?

title: Invitation
dialogue_line: I'm not sure. Which movies are out right now?

title: Invitation
dialogue_line: I actually don't know. How about we choose when we get there?

title: Invitation
dialogue_line: Sure thing, that sounds great.

title: Invitation
dialogue_line: Okay, should I pick you up at your house? Or do you want to meet somewhere?

title: Invitation
dialogue_line: I live by school; if you want, we could meet there.

title: Invitation
dialogue_line: Sure. I drive a white Nissan Sentra. I'll text you later on, okay?

title: Invitation
dialogue_line: That sounds great. I'll be waiting for your text.

title: Asking for Donation
dialogue_line: Would you like to donate money for Christopher?

title: Asking for Donation
dialogue_line: Wait, what happened to Christopher?

title: Asking for Donation
dialogue_line: He was hit by a car after school the other day.

title: Asking for Donation
dialogue_line: What? That was terrible!

title: Asking for Donation
dialogue_line: That day I was going to walk home with him, but I decided to go to the library.

title: Asking for Donation
dialogue_line: I can't believe it. Is he okay?

title: Asking for Donation
dialogue_line: He broke some bones, but other than that, he is okay.

title: Asking for Donation
dialogue_line: Oh, great! So, why are you collecting money for him?

title: Asking for Donation
dialogue_line: The hospital bills are sort of steep. His parents can't afford it.

title: Asking for Donation
dialogue_line: Oh, wow! Well, here is my last $10. Please send my best to Chris.

title: Asking for Donation
dialogue_line: Thank you. Every dollar counts.

title: Asking for Donation
dialogue_line: Bless your heart for helping him out.

title: Sharing News
dialogue_line: Did you hear about Joseph and Michelle?

title: Sharing News
dialogue_line: No, what happened? Did they have a divorce?

title: Sharing News
dialogue_line: Oh, no. They are pregnant.

title: Sharing News
dialogue_line: Really? How far along is Michelle?

title: Sharing News
dialogue_line: Joseph told me that she is four months.

title: Sharing News
dialogue_line: Oh, okay. How is he handling the news?

title: Sharing News
dialogue_line: He was a mess the last time I saw him.

title: Sharing News
dialogue_line: How is he now? Is he still crazy?

title: Sharing News
dialogue_line: Actually, he seems relaxed and collected.

title: Sharing News
dialogue_line: I can't believe Joseph is going to be a father.

title: Sharing News
dialogue_line: It's trippy, huh? He is our age.

title: Sharing News
dialogue_line: This is making me feel really old.

title: Changing the Subject
dialogue_line: Can I ask you a question?

title: Changing the Subject
dialogue_line: Sure, go ahead.

title: Changing the Subject
dialogue_line: How is your relationship with your parents?

title: Changing the Subject
dialogue_line: It's good. I get along with my father more than I do with my mother.

title: Changing the Subject
dialogue_line: If I may ask, why is that?

title: Changing the Subject
dialogue_line: I'm not comfortable answering that. Why are you asking?

title: Changing the Subject
dialogue_line: It's for a class project. Why don't you get along with your mother?

title: Changing the Subject
dialogue_line: What class are you doing this for?

title: Changing the Subject
dialogue_line: It's for my psychology class. Do you live with your dad or mom?

title: Changing the Subject
dialogue_line: I live with my dad.

title: Changing the Subject
dialogue_line: Do you think that's why you don't get along with your mom?

title: Changing the Subject
dialogue_line: I said I'm not comfortable talking about that. Change the subject.

title: Receiving Visitors
dialogue_line: Come in, please. Take a seat wherever you like.

title: Receiving Visitors
dialogue_line: Thank you. It's been a long and hot day.

title: Receiving Visitors
dialogue_line: It has been a hot one. Would you like something to drink?

title: Receiving Visitors
dialogue_line: What do you have?

title: Receiving Visitors
dialogue_line: We have soda, juice, and bottled water.

title: Receiving Visitors
dialogue_line: I'll take bottled water, and my wife would like one, too.

title: Receiving Visitors
dialogue_line: Sounds good. Would you like it in a glass with ice?

title: Receiving Visitors
dialogue_line: Yes, that sounds wonderful.

title: Receiving Visitors
dialogue_line: We also have some slices of pineapple. Would you like some?

title: Receiving Visitors
dialogue_line: Pineapple would hit the spot. I would love some.

title: Receiving Visitors
dialogue_line: Does your wife want some as well?

title: Receiving Visitors
dialogue_line: Actually, she doesn't like pineapple. Thanks, anyway.

title: Ending a Conversation
dialogue_line: I didn't like the way you sang tonight.

title: Ending a Conversation
dialogue_line: Oh, wow. Well, thanks for coming out.

title: Ending a Conversation
dialogue_line: You didn't put in all your effort. That's all I'm saying.

title: Ending a Conversation
dialogue_line: Okay, well I'm going to leave now.

title: Ending a Conversation
dialogue_line: Why are you in a rush to leave?

title: Ending a Conversation
dialogue_line: Because you are being rude, and I don't want to speak to you.

title: Ending a Conversation
dialogue_line: Well, now I know you can't take criticism.

title: Ending a Conversation
dialogue_line: It's not that I can't take criticism; it's that I don't like jerks.

title: Ending a Conversation
dialogue_line: How am I a jerk? I'm just giving you my honest opinion.

title: Ending a Conversation
dialogue_line: Well, in my honest opinion, I don't care what you think.

title: Ending a Conversation
dialogue_line: Now, that was rude. I don't want to talk to you anymore.

title: Ending a Conversation
dialogue_line: Great. Believe me; I won't be losing any sleep.

title: Leave-taking
dialogue_line: It's 4 a.m. already? I have to be getting home.

title: Leave-taking
dialogue_line: You can stay over if you want. I have an extra bed.

title: Leave-taking
dialogue_line: I appreciate the gesture, but I must get home.

title: Leave-taking
dialogue_line: Do you want to hang out tomorrow night?

title: Leave-taking
dialogue_line: I would love that. I will call you after I get out of work.

title: Leave-taking
dialogue_line: What time do you get out?

title: Leave-taking
dialogue_line: If my boss isn't there, I should be getting out at around 8:00 p.m.

title: Leave-taking
dialogue_line: And if your boss is there?

title: Leave-taking
dialogue_line: Then I will be getting out sometime around 10:00 p.m.

title: Leave-taking
dialogue_line: Great. We could go grab a drink after you get out of work.

title: Leave-taking
dialogue_line: That sounds lovely, good night.

title: Leave-taking
dialogue_line: Good night. Drive home safely.

title: Easy or Hard?
dialogue_line: I don't know which class to register for.

title: Easy or Hard?
dialogue_line: You should pick the class you need.

title: Easy or Hard?
dialogue_line: I know I need a science class.

title: Easy or Hard?
dialogue_line: I would take biology with Mr. Green.

title: Easy or Hard?
dialogue_line: It's a challenging yet fun class.

title: Easy or Hard?
dialogue_line: I don't like challenges.

title: Easy or Hard?
dialogue_line: Why are you in college then?

title: Easy or Hard?
dialogue_line: My mom forced me to enroll.

title: Easy or Hard?
dialogue_line: You should go to a vocational school instead.

title: Easy or Hard?
dialogue_line: I don't think you understand. My mom is scary.

title: Easy or Hard?
dialogue_line: Okay, fine. I recommend Earth Science 125 with Mr. Anderson.

title: Easy or Hard?
dialogue_line: Thanks for the recommendation!

title: A Restriction
dialogue_line: I am so upset.

title: A Restriction
dialogue_line: Oh, no. Talk to me about it.

title: A Restriction
dialogue_line: I can't register for a class I really need.

title: A Restriction
dialogue_line: Is it full?

title: A Restriction
dialogue_line: I have a hold on my record, because my library books were overdue.

title: A Restriction
dialogue_line: Can't you just pay the overdue fees?

title: A Restriction
dialogue_line: I can't afford it. I'm totally broke.

title: A Restriction
dialogue_line: How much do you need?

title: A Restriction
dialogue_line: I need $50.

title: A Restriction
dialogue_line: Wow, you must have kept those books long past the due date.

title: A Restriction
dialogue_line: Yes, I know I am horrible.

title: A Restriction
dialogue_line: I'll lend you the money.

title: The Quiet Student
dialogue_line: Hi, I'm James. What's your name?

title: The Quiet Student
dialogue_line: Hi James. My name is Lisa.

title: The Quiet Student
dialogue_line: I'm taking this class because it seems interesting. Why are you?

title: The Quiet Student
dialogue_line: I'm taking this class because it's a requirement.

title: The Quiet Student
dialogue_line: We should get to know each other.

title: The Quiet Student
dialogue_line: I don't think so. I like keeping to myself.

title: The Quiet Student
dialogue_line: So you don't like meeting new students?

title: The Quiet Student
dialogue_line: Nope. I would rather just be alone.

title: The Quiet Student
dialogue_line: That is so sad!

title: The Quiet Student
dialogue_line: It's not. It's really peaceful and self-empowering.

title: The Quiet Student
dialogue_line: Can we at least study together?

title: The Quiet Student
dialogue_line: Nope, we can't do that.

title: Finding the Classroom
dialogue_line: It takes me hours to find my classroom.

title: Finding the Classroom
dialogue_line: I might be able to help you.

title: Finding the Classroom
dialogue_line: Really? That would be great!

title: Finding the Classroom
dialogue_line: What's your classroom number?

title: Finding the Classroom
dialogue_line: My classroom number is A21.

title: Finding the Classroom
dialogue_line: So the "A" is the building type.

title: Finding the Classroom
dialogue_line: Okay, but I don't know where that is.

title: Finding the Classroom
dialogue_line: Do you know where the gym is?

title: Finding the Classroom
dialogue_line: Yeah, I do.

title: Finding the Classroom
dialogue_line: Okay, your classroom is behind the gym.

title: Finding the Classroom
dialogue_line: That's really helpful! Thank you.

title: Finding the Classroom
dialogue_line: No problem, and the "21" means it's upstairs.

title: Buying Textbooks
dialogue_line: I can't spend anymore money after I buy my English textbook.

title: Buying Textbooks
dialogue_line: How much is your English textbook?

title: Buying Textbooks
dialogue_line: It's $198. I'm not kidding.

title: Buying Textbooks
dialogue_line: That's ridiculously expensive! What's the title of the textbook?

title: Buying Textbooks
dialogue_line: It's called How to Write Well.

title: Buying Textbooks
dialogue_line: Dude, someone is selling that book for $30.

title: Buying Textbooks
dialogue_line: No way. What edition is it?

title: Buying Textbooks
dialogue_line: I think it was the 10th edition.

title: Buying Textbooks
dialogue_line: Oh, no wonder he or she is selling it for only $30.

title: Buying Textbooks
dialogue_line: What edition do you need?

title: Buying Textbooks
dialogue_line: I need the 21st edition.

title: Buying Textbooks
dialogue_line: The publisher seems to be really making money, considering the number of editions.

title: Professor Hernandez
dialogue_line: I hate Professor Hernandez!

title: Professor Hernandez
dialogue_line: Me too! He keeps calling me stupid!

title: Professor Hernandez
dialogue_line: You think that's bad? He gave me an F, because I double spaced my essay!

title: Professor Hernandez
dialogue_line: But every professor wants essays double spaced. He's crazy!

title: Professor Hernandez
dialogue_line: Professor Hernandez is weird. He wants essays triple spaced.

title: Professor Hernandez
dialogue_line: That's just a waste of paper. Why does he like triple spacing?

title: Professor Hernandez
dialogue_line: He says it's because he has to make a lot of corrections, because we're stupid.

title: Professor Hernandez
dialogue_line: We should start a petition, and get him fired!

title: Professor Hernandez
dialogue_line: We should, but he can find out.

title: Professor Hernandez
dialogue_line: I know. If he found out, he would ruin everyone's life.

title: Professor Hernandez
dialogue_line: He is so evil.

title: Professor Hernandez
dialogue_line: That's why this petition has to work!

title: A Busy Professor
dialogue_line: Hey, Professor Hill.

title: A Busy Professor
dialogue_line: What is it?

title: A Busy Professor
dialogue_line: I've been having trouble with derivatives.

title: A Busy Professor
dialogue_line: That's not good. There's a test on derivatives next week.

title: A Busy Professor
dialogue_line: I know. Can I make an appointment with you for some help?

title: A Busy Professor
dialogue_line: I'm a busy man.

title: A Busy Professor
dialogue_line: You didn't even check your schedule yet!

title: A Busy Professor
dialogue_line: I know I'm busy, because many people already made appointments.

title: A Busy Professor
dialogue_line: So I'm hopeless?

title: A Busy Professor
dialogue_line: Of course not! There's the tutoring center.

title: A Busy Professor
dialogue_line: But the tutors are not professors. They're just students.

title: A Busy Professor
dialogue_line: They might surprise you.

title: Turning Homework in Late
dialogue_line: May I turn in my homework tomorrow?

title: Turning Homework in Late
dialogue_line: It's due today.

title: Turning Homework in Late
dialogue_line: I know, but I don't have it right now.

title: Turning Homework in Late
dialogue_line: How come? Your dog ate it?

title: Turning Homework in Late
dialogue_line: No! I left it at home.

title: Turning Homework in Late
dialogue_line: I can't take your word for it.

title: Turning Homework in Late
dialogue_line: Why not? I'm an A+ student.

title: Turning Homework in Late
dialogue_line: How do I know if you even did the homework?

title: Turning Homework in Late
dialogue_line: I'll ask my mom to take a picture of it and send it to me.

title: Turning Homework in Late
dialogue_line: That's fair enough.

title: Turning Homework in Late
dialogue_line: Thanks. Also, you should try trusting students more. We're not all that bad.

title: Turning Homework in Late
dialogue_line: I'll try, but I can't promise anything.

title: An Honest Student
dialogue_line: I have to tell you something.

title: An Honest Student
dialogue_line: What is it?

title: An Honest Student
dialogue_line: You graded my test incorrectly. I got this wrong, but you didn't mark it.

title: An Honest Student
dialogue_line: Wow! I have never met a more honest student.

title: An Honest Student
dialogue_line: I just felt wrong.

title: An Honest Student
dialogue_line: Just keep the score you have.

title: An Honest Student
dialogue_line: Really? That's awesome.

title: An Honest Student
dialogue_line: Yes. I have to ask, why did you decide to tell me?

title: An Honest Student
dialogue_line: I'm really bad at lying.

title: An Honest Student
dialogue_line: That's a good thing! Your honesty is praiseworthy.

title: An Honest Student
dialogue_line: Thanks. Want to give me extra credit?

title: An Honest Student
dialogue_line: Don't push it.

title: Borrowing Class Notes
dialogue_line: Can I borrow your class notes from yesterday's lecture?

title: Borrowing Class Notes
dialogue_line: Heck no! You're so lazy.

title: Borrowing Class Notes
dialogue_line: What are you talking about? I was sick yesterday.

title: Borrowing Class Notes
dialogue_line: I don't care. Ask someone else.

title: Borrowing Class Notes
dialogue_line: You're so mean!

title: Borrowing Class Notes
dialogue_line: I can't let anyone borrow my class notes.

title: Borrowing Class Notes
dialogue_line: Why not? They're just notes.

title: Borrowing Class Notes
dialogue_line: I let a classmate borrow my notes once, and she sold copies to people.

title: Borrowing Class Notes
dialogue_line: That's crazy! For how much?

title: Borrowing Class Notes
dialogue_line: She sold each class note set for $5.

title: Borrowing Class Notes
dialogue_line: Don't worry, I promise not to sell your notes.

title: Borrowing Class Notes
dialogue_line: I can't take your word for it.

title: 90% Is a B
dialogue_line: I think your grading policy is unfair.

title: 90% Is a B
dialogue_line: I beg your pardon?!

title: 90% Is a B
dialogue_line: Why is a 90% a B?

title: 90% Is a B
dialogue_line: I'm trying to challenge you guys.

title: 90% Is a B
dialogue_line: That's not a challenge, that's a punishment.

title: 90% Is a B
dialogue_line: I've had this policy since I started teaching.

title: 90% Is a B
dialogue_line: It's time for a change.

title: 90% Is a B
dialogue_line: I'm not changing my policy because you don't like it.

title: 90% Is a B
dialogue_line: Put yourself in my shoes.

title: 90% Is a B
dialogue_line: I have been a student once, and I think my policy is fair.

title: 90% Is a B
dialogue_line: I'm going to drop your class!

title: 90% Is a B
dialogue_line: Go ahead! Less for me to grade!

title: Rounding It Up
dialogue_line: I have a 89.5%.

title: Rounding It Up
dialogue_line: Okay, so what?

title: Rounding It Up
dialogue_line: It's really close to an A.

title: Rounding It Up
dialogue_line: You know I don't round up.

title: Rounding It Up
dialogue_line: But I really need a 4.0 GPA.

title: Rounding It Up
dialogue_line: You get what you deserve.

title: Rounding It Up
dialogue_line: I know I deserve an A. I always do great work and participate.

title: Rounding It Up
dialogue_line: I can't change it.

title: Rounding It Up
dialogue_line: Please? I'll wash your car.

title: Rounding It Up
dialogue_line: Are you bribing me?

title: Rounding It Up
dialogue_line: I just want an A.

title: Rounding It Up
dialogue_line: I'll give you a C if you don't leave now.

title: Being Absent
dialogue_line: Why were you absent yesterday?

title: Being Absent
dialogue_line: Why do you care?

title: Being Absent
dialogue_line: You should be thankful I care so much about your education.

title: Being Absent
dialogue_line: The truth is, I didn't hear the alarm clock.

title: Being Absent
dialogue_line: You missed out on a very important lecture.

title: Being Absent
dialogue_line: It happens. I'll just ask my friend what was on the lecture.

title: Being Absent
dialogue_line: Is she a good note taker?

title: Being Absent
dialogue_line: I don't know. I guess?

title: Being Absent
dialogue_line: If you were in class, you wouldn't have to rely on anyone's notes.

title: Being Absent
dialogue_line: I can't change the past.

title: Being Absent
dialogue_line: I know. Anyways, you should increase the volume on your alarm clock.

title: Being Absent
dialogue_line: I suppose I could do that.

title: Leaving School
dialogue_line: I have to leave class early tomorrow.

title: Leaving School
dialogue_line: I don't like that. Just don't come to class.

title: Leaving School
dialogue_line: Don't be like that, Professor! I have to attend my mom's funeral.

title: Leaving School
dialogue_line: I'm sorry for your loss.

title: Leaving School
dialogue_line: It's okay. I'm going to miss her.

title: Leaving School
dialogue_line: I lost my mom when I was in college, too.

title: Leaving School
dialogue_line: Saddest thing ever, right?

title: Leaving School
dialogue_line: Yes. You know what? Take a week off school.

title: Leaving School
dialogue_line: I can't do that. I have too many responsibilities.

title: Leaving School
dialogue_line: Take my advice.

title: Leaving School
dialogue_line: I'll think about it.

title: Leaving School
dialogue_line: If you ever need to talk, my door is open.

title: In Need of a Counselor
dialogue_line: I would like to see my counselor now.

title: In Need of a Counselor
dialogue_line: Sorry, she doesn't have any time today.

title: In Need of a Counselor
dialogue_line: Are you serious?

title: In Need of a Counselor
dialogue_line: Yes, I am. Please make an appointment for next week.

title: In Need of a Counselor
dialogue_line: I really need to see her.

title: In Need of a Counselor
dialogue_line: I'm sorry, but you really can't.

title: In Need of a Counselor
dialogue_line: I swear, I will bang on her door and scream.

title: In Need of a Counselor
dialogue_line: Don't make a scene.

title: In Need of a Counselor
dialogue_line: If you don't want me to make a scene, tell the counselor I'm here.

title: In Need of a Counselor
dialogue_line: Fine! You can only talk to her for five minutes, though.

title: In Need of a Counselor
dialogue_line: That's all I need.

title: In Need of a Counselor
dialogue_line: Next time, you'd better make an appointment.

title: Talking to a Counselor
dialogue_line: I'm glad you came to talk to me today.

title: Talking to a Counselor
dialogue_line: You kind of forced me to.

title: Talking to a Counselor
dialogue_line: That's because I'm worried.

title: Talking to a Counselor
dialogue_line: What are you worried about?

title: Talking to a Counselor
dialogue_line: You withdrew from 4 of your 5 classes last semester.

title: Talking to a Counselor
dialogue_line: I was doing poorly!

title: Talking to a Counselor
dialogue_line: And why was that exactly?

title: Talking to a Counselor
dialogue_line: It was just too hard.

title: Talking to a Counselor
dialogue_line: You're really behind now. You might have to spend 6 years here.

title: Talking to a Counselor
dialogue_line: Can't I just take summer classes?

title: Talking to a Counselor
dialogue_line: Yes, but you don't want to stress yourself out.

title: Talking to a Counselor
dialogue_line: I don't really have a choice.

title: Adding a Class
dialogue_line: I'm thinking of adding another class.

title: Adding a Class
dialogue_line: Another one? You already have 7 classes.

title: Adding a Class
dialogue_line: I know, but I really want to add Psychology 101. It seems interesting.

title: Adding a Class
dialogue_line: You're going to be so stressed out.

title: Adding a Class
dialogue_line: I think I can handle 8 classes.

title: Adding a Class
dialogue_line: Seriously? You're going to be constantly in class or studying.

title: Adding a Class
dialogue_line: I know, but it's worth it.

title: Adding a Class
dialogue_line: Tell me that when I'm partying and you're not.

title: Adding a Class
dialogue_line: How many classes are you taking? Two?

title: Adding a Class
dialogue_line: Haha! You're funny. I'm taking three.

title: Adding a Class
dialogue_line: That's so little. Don't you feel like an underachiever?

title: Adding a Class
dialogue_line: Remind me again why we're friends.

title: Writing Workshop
dialogue_line: Want to go to the writing workshop with me today?

title: Writing Workshop
dialogue_line: Nah man, my writing skills is tight.

title: Writing Workshop
dialogue_line: You mean "are" instead of "is," right?

title: Writing Workshop
dialogue_line: Yeah, of course!

title: Writing Workshop
dialogue_line: You should come with me. Our college has great workshops.

title: Writing Workshop
dialogue_line: I don't want to look stupid.

title: Writing Workshop
dialogue_line: You won't. You look stupid using incorrect grammar.

title: Writing Workshop
dialogue_line: Fine. How long is the workshop?

title: Writing Workshop
dialogue_line: It's about an hour.

title: Writing Workshop
dialogue_line: I don't think my attention span is more than 5 minutes.

title: Writing Workshop
dialogue_line: Don't worry, I'll pinch you to wake you up.

title: Writing Workshop
dialogue_line: That's a clever idea.

title: Studying Abroad
dialogue_line: I'm planning to study abroad this summer.

title: Studying Abroad
dialogue_line: Cool! Where are you going?

title: Studying Abroad
dialogue_line: I'm going to Italy.

title: Studying Abroad
dialogue_line: What are you studying there?

title: Studying Abroad
dialogue_line: I'm taking a cooking class.

title: Studying Abroad
dialogue_line: That sounds interesting.

title: Studying Abroad
dialogue_line: I'm excited to learn in a totally new environment.

title: Studying Abroad
dialogue_line: Italy seems beautiful.

title: Studying Abroad
dialogue_line: It's beautiful in the pictures I've seen.

title: Studying Abroad
dialogue_line: Take a lot when you're there.

title: Studying Abroad
dialogue_line: I will, and I'll study hard, too.

title: Studying Abroad
dialogue_line: Also, learn some Italian while you're there.

title: Job Fair
dialogue_line: I hope I can find a job after graduation.

title: Job Fair
dialogue_line: What is your major?

title: Job Fair
dialogue_line: My major is geology.

title: Job Fair
dialogue_line: Geology majors aren't very high in demand, but you'll do fine.

title: Job Fair
dialogue_line: What makes you say that?

title: Job Fair
dialogue_line: You're smart and likeable. Don't worry.

title: Job Fair
dialogue_line: Thanks, but I'm still scared.

title: Job Fair
dialogue_line: Oh, hey! You should go to the job fair.

title: Job Fair
dialogue_line: We have that here?

title: Job Fair
dialogue_line: Yes. Take advantage of it.

title: Job Fair
dialogue_line: Have you ever been there?

title: Job Fair
dialogue_line: Yes, and it's really helpful. Dress nicely!

title: A Restaurant by the College
dialogue_line: I am so sick of dining hall food.

title: A Restaurant by the College
dialogue_line: Me too! It's so unhealthy.

title: A Restaurant by the College
dialogue_line: We should go to a restaurant nearby.

title: A Restaurant by the College
dialogue_line: Want to go to Health Nut?

title: A Restaurant by the College
dialogue_line: What a funny name!

title: A Restaurant by the College
dialogue_line: I like it!

title: A Restaurant by the College
dialogue_line: Do they sell nuts?

title: A Restaurant by the College
dialogue_line: I'm not sure. Anyways, I want to try their organic tofu.

title: A Restaurant by the College
dialogue_line: I'm allergic to tofu.

title: A Restaurant by the College
dialogue_line: That's okay! They serve a wide variety of food.

title: A Restaurant by the College
dialogue_line: Great! I'm just glad we're not eating dining hall food.

title: A Restaurant by the College
dialogue_line: Me too. Let's go!

title: Vending Machine Problems
dialogue_line: Why are you taking so long? Is something wrong?

title: Vending Machine Problems
dialogue_line: Sorry, my bag of chips got stuck.

title: Vending Machine Problems
dialogue_line: Vending machines suck, huh?

title: Vending Machine Problems
dialogue_line: They're the worst, but the food is great.

title: Vending Machine Problems
dialogue_line: It might come out if someone buys an item from the same column yours is on.

title: Vending Machine Problems
dialogue_line: Can you be that "someone?"

title: Vending Machine Problems
dialogue_line: Sure, why not? I could use some chips.

title: Vending Machine Problems
dialogue_line: Thanks! Hey, what is your name?

title: Vending Machine Problems
dialogue_line: My name is Charlie.

title: Vending Machine Problems
dialogue_line: Nice to meet you, Charlie.

title: Vending Machine Problems
dialogue_line: What is your name?

title: Vending Machine Problems
dialogue_line: Hater of Vending Machines.

title: Forgetting Your Student ID
dialogue_line: I would like to purchase the book for Sociology 130.

title: Forgetting Your Student ID
dialogue_line: May I see your student ID?

title: Forgetting Your Student ID
dialogue_line: I didn't know we needed it.

title: Forgetting Your Student ID
dialogue_line: Please go get your ID, and get in line again.

title: Forgetting Your Student ID
dialogue_line: But I waited in line for two hours!

title: Forgetting Your Student ID
dialogue_line: I'm sorry, but you need a student ID to purchase textbooks here.

title: Forgetting Your Student ID
dialogue_line: Are there any other options?

title: Forgetting Your Student ID
dialogue_line: Show me proof that you're a student at this college, and you'll be good.

title: Forgetting Your Student ID
dialogue_line: I have my report card. Here it is.

title: Forgetting Your Student ID
dialogue_line: This will do. Nice grades by the way.

title: Forgetting Your Student ID
dialogue_line: Thanks! I worked very hard for them.

title: Forgetting Your Student ID
dialogue_line: Good luck with this semester.

title: The Overdue Hold
dialogue_line: Wow! Your books are over the due date by one month.

title: The Overdue Hold
dialogue_line: It would have been longer if there wasn't a hold on my record.

title: The Overdue Hold
dialogue_line: What kind of hold is on your record?

title: The Overdue Hold
dialogue_line: A hold that won't let me go to the college football game.

title: The Overdue Hold
dialogue_line: Oh, that's tough.

title: The Overdue Hold
dialogue_line: Yeah. My girlfriend is actually a cheerleader, and so I have to go.

title: The Overdue Hold
dialogue_line: You're not going to like what I'm going to say.

title: The Overdue Hold
dialogue_line: What is it?

title: The Overdue Hold
dialogue_line: I can't remove the hold even if you pay the overdue fee.

title: The Overdue Hold
dialogue_line: Is it a technical error?

title: The Overdue Hold
dialogue_line: I don't know! I just can't remove it!

title: The Overdue Hold
dialogue_line: If my girlfriend breaks up with me, I'm blaming you.

title: Post-Undergraduate Plans
dialogue_line: What do you plan to do after you graduate from here?

title: Post-Undergraduate Plans
dialogue_line: I'm planning to go to medical school. You?

title: Post-Undergraduate Plans
dialogue_line: I'm planning to teach English in underprivileged countries.

title: Post-Undergraduate Plans
dialogue_line: That's really kind of you.

title: Post-Undergraduate Plans
dialogue_line: Thanks. The first country I'm teaching in is Kenya.

title: Post-Undergraduate Plans
dialogue_line: While you're at Kenya, I'll be studying for medical school.

title: Post-Undergraduate Plans
dialogue_line: What kind of doctor do you want to be?

title: Post-Undergraduate Plans
dialogue_line: I want to be a pediatrician.

title: Post-Undergraduate Plans
dialogue_line: Because you like kids?

title: Post-Undergraduate Plans
dialogue_line: I don't really have a good reason. I just think I'll be good at it.

title: Post-Undergraduate Plans
dialogue_line: You should do what you love, not necessarily what you're good at.

title: Post-Undergraduate Plans
dialogue_line: That is very cheesy advice.

title: Purchasing a Parking Permit
dialogue_line: The parking permit is $200 per semester, right?

title: Purchasing a Parking Permit
dialogue_line: It's actually $300.

title: Purchasing a Parking Permit
dialogue_line: Why?! That's ridiculous.

title: Purchasing a Parking Permit
dialogue_line: It's because of the budget cuts.

title: Purchasing a Parking Permit
dialogue_line: That's a terrible excuse.

title: Purchasing a Parking Permit
dialogue_line: It's the truth.

title: Purchasing a Parking Permit
dialogue_line: Give me something better than that.

title: Purchasing a Parking Permit
dialogue_line: Miss, if you don't want to pay, then don't.

title: Purchasing a Parking Permit
dialogue_line: This is so stressful.

title: Purchasing a Parking Permit
dialogue_line: I advise writing a letter to the dean.

title: Purchasing a Parking Permit
dialogue_line: I bet he'll just throw it away.

title: Purchasing a Parking Permit
dialogue_line: You would be surprised.

title: Parking Issue
dialogue_line: Do you have a car on campus?

title: Parking Issue
dialogue_line: No, because it's hard to find parking here.

title: Parking Issue
dialogue_line: How do you get to places then?

title: Parking Issue
dialogue_line: I walk or take the bus.

title: Parking Issue
dialogue_line: That's crazy! I could never do that.

title: Parking Issue
dialogue_line: You should. It's great for the environment.

title: Parking Issue
dialogue_line: That's true. What do you do for fun then?

title: Parking Issue
dialogue_line: There's a lot of stuff to do around campus.

title: Parking Issue
dialogue_line: I never realized.

title: Parking Issue
dialogue_line: You should do some exploring.

title: Parking Issue
dialogue_line: You convinced me. I won't bring my car this semester.

title: Parking Issue
dialogue_line: We can walk to places together now!

title: Fighting a Parking Ticket
dialogue_line: You know you can't park here, right?

title: Fighting a Parking Ticket
dialogue_line: Listen, I had to talk to my friend really quickly, and there was no parking spaces.

title: Fighting a Parking Ticket
dialogue_line: I'm going to have to give you a ticket.

title: Fighting a Parking Ticket
dialogue_line: I'm a broke college student.

title: Fighting a Parking Ticket
dialogue_line: And I'm a broke police officer. Deal with it.

title: Fighting a Parking Ticket
dialogue_line: Can't you just let me off with a warning?

title: Fighting a Parking Ticket
dialogue_line: No way. I have to be firm with you.

title: Fighting a Parking Ticket
dialogue_line: I'll buy you a box of donuts.

title: Fighting a Parking Ticket
dialogue_line: You have got to be kidding me.

title: Fighting a Parking Ticket
dialogue_line: I thought all cops liked donuts.

title: Fighting a Parking Ticket
dialogue_line: That's a stereotype. You should really learn to be quiet.

title: Fighting a Parking Ticket
dialogue_line: I'll stay quiet if you let me off with a warning.

title: Sports
dialogue_line: I'm thinking of joining a sports club on campus.

title: Sports
dialogue_line: You should! It takes away the stress of studying.

title: Sports
dialogue_line: What sport do you play?

title: Sports
dialogue_line: I actually play on our university's baseball team.

title: Sports
dialogue_line: That's cool! You must be really good.

title: Sports
dialogue_line: Yeah, I have a baseball scholarship.

title: Sports
dialogue_line: No wonder you're in such great shape!

title: Sports
dialogue_line: You'll be in great shape too after joining a sports club.

title: Sports
dialogue_line: I'm thinking of joining the tennis club.

title: Sports
dialogue_line: I wouldn't if I were you. The members don't even play tennis.

title: Sports
dialogue_line: What do they do then?

title: Sports
dialogue_line: They just talk about tennis. They never even touched a racket, though.

title: Clubs
dialogue_line: College is so boring. All I do is go to class.

title: Clubs
dialogue_line: You should join some clubs.

title: Clubs
dialogue_line: Are you a part of any clubs?

title: Clubs
dialogue_line: Yes! I am currently in the Animal Lovers Club and the Knitting Club.

title: Clubs
dialogue_line: What do you do in the Animal Lovers Club?

title: Clubs
dialogue_line: We do a lot of things! Last week, we walked dogs.

title: Clubs
dialogue_line: That sounds fun. What's the wildest animal you ever interacted with?

title: Clubs
dialogue_line: I touched a dodo bird a couple weeks ago.

title: Clubs
dialogue_line: Dodo birds are extinct.

title: Clubs
dialogue_line: I'm just messing with you!

title: Clubs
dialogue_line: You're silly! Okay, I'll join the Animal Lovers Club.

title: Clubs
dialogue_line: Great! We always welcome new members.

title: Early Morning Class
dialogue_line: I have to go to bed early.

title: Early Morning Class
dialogue_line: Why? The night is still young!

title: Early Morning Class
dialogue_line: I have a class at 7 a.m.

title: Early Morning Class
dialogue_line: That's tough! My earliest class is at 9 a.m.

title: Early Morning Class
dialogue_line: That sounds amazing to me.

title: Early Morning Class
dialogue_line: How do you stay awake in that class?

title: Early Morning Class
dialogue_line: Before I go to class, I drink four cups of coffee and take a cold shower.

title: Early Morning Class
dialogue_line: Interesting routine. Does it work?

title: Early Morning Class
dialogue_line: Kind of. It's better than not doing it at all.

title: Early Morning Class
dialogue_line: Why are you taking that class?

title: Early Morning Class
dialogue_line: It's only offered once a year, so I have to take it now.

title: Early Morning Class
dialogue_line: I hope the class is interesting, at least.

title: A Bad Roommate
dialogue_line: I hate my roommate.

title: A Bad Roommate
dialogue_line: I'm sorry to hear that. What's wrong with her?

title: A Bad Roommate
dialogue_line: A lot of things. First of all, she snores so loudly!

title: A Bad Roommate
dialogue_line: That's not really her fault. What else?

title: A Bad Roommate
dialogue_line: She never takes a shower.

title: A Bad Roommate
dialogue_line: That's disgusting! You should tell her to take a shower.

title: A Bad Roommate
dialogue_line: I did! She got mad at me and then proceeded to slap me.

title: A Bad Roommate
dialogue_line: Ouch! Did you try to get a new roommate?

title: A Bad Roommate
dialogue_line: I tried, but I could not. No one was willing to switch.

title: A Bad Roommate
dialogue_line: I guess you can get a new room by yourself.

title: A Bad Roommate
dialogue_line: I can't afford it. Ugh, I hate her so much.

title: A Bad Roommate
dialogue_line: It's okay. The year will be over before you know it.

title: Homesick
dialogue_line: Are you okay? You look really sad.

title: Homesick
dialogue_line: I'm homesick. I feel so out of place here.

title: Homesick
dialogue_line: But this college is so awesome.

title: Homesick
dialogue_line: I know, but I really miss home.

title: Homesick
dialogue_line: How far do you live?

title: Homesick
dialogue_line: Far. Let's just say I need an airplane to get there.

title: Homesick
dialogue_line: It's almost winter break. Hang in there.

title: Homesick
dialogue_line: I don't think I can handle it anymore.

title: Homesick
dialogue_line: Try calling your friends and family from your hometown.

title: Homesick
dialogue_line: I don't want them to worry about me.

title: Homesick
dialogue_line: Just call them. Don't you want to stop feeling sad?

title: Homesick
dialogue_line: Okay, I'll call them now.

title: Changing Majors
dialogue_line: I was wondering if I could change my major from biology to political science.

title: Changing Majors
dialogue_line: Those majors are very different from each other.

title: Changing Majors
dialogue_line: I know, but I hate biology. I can't see myself studying it anymore.

title: Changing Majors
dialogue_line: You can change it, but you'll have to take more classes.

title: Changing Majors
dialogue_line: I don't mind. Political science is really interesting to me.

title: Changing Majors
dialogue_line: You would be graduating a year late.

title: Changing Majors
dialogue_line: Oh, no. I have to think a little more about this then.

title: Changing Majors
dialogue_line: I think you should change it, since you hate biology.

title: Changing Majors
dialogue_line: Yeah, you're right. I'm sorry I am so indecisive.

title: Changing Majors
dialogue_line: A lot of people change majors. It's normal.

title: Changing Majors
dialogue_line: But not as late as I did. I hate that I'm graduating after all my friends.

title: Changing Majors
dialogue_line: You're making the right choice.

title: Dropping Out
dialogue_line: I have decided to drop out of college.

title: Dropping Out
dialogue_line: You're making the worst decision of your life.

title: Dropping Out
dialogue_line: I just don't get the point of college. It's just memorizing.

title: Dropping Out
dialogue_line: What are you going to do then?

title: Dropping Out
dialogue_line: I'm going to get a job!

title: Dropping Out
dialogue_line: As what? A burger flipper?

title: Dropping Out
dialogue_line: Don't be mean. I'm going to be rich and successful when I'm older.

title: Dropping Out
dialogue_line: It's almost impossible to be rich and successful without a college degree.

title: Dropping Out
dialogue_line: Look at Steve Jobs! He dropped out of college.

title: Dropping Out
dialogue_line: He's a rare case.

title: Dropping Out
dialogue_line: Watch me prove you wrong.

title: Dropping Out
dialogue_line: I'd like to see you try.

title: Freshman 15
dialogue_line: I gained so much weight because my college dining hall is all-you-can-eat.

title: Freshman 15
dialogue_line: It's called the "freshman 15."

title: Freshman 15
dialogue_line: What is that exactly?

title: Freshman 15
dialogue_line: It's an expression to refer to the observation that many college freshmen gain weight.

title: Freshman 15
dialogue_line: Oh, I see. I definitely got the freshman 15 then.

title: Freshman 15
dialogue_line: You should use your college's gym.

title: Freshman 15
dialogue_line: I never have time.

title: Freshman 15
dialogue_line: Oh, please! You just have to make time.

title: Freshman 15
dialogue_line: I guess I should set an hour to work out.

title: Freshman 15
dialogue_line: That's the attitude I like to hear!

title: Freshman 15
dialogue_line: Did you gain any weight?

title: Freshman 15
dialogue_line: Yeah, I just wear big clothes to hide my fat.

title: A Special Library
dialogue_line: Hi, I'm here to apply for a library card.

title: A Special Library
dialogue_line: Is this your first time applying for one?

title: A Special Library
dialogue_line: It's my first time applying for a card here.

title: A Special Library
