dialogue_line: I need to locate the laundry room. I have a load of clothes to wash.

title: Where Is the Laundry Room
dialogue_line: There is one downstairs.

title: Where Is the Laundry Room
dialogue_line: Thank you very much.

title: Where Is the Laundry Room
dialogue_line: There is also another located in the basement of the neighboring building.

title: Where Is the Laundry Room
dialogue_line: Do I have to pay at a front desk?

title: Where Is the Laundry Room
dialogue_line: No, the machines require exact change. I suggest you take quarters.

title: Where Is the Laundry Room
dialogue_line: Does the laundry room carry detergent?

title: Where Is the Laundry Room
dialogue_line: Yes, but I recommend you take your own. They're expensive.

title: Where Is the Laundry Room
dialogue_line: That's good to know. Thanks again and have a nice day.

title: Where Is the Laundry Room
dialogue_line: No problem. See you around.

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: I need to wash my clothes.

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: As a tenant of this apartment, you have access to the washer and dryer.

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: Is that so? I didn't know that.

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: It's good that you know now.

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: Are there any laundry rules I should know about?

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: Yes. There are certain hours you are allowed to use the laundry room.

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: What are the hours?

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: You are only allowed to wash clothes from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: That's good to know. Is there anything else I should know?

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: You're responsible for your belongings.

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: Well, that's common knowledge.

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: Also, there is no food or drink allowed in the laundry room.

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: Thanks for going over the rules and hours with me.

title: Laundry Room Rules
dialogue_line: It was my pleasure to help a fellow neighbor.

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: Excuse me. Can you give me a minute of your time?

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: Sure, I don't see why not.

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: Thank you kindly. I'm pretty new in town, and I think I might be lost.

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: Do you need to make a phone call?

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: No, thank you. I just need some directions.

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: Where are you trying to get to?

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: I need to find my way back to Colorado Boulevard.

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: Colorado Boulevard? Why, you're not far off from there.

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: Can you point me towards the direction of that street?

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: Gladly! You're going to walk straight down this street.

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: Alright, straight down.

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: Then you make a right after two blocks.

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: Alright, I got that.

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: Then a left at the next street, and you should be there.

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: Thank you so much.

title: Asking for Directions (1)
dialogue_line: You're welcome. Have a safe trip.

title: Asking for Directions (2)
dialogue_line: You look lost. Are you in need of any directions?

title: Asking for Directions (2)
dialogue_line: I was just about to ask someone for directions. Thank you for noticing.

title: Asking for Directions (2)
dialogue_line: Where are you from?

title: Asking for Directions (2)
dialogue_line: I'm from the inner city.

title: Asking for Directions (2)
dialogue_line: You're a long way from home then. Are you looking for a certain street?

title: Asking for Directions (2)
dialogue_line: Actually, I need directions to the nearest public bus.

title: Asking for Directions (2)
dialogue_line: Which bus number are you looking for?

title: Asking for Directions (2)
dialogue_line: I'm looking for Line 267.

title: Asking for Directions (2)
dialogue_line: I know that bus. The stop is just around that corner.

title: Asking for Directions (2)
dialogue_line: Where? Over there?

title: Asking for Directions (2)
dialogue_line: In that direction.

title: Asking for Directions (2)
dialogue_line: Thank you so much. I appreciate the help.

title: Asking for Directions (2)
dialogue_line: You're welcome. Safe travels, my friend.

title: Neighbors and Help (1)
dialogue_line: Hello, neighbor. How are you today?

title: Neighbors and Help (1)
dialogue_line: I'm fine. How are you?

title: Neighbors and Help (1)
dialogue_line: I'm doing alright. I was wondering if I could ask you for a favor.

title: Neighbors and Help (1)
dialogue_line: Sure. What is it?

title: Neighbors and Help (1)
dialogue_line: I'll be away for the weekend. Could you take care of my dog?

title: Neighbors and Help (1)
dialogue_line: Yeah, I'd love to. I'm great with dogs.

title: Neighbors and Help (1)
dialogue_line: Oh, that's fantastic! Thank you very much!

title: Neighbors and Help (1)
dialogue_line: Is there anything I need to know about your dog?

title: Neighbors and Help (1)
dialogue_line: Not really. She's an old, calm, and friendly dog. You'll have no trouble.

title: Neighbors and Help (1)
dialogue_line: Alright. I'll give you a call if I have any questions or concerns.

title: Neighbors and Help (1)
dialogue_line: I'll bring her over in a few minutes along with her food. Thanks again!

title: Neighbors and Help (1)
dialogue_line: No problem. Have a safe trip.

title: Neighbors and Help (2)
dialogue_line: Are you my new neighbor?

title: Neighbors and Help (2)
dialogue_line: Yes, I am. It's nice to meet you.

title: Neighbors and Help (2)
dialogue_line: Nice to meet you, too.

title: Neighbors and Help (2)
dialogue_line: How is your day going so far?

title: Neighbors and Help (2)
dialogue_line: It's going just fine. Thank you for asking.

title: Neighbors and Help (2)
dialogue_line: Do you think you can help me with something?

title: Neighbors and Help (2)
dialogue_line: Sure, I would be glad to help, whatever I can.

title: Neighbors and Help (2)
dialogue_line: It's nothing big. I just need help carrying my old couch to the curb.

title: Neighbors and Help (2)
dialogue_line: Alright, do you want me to help you right now?

title: Neighbors and Help (2)
dialogue_line: If it's not a problem.

title: Neighbors and Help (2)
dialogue_line: No. I'll come over right now.

title: Neighbors and Help (2)
dialogue_line: Thank you for the assistance.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (1)
dialogue_line: I have a question about my one-room apartment.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (1)
dialogue_line: What do you need to know?

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (1)
dialogue_line: Am I allowed to have extra people living with me?

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (1)
dialogue_line: You are only allowed one roommate, but they'll need to have an application on file.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (1)
dialogue_line: Will I be charged extra for any additional people?

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (1)
dialogue_line: Yes. And you'll also need special permission for that.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (1)
dialogue_line: Are my visitors allowed to use any of the facilities?

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (1)
dialogue_line: Yes, but you have to be present with them.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (1)
dialogue_line: Are occasional guest sleepovers fine?

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (1)
dialogue_line: As long as it is occasional, it should be no problem.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (1)
dialogue_line: Thank you. That is all I needed to know.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (1)
dialogue_line: Alright. If you have any more questions, don't hesitate to ask.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (2)
dialogue_line: Come inside my apartment! Make yourself feel at home.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (2)
dialogue_line: Thank you for letting me visit you today.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (2)
dialogue_line: It's always nice to meet extra tenants of the apartment.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (2)
dialogue_line: How do you like the apartment so far?

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (2)
dialogue_line: I don't like it, I love it!

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (2)
dialogue_line: I'm glad to hear that.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (2)
dialogue_line: Everybody I've met is super friendly, and the apartment is beautiful.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (2)
dialogue_line: I share the exact same thoughts.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (2)
dialogue_line: How long have you been a tenant here?

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (2)
dialogue_line: Not long. I moved in a few months ago.

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (2)
dialogue_line: Would you like a drink?

title: Visitors and Extra Tenants (2)
dialogue_line: Sure, I'm kind of thirsty.

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
dialogue_line: Are you locked out of your apartment?

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
dialogue_line: It appears that I am.

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
dialogue_line: Did you forget your key inside your apartment?

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
dialogue_line: No. I think I lost it somewhere in the city.

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
dialogue_line: That's unfortunate. I think I could help you.

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
dialogue_line: Really? Do you have another key?

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
dialogue_line: No, but the landlord does.

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
dialogue_line: He doesn't live here though.

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
dialogue_line: I have his phone number. I'll just give him a call.

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
dialogue_line: Thank you. If you want, I'll talk to him myself.

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
dialogue_line: No, don't worry. I talk to him for you.

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
dialogue_line: Please I insist. I should be the one to ask for help since I'm the one who's in need of it.

title: Key and Lock Problems (1)
dialogue_line: Alright, suit yourself.

title: Key and Lock Problems (2)
dialogue_line: Help, please. My key won't open the front door to my apartment.

title: Key and Lock Problems (2)
dialogue_line: Oh, no. Let me try to help you.

title: Key and Lock Problems (2)
dialogue_line: Thank you, but I don't think there's much you can do.

title: Key and Lock Problems (2)
dialogue_line: Don't be so pessimistic. I'll help you unlock that door.

title: Key and Lock Problems (2)
dialogue_line: I already tried using the key. There's no use in trying anymore.

title: Key and Lock Problems (2)
dialogue_line: I have another idea. Care to hear it?

title: Key and Lock Problems (2)
dialogue_line: Alright, I don't have any other options.

title: Key and Lock Problems (2)
dialogue_line: Let me drive you to a locksmith.

title: Key and Lock Problems (2)
dialogue_line: What good will that do?

title: Key and Lock Problems (2)
dialogue_line: A locksmith can replace your key. The one you have now is probably broken.

title: Key and Lock Problems (2)
dialogue_line: It's worth a try, I guess.

title: Key and Lock Problems (2)
dialogue_line: There's the spirit! Come on, let's go.

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: Have you checked your smoke detectors recently?

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: No, I wasn't even aware we had smoke detectors.

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: All the apartments are equipped with them. It's an essential safety feature.

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: How do you check if they're working?

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: It's real easy. If you like, I could show you.

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: That would be nice of you.

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: Are you doing anything right now?

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: No. It's my day off work.

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: How about I come over and show you how to check them?

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: Sounds good. Come inside.

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: It's really easy to check them. Just grab one from the wall, and check the battery in the back.

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: What does this light mean?

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: If you see the light, that means it's functioning.

title: Checking Smoke Detectors
dialogue_line: So I don't need to replace the battery. Thank you so much.

title: Mailbox Key Missing
dialogue_line: Have you seen my mailbox key lying around somewhere?

title: Mailbox Key Missing
dialogue_line: No, I'm sorry. Where did you last leave it?

title: Mailbox Key Missing
dialogue_line: I thought it was in my pocket.

title: Mailbox Key Missing
dialogue_line: Is that where you last put it?

title: Mailbox Key Missing
dialogue_line: Yeah, I'm pretty sure.

title: Mailbox Key Missing
dialogue_line: Think hard. Where was it before you supposedly put in your pocket?

title: Mailbox Key Missing
dialogue_line: I was in my apartment cleaning out the kitchen.

title: Mailbox Key Missing
dialogue_line: Maybe you emptied your pockets while you were cleaning.

title: Mailbox Key Missing
dialogue_line: Wait! I think I did empty my pockets!

title: Mailbox Key Missing
dialogue_line: There you go. I knew it.

title: Mailbox Key Missing
dialogue_line: I remember now. My keys are on the kitchen counter.

title: Mailbox Key Missing
dialogue_line: That's a relief.

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: Oh, no! I'm locked out again.

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: Did I overhear you say what I think you just said?

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: That I'm locked out? Yes, that's what I said.

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: I'm sorry to hear that. How did you lock yourself out?

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: I'm pretty sure I left my key inside the apartment.

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: That happened to me before.

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: What did you do when it happened?

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: I climbed into the window to unlock the door.

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: That doesn't sound like such a bad idea.

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: Unless you have a spare key.

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: It seems I'm going to have to break into my own apartment.

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: Be careful not to break anything.

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: Is that what you did when you did the same?

title: Locked Out
dialogue_line: Accidentally, yes, I did.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (1)
dialogue_line: I'm sorry to knock on your door at this late hour.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (1)
dialogue_line: Is there something wrong?

title: A Noisy Neighbor (1)
dialogue_line: It's just one minor issue I have to bring up with you.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (1)
dialogue_line: Don't tell me. I think I know what it is.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (1)
dialogue_line: I hope you can understand.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (1)
dialogue_line: I completely do. I'm so sorry. I didn't realize how loud my television was.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (1)
dialogue_line: It's just a little too loud. If you could just lower it a tad bit.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (1)
dialogue_line: This is so embarrassing for me. You have my sincerest apology.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (1)
dialogue_line: No, that's alright. It happens to all of us at one point.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (1)
dialogue_line: It's these new speakers that I bought. I'm just learning how to use them.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (1)
dialogue_line: Please, say no more. Let's just put the matter to rest.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (1)
dialogue_line: This won't happen again.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: Can I help you with something?

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: Yes, I hope that you can.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: What seems to be the problem?

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: Do you know what time it is?

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: It's eleven o'clock at night.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: Actually, it was eleven an hour ago.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: Oh, you're right about that.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: I live right next door to you, and your loud music is keeping me awake.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: Is that so? It's really that loud?

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: Yes, it is. I'm going to have to ask you to lower down the noise.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: Sorry about that. I'll lower down the music.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: Thank you. Please be a little more considerate next time.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: I will. Again, I apologize for the noise. It won't happen again.

title: A Noisy Neighbor (2)
dialogue_line: I sure hope it won't.

title: Plumbing Problems
dialogue_line: Who do I have the pleasure to speak to this afternoon?

title: Plumbing Problems
dialogue_line: Hello, my name is James.

title: Plumbing Problems
dialogue_line: You've called your city's local plumber. What can I do for you?

title: Plumbing Problems
dialogue_line: Thank you. I have a problem with my gas line.

title: Plumbing Problems
dialogue_line: I specialize in gas line problems. You're in luck.

title: Plumbing Problems
dialogue_line: I'm glad to hear that. Can you come to my home today?

title: Plumbing Problems
dialogue_line: I'm booked today, sorry. Can I come tomorrow instead?

title: Plumbing Problems
dialogue_line: Tomorrow works for me too. Is three o'clock fine?

title: Plumbing Problems
dialogue_line: Yes, that hour is fine.

title: Plumbing Problems
dialogue_line: What are your rates?

title: Plumbing Problems
dialogue_line: I will provide you with an estimate free of charge when I see the problem.

title: Plumbing Problems
dialogue_line: Alright, that sounds good. Thank you.

title: Poor Upkeep
dialogue_line: This floor is falling apart.

title: Poor Upkeep
dialogue_line: How can you tell?

title: Poor Upkeep
dialogue_line: Are you kidding me? Step over here.

title: Poor Upkeep
dialogue_line: You're right. The floor to this apartment is badly damaged.

title: Poor Upkeep
dialogue_line: See, I told you so.

title: Poor Upkeep
dialogue_line: What did you do that made the floor like this?

title: Poor Upkeep
dialogue_line: It wasn't me. It was like this when I moved in here.

title: Poor Upkeep
dialogue_line: You should report this poor upkeep to the landlord.

title: Poor Upkeep
dialogue_line: You're right. I'll call him the first thing in the morning.

title: Poor Upkeep
dialogue_line: Be carful not to damage the floor any further.

title: Poor Upkeep
dialogue_line: I won't. I hope the landlord replaces the floor soon.

title: Poor Upkeep
dialogue_line: He probably will.

title: Reporting a Problem to the Landlord
dialogue_line: The floor to my apartment is badly damaged.

title: Reporting a Problem to the Landlord
dialogue_line: I'm sorry to hear that. How bad is it?

title: Reporting a Problem to the Landlord
dialogue_line: It's practically falling apart.

title: Reporting a Problem to the Landlord
dialogue_line: Did some kind of accident cause this?

title: Reporting a Problem to the Landlord
dialogue_line: None that I could've made. I think your previous tenant might have caused this.

title: Reporting a Problem to the Landlord
dialogue_line: That makes sense. He took poor care of the apartment.

title: Reporting a Problem to the Landlord
dialogue_line: I could see that myself.

title: Reporting a Problem to the Landlord
dialogue_line: I'll have that fixed as soon as possible.

title: Reporting a Problem to the Landlord
dialogue_line: If it's not too much trouble, may I request one more thing?

title: Reporting a Problem to the Landlord
dialogue_line: Is there anything else wrong in the apartment?

title: Reporting a Problem to the Landlord
dialogue_line: It's just my bedroom window. I can't seem to get it open.

title: Reporting a Problem to the Landlord
dialogue_line: I'll have that window taken care of as well.

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: You seem a little lost.

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: I actually am lost. How could you tell?

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: The look on your face said it all.

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: Maybe you could help me.

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: I'd be happy to help.

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: I'm not sure what bus I'm supposed to take.

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: What's your destination?

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: I'm heading to Westwood.

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: I've been there several times by bus.

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: You have? What bus did you take?

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: The Line 720 takes you directly there.

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: Where is the stop for that bus?

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: Right at the corner over there.

title: Which Bus to Take (1)
dialogue_line: Thank you very much.

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: Excuse me, sir. Care to help me?

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: What can I do for you?

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: I'm trying to make way back home, and I'm not sure what bus to take.

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: Where do you live?

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: I live in the city of Bell.

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: I've never heard of that city.

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: I'm not surprised you haven't. It's not a big city.

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: What are the surrounding cities?

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: They're Maywood, Huntington Park, and Downey.

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: I'm familiar with the city of Downey.

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: Would you know how to get there by bus?

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: Yes. Take 764 bus northbound.

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: Thank you. I'll find my home from there.

title: Which Bus to Take (2)
dialogue_line: You're welcome. Good luck, and take care.

title: Taking the Bus for the First Time
dialogue_line: I've never taken the bus before.

title: Taking the Bus for the First Time
dialogue_line: This is your first time? Wow, that's surprising.

title: Taking the Bus for the First Time
dialogue_line: How is it surprising?

title: Taking the Bus for the First Time
dialogue_line: I've just never met anyone who hasn't taken the bus before.

title: Taking the Bus for the First Time
dialogue_line: Well, now you could say you have.

title: Taking the Bus for the First Time
dialogue_line: Why are you finally taking the bus for the first time?

title: Taking the Bus for the First Time
dialogue_line: I figured it would be a good way to save money.

title: Taking the Bus for the First Time
dialogue_line: That's for sure considering the price of gas nowadays.

title: Taking the Bus for the First Time
dialogue_line: No kidding. Listen, I have a few questions about taking the bus.

title: Taking the Bus for the First Time
dialogue_line: What are they? I'm sure I could answer them for you.

title: Taking the Bus for the First Time
dialogue_line: I was wondering how often the buses pass by.

title: Taking the Bus for the First Time
dialogue_line: They usually pass by every thirty minutes, but it could vary.

title: Paying the Bus Fare
dialogue_line: Hello, bus driver. How are you doing today?

title: Paying the Bus Fare
dialogue_line: Good afternoon. I'm doing just fine.

title: Paying the Bus Fare
dialogue_line: This is my first time taking the bus.

title: Paying the Bus Fare
dialogue_line: Is that so? I hope you have enough change for the bus fare.

title: Paying the Bus Fare
dialogue_line: Yes, I do. Don't you worry about a thing.

title: Paying the Bus Fare
dialogue_line: That's good. Just put your money into the machine and take a seat.

title: Paying the Bus Fare
dialogue_line: It's one dollar and fifty cents for the fare, correct?

title: Paying the Bus Fare
dialogue_line: Yes, that's correct.

title: Paying the Bus Fare
dialogue_line: Thank you. There you are. I told you I had enough.

title: Paying the Bus Fare
dialogue_line: Thank you, you're fine to sit down now.

title: Paying the Bus Fare
dialogue_line: Is there anywhere I can't sit?

title: Paying the Bus Fare
dialogue_line: The front seats hold priority for the elderly and disabled.

title: Asking for a Transfer (1)
dialogue_line: I'm trying to get to the city of Lakewood. Does this bus take me there?

title: Asking for a Transfer (1)
dialogue_line: No, I'm sorry. You're going to have to make a transfer.

title: Asking for a Transfer (1)
dialogue_line: Can't I simply get on another bus?

title: Asking for a Transfer (1)
dialogue_line: You could, but you would have to pay again.

title: Asking for a Transfer (1)
dialogue_line: I don't think I want to pay again.

title: Asking for a Transfer (1)
dialogue_line: Especially when a transfer is free.

title: Asking for a Transfer (1)
dialogue_line: How do I get a transfer?

title: Asking for a Transfer (1)
dialogue_line: All you have to do is approach the bus driver and ask for one.

title: Asking for a Transfer (1)
dialogue_line: Alright, I will do that right now. Thanks for the help.

title: Asking for a Transfer (1)
dialogue_line: Have a safe bus ride.

title: Asking for a Transfer (2)
dialogue_line: Excuse me. I would like to get a transfer.

title: Asking for a Transfer (2)
dialogue_line: Do you have your day pass with you?

title: Asking for a Transfer (2)
dialogue_line: It's a month pass. Is that okay?

title: Asking for a Transfer (2)
dialogue_line: Yes, that's fine. Please scan your pass on the machine.

title: Asking for a Transfer (2)
dialogue_line: Did it scan?

title: Asking for a Transfer (2)
dialogue_line: Yes it did. Alright, it's going to cost one dollar for the transfer.

title: Asking for a Transfer (2)
dialogue_line: I'm sorry. I don't think I have enough for the transfer.

title: Asking for a Transfer (2)
dialogue_line: Is this your first time getting a transfer?

title: Asking for a Transfer (2)
dialogue_line: Yes, it is. I thought transfers were free.

title: Asking for a Transfer (2)
dialogue_line: I'll let it pass since it's your first time.

title: Asking for a Transfer (2)
dialogue_line: Thank you so much. It won't happen again.

title: Asking for a Transfer (2)
dialogue_line: Don't mention it. Just be prepared the next time.

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: What's wrong? You seem unsure about something.

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: I'm unsure of where to get off the bus.

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: Where are you coming from?

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: I got on the bus in Pasadena.

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: Where are you heading to?

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: I'm trying to go downtown.

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: I could tell you where to get off.

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: You can? That would be very nice of you. Thank you.

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: I'm happy to help a stranger anytime.

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: What's the street that I should get off on?

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: You're going to get off on Wilshire.

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: How much further is that stop?

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: The bus is fifteen minutes away from there.

title: Where to Get Off (1)
dialogue_line: We're pretty close then.

title: Where to Get Off (2)
dialogue_line: Is this your first time riding the bus?

title: Where to Get Off (2)
dialogue_line: Yes, it is. How did you tell?

title: Where to Get Off (2)
dialogue_line: The look on your face gave it away.

title: Where to Get Off (2)
dialogue_line: I really do look that confused?

title: Where to Get Off (2)
dialogue_line: I'm sorry to say so, but don't be embarrassed.

title: Where to Get Off (2)
dialogue_line: You seem friendly. Would you mind answering a question?

title: Where to Get Off (2)
dialogue_line: No, not at all. What's your question?

title: Where to Get Off (2)
dialogue_line: I'm trying to get to the airport. Do you know where I should get off?

title: Where to Get Off (2)
dialogue_line: This bus actually drops you off right in front of the airport.

title: Where to Get Off (2)
dialogue_line: I know that it does. I've just forgotten on what street.

title: Where to Get Off (2)
dialogue_line: The stop will say LAX Airport.

title: Where to Get Off (2)
dialogue_line: Oh, really. That's pretty obvious.

title: Complaining about a Late Bus (1)
dialogue_line: This bus is taking so long!

title: Complaining about a Late Bus (1)
dialogue_line: You're right. It's running late.

title: Complaining about a Late Bus (1)
dialogue_line: It was supposed to be here thirty minutes ago.

title: Complaining about a Late Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Just be a little more patient. I'm sure it'll arrive any minute now.

title: Complaining about a Late Bus (1)
dialogue_line: We're going to be so late, all because of this late bus.

title: Complaining about a Late Bus (1)
dialogue_line: The buses usually come on time.

title: Complaining about a Late Bus (1)
dialogue_line: They should always be on time. Don't they know people depend on their swiftness?

title: Complaining about a Late Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Just wait a little longer.

title: Complaining about a Late Bus (1)
dialogue_line: I'm tired of waiting. This bus is never going to come.

title: Complaining about a Late Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Complaining is not helping the situation.

title: Complaining about a Late Bus (1)
dialogue_line: I have every right to be complaining!

title: Complaining about a Late Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Suit yourself then.

title: Complaining about a Late bus (2)
dialogue_line: How long have we've been waiting for this bus?

title: Complaining about a Late bus (2)
dialogue_line: Almost one hour. I think it's late.

title: Complaining about a Late bus (2)
dialogue_line: It is late! What is taking this bus driver so long to get here?

title: Complaining about a Late bus (2)
dialogue_line: Probably traffic. You know how traffic could be on the weekends.

title: Complaining about a Late bus (2)
dialogue_line: That is not a good excuse. Bus drivers should know how to maneuver past traffic.

title: Complaining about a Late bus (2)
dialogue_line: That's easy for you to say.

title: Complaining about a Late bus (2)
dialogue_line: I just want the bus to arrive already. I want to go home.

title: Complaining about a Late bus (2)
dialogue_line: It's bound to arrive any minute now.

title: Complaining about a Late bus (2)
dialogue_line: I hope you're right. My patience has all extinguished.

title: Complaining about a Late bus (2)
dialogue_line: Wait. I think I see it coming in the distance!

title: Complaining about a Late bus (2)
dialogue_line: Thank goodness! I couldn't possibly wait another minute.

title: Complaining about a Late bus (2)
dialogue_line: False alarm. It was just a truck. Sorry about that.

title: Getting Off Too Early (1)
dialogue_line: Wait a second. Where am I?

title: Getting Off Too Early (1)
dialogue_line: You're in Los Angeles.

title: Getting Off Too Early (1)
dialogue_line: Los Angeles? Oh, no. I got off the bus too early.

title: Getting Off Too Early (1)
dialogue_line: Where were you going to?

title: Getting Off Too Early (1)
dialogue_line: I need to get to Westwood.

title: Getting Off Too Early (1)
dialogue_line: Just hop on the next bus.

title: Getting Off Too Early (1)
dialogue_line: And wait exactly how long for it?

title: Getting Off Too Early (1)
dialogue_line: Not long. I can tell you that.

title: Getting Off Too Early (1)
dialogue_line: Maybe I should just take a taxi.

title: Getting Off Too Early (1)
dialogue_line: Take my word, young man, the next bus won't take long.

title: Getting Off Too Early (1)
dialogue_line: When will the next one arrive?

title: Getting Off Too Early (1)
dialogue_line: I'd say in less than ten minutes.

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: Is this Gage Avenue?

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: No, this is Florence Avenue.

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: Oh, no. I must've gotten off the bus too early.

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: Don't worry. We all make mistakes.

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: Thank you for that.

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: Maybe I can help you get to where you're going.

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: Are you sure it wouldn't be any trouble?

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: No trouble at all.

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: How much further is Gage Avenue?

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: Not too far. It's a fifteen-minute walk from here.

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: Can you please point me towards the right direction?

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: Sure. You're going to head south from here.

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: South is that way?

title: Getting Off Too Early (2)
dialogue_line: No that's north. South is the opposite way.

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: I have so many places to go today.

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: Are you planning on taking the bus?

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: Yes. I'm going to have to bring so much bus fare with me.

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: You don't have to. Just buy a pass for the day.

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: A pass? What's that?

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: It comes in the form of a card that allows you to pass on any bus.

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: And is it just for one day?

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: You can buy a bus pass for the day, week, month, and even a year.

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: I didn't know that. How do I buy one?

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: You can ask for one on the bus.

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: How much does the card cost?

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: The card itself is one dollar, but a pass for the day is five.

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: I only need to bring six dollars with me today?

title: How to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: Yes. Unless you want to buy a pass for a week or longer.

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: Hello, I would like to buy a bus pass.

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: Do you have a card to use for your pass?

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: What kind of card do I need?

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: It's a card I can provide you with.

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: Is it free to get?

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: No, but it's only one dollar.

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: It's nearly free. Here's the dollar.

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: Do you also have money for the day pass?

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: Yes, I do. How much is it for a day pass again?

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: Exactly five dollars.

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: I do have enough. Do I give you the money?

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: No, please deposit it into the machine.

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: Alright then. There you go.

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: Here's your pass for the day. Do take care of that.

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: Thank you very much. I'll hold on to it.

title: How to Buy a Pass (2)
dialogue_line: You're welcome. Have a nice day.

title: How to Buy a Pass (3)
dialogue_line: I have never bought a bus pass before. Do you know how?

title: How to Buy a Pass (3)
dialogue_line: Yes I do. You can buy it from the bus driver.

title: How to Buy a Pass (3)
dialogue_line: What kinds of bus passes do they have?

title: How to Buy a Pass (3)
dialogue_line: They have day passes, week passes, and month passes.

title: How to Buy a Pass (3)
dialogue_line: How much is the monthly pass?

title: How to Buy a Pass (3)
dialogue_line: It's 64 dollars, but if you're a student, you can get it for 35 dollars.

title: How to Buy a Pass (3)
dialogue_line: Yes. I'm a student. I think I'll get the monthly pass.

title: How to Buy a Pass (3)
dialogue_line: Since you'll be getting the student discount, you need to show your student I.D.

title: How to Buy a Pass (3)
dialogue_line: Alright. Thank you for your help.

title: How to Buy a Pass (3)
dialogue_line: No problem. Anytime!

title: Missing the Bus Stop (1)
dialogue_line: Does this bus stop at Normandy Street?

title: Missing the Bus Stop (1)
dialogue_line: Yes, it does. Is that your stop?

title: Missing the Bus Stop (1)
dialogue_line: Yes, it is. How much further until the bus gets there?

title: Missing the Bus Stop (1)
dialogue_line: Actually, the bus passed by Normandy Street ten minutes ago.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (1)
dialogue_line: I missed my bus stop? Darn it, I knew this would happen to me.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (1)
dialogue_line: Are you on your way to work?

title: Missing the Bus Stop (1)
dialogue_line: Fortunately I'm not, or else I would've been running late.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (1)
dialogue_line: Are you meeting a friend?

title: Missing the Bus Stop (1)
dialogue_line: Yes, I am actually. I'm going to have to call him, and tell him I missed my stop.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (1)
dialogue_line: You should get off on the upcoming stop.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (1)
dialogue_line: Good idea. I'll just walk back to Normandy.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (1)
dialogue_line: It might be a long walk.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (2)
dialogue_line: Look! The bus is coming!

title: Missing the Bus Stop (2)
dialogue_line: Let's see if we can cross the street in time to catch it.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (2)
dialogue_line: I don't think we are going to make it.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (2)
dialogue_line: You are right. There it goes.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (2)
dialogue_line: When will the next bus arrive?

title: Missing the Bus Stop (2)
dialogue_line: According to the bus stop pamphlet, it should arrive in about fifteen minutes.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (2)
dialogue_line: We are going to be a bit late.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (2)
dialogue_line: I hope our friends don't get impatient.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (2)
dialogue_line: Hopefully they'll understand.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (2)
dialogue_line: It should be here any moment now.

title: Missing the Bus Stop (2)
dialogue_line: Look! Here it comes!

title: Missing the Bus Stop (2)
dialogue_line: Get your bus pass ready to hop on board!

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
dialogue_line: I don't recognize any of these streets.

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Is this your first time riding this bus?

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
dialogue_line: No, I take this bus to school every day.

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
dialogue_line: This bus always drives by these streets.

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Are you sure this is not just a new route.

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
dialogue_line: I'm pretty sure it's not.

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Perhaps it could be a detour.

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Perhaps you might be on the wrong bus.

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
dialogue_line: There's no way this is the wrong bus.

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
dialogue_line: If you don't believe me, maybe you should go ask the bus driver.

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Wait, I don't think I have to. You're right, this is the wrong bus.

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
dialogue_line: I hate to say I told you so, but I told you so.

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)
dialogue_line: How could I make such a dumb mistake?

title: On the Wrong Bus (1)

dialogue_line: Thank you. I'm new to the area.

title: On the Wrong Bus (2)
dialogue_line: Alright. Thank you very much. Have a nice day.

title: Student Discount (1)

title: Student Discount (2)
dialogue_line: Alright. I think I'll take that.

title: Talking on the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: I'm going to be so late. This bus driver is driving so slowly.

title: Talking on the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Where are you in a hurry to?

title: Talking on the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: I have doctor's appointment. I hope I make it on time.

title: Talking on the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: I'm sure you will. Where's your clinic?

title: Talking on the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: It's in Long Beach.

title: Talking on the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: I'd say we're about twenty minutes away from there.

title: Talking on the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: I sure hope you're right about that. Where are you heading to?

dialogue_line: I'm going to visit my grandma.

title: Talking on the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: She's also in Long Beach.

title: Talking on the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: What a coincidence! Do you often ride this bus to visit her?

title: Talking on the Bus (1)

title: Talking on the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: That's so sweet of you. You must love her very much.

title: Talking on the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: I do. Why are you going to the doctor's?

title: Talking on the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: To get my routine check-up. Nothing serious.

dialogue_line: It's so nice to meet friendly people on the bus.

title: Talking on the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: Sure. What do you need to know?

title: Talking on the Bus (2)

title: Talking on the Bus (2)

title: Talking on the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: Thank you. I was just making sure. I'm new to the area.

title: Talking on the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: I've lived in this area for a while.

title: Talking on the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: I'm visiting friends. If you don't mind me asking, what are you going to do?

title: Talking on the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: I'm going to visit the markets and stores there.

title: Talking on the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: Nice. Do you recommend any restaurants in Monterey Park?

title: Talking on the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: You should try the Elite Restaurant. It's pretty good.

title: Talking on the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: I'll be sure to check it out. Here comes our stop. Have a nice day.

title: Talking on the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: Nice talking to you.

title: The Bus System (1)

dialogue_line: What for? Are you visiting someone?

dialogue_line: No, I have an important job interview there.

title: The Bus System (1)
dialogue_line: How are you planning on getting there?

title: The Bus System (1)
dialogue_line: I would drive. but my car overheated last night.

title: The Bus System (1)
dialogue_line: It looks like you're going to have to ride the bus.

title: The Bus System (1)
dialogue_line: I haven't ridden the bus in years.

title: The Bus System (1)

title: The Bus System (1)

title: The Bus System (1)
dialogue_line: Speaking from experience, I could tell you how efficient it is.

title: The Bus System (1)

title: The Bus System (2)

title: The Bus System (2)
dialogue_line: How long will it take me to get there?

title: The Bus System (2)

title: The Bus System (2)
dialogue_line: That's not too bad.

title: The Bus System (2)
dialogue_line: Yeah, it really isn't.

title: The Bus System (2)
dialogue_line: Are there a lot of people on that bus?

title: The Bus System (2)
dialogue_line: The 260 bus can get pretty full except on holidays.

title: The Bus System (2)
dialogue_line: Thank you for telling me.

title: The Bus System (2)
dialogue_line: No problem. Where are you going?

title: The Bus System (2)
dialogue_line: I'll be visiting friends.

title: The Bus System (2)
dialogue_line: That's nice. I hope you have fun.

title: Why to Buy a Pass (1)

title: Why to Buy a Pass (1)

title: Why to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: I have to take six buses in total today.

title: Why to Buy a Pass (1)
dialogue_line: Why so many?

title: Why to Buy a Pass (1)

title: Why to Buy a Pass (1)

dialogue_line: I think I'll just buy the pass on the bus.

dialogue_line: Thank you very much. This is very helpful.

dialogue_line: Yes I do. You'll only need one bus.

dialogue_line: Which bus should I take?

title: Where to Take the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: You can take the 260 bus on Atlantic.

title: Where to Take the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: It should take you no longer than 30 minutes depending on traffic.

title: Where to Change the Bus (1)

dialogue_line: That would be nice of you. I just have one question.

title: Where to Change the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: You can ask as many as you want.

dialogue_line: I just need to know where to change buses.

title: Where to Change the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Well, where are you going? I need to know that.

dialogue_line: That bus takes me to Beverly Hills?

title: Where to Change the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Yes, right in the center of it.

title: Where to Change the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Where do I change into the 720 bus?

title: Where to Change the Bus (1)

title: Where to Change the Bus (1)
dialogue_line: Thank you, sir. You have been so helpful.

dialogue_line: Yes, I do. You'll need to take two buses.

title: Where to Change the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: Which bus should I take first?

title: Where to Change the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: You'll have to take the 70 bus.

title: Where to Change the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: Yes. You'll find it right across the street after you get off the 260.

title: Where to Change the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: How long might the whole trip take?

title: Where to Change the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: It might take you about 40 minutes to an hour depending on traffic.

title: Where to Change the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: Alright. Thank you very much.

title: Where to Change the Bus (2)
dialogue_line: You're welcome. Glad I could help.

title: Looking for a Job
dialogue_line: Hey Dennis, this is Ron. How's it going?

title: Looking for a Job
dialogue_line: Hi, Ron. I'm looking for a summer job. I was hoping you could help me.

title: Looking for a Job
dialogue_line: Okay, how can I help you?

title: Looking for a Job
dialogue_line: Well, I was wondering if you could hook me up at the place you work.

title: Looking for a Job
dialogue_line: No problem. I don't know if they're hiring, but I'll find out.

title: Looking for a Job
dialogue_line: Aw man, you're the bomb!

title: Looking for a Job
dialogue_line: What kind of job you are interested in doing?

title: Looking for a Job
dialogue_line: Anything you think that I can do will be fine.

title: Looking for a Job
dialogue_line: I'll talk to my boss in the morning and get back to you.

title: Looking for a Job
dialogue_line: Thanks, man. A friend in need is a friend indeed.

title: Looking for a Job
dialogue_line: Anything else you need me to do?

title: Looking for a Job
dialogue_line: No. I'm waiting to hear from you.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (1)
dialogue_line: Okay, I talked to my boss. Here's his phone number.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (1)
dialogue_line: Thanks a lot, bud. Did he say he has an open position?

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (1)
dialogue_line: No, but he said he would talk to you.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (1)
dialogue_line: That's great! Hey, thanks again.

dialogue_line: You know, you should also go online to look for work

dialogue_line: Online? Where?

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (1)
dialogue_line: There are many job search websites.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (1)
dialogue_line: Do you know any by name?

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (1)
dialogue_line: Just Google "Jobs in L.A." and you'll find some.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (1)
dialogue_line: Okay, I'll try that when I get home.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (1)
dialogue_line: You can do it on your smartphone, you know.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (1)
dialogue_line: I know, but I think it's better at home, thanks again.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I am so excited. I've got my first job interview.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Interview for what?

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Wow, that's impressive.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I'm preparing for the interview by practicing with my sister.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: What exactly are you doing?

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: We're doing mock interviews.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Is that helpful?

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: It sure is. She recorded our first interview, and pointed out things I should avoid.

dialogue_line: What are some of the things she saw?

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: She said that I said,"You know" too much, and that I looked nervous.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Cool! That should help.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: It has. I feel so confident now.

title: Preparing for a Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Well, good luck, my friend.

dialogue_line: That concludes my part of the interview. Do you have any questions for me?

dialogue_line: Okay, I have no more questions. Thank you.

title: Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Hello, may I speak to Susan, please?

title: Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Yes, this is Susan.

title: Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: This is Mr. Jones from the ABC Company.

title: Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Hello, Mr. Jones.

title: Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: I have a job offer if you are still interested.

title: Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Oh, that's wonderful. Is it for the customer service job?

title: Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Yes, we would like you to start next Monday. It pays $15 per hour.

title: Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Next Monday? Sure. I'll take it.

title: Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Super. I'll email you some literature you can read about our company.

title: Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Oh, that's great news, Mr. Jones.

title: Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Welcome to the ABC Company. We'll see you Monday.

title: Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Okay, Monday it is. See you then.

title: Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Hello.

title: Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Hi, baby, it's Joe.

title: Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: What's up, honey?

title: Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: I just got off work. What are you doing tonight?

title: Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: I don't have any plans. I'll be getting home at about 6:00.

title: Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Well, I got a hold of some Dodger tickets for tonight.

title: Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: How did you manage that?

title: Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: A friend at work was selling them. He couldn't go himself.

title: Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: That's great! Who are they playing?

title: Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: They're playing the Giants. It should be a good game.

title: Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Alright then, count me in.

title: Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Okay, I'll pick you up at 6:30.

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Hey Alice, do you have a stapler I can use?

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Of course I do. It's on my desk.

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Thanks. Mine broke two weeks ago.

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Didn't you put in a office supply request?

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I asked Joseph if he would get me one.

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I know he's in charge, but you should submit a form.

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: A form? What form?

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: An Office Supply form. Don't rely on Joseph. Put it in writing.

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Oh, I could use a couple of other supplies, too.

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Yes, by all means, get what you need.

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Where are these forms?

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I'll email it to you. Just print it, and send it in.

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Thanks, Alice.

title: Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: No problem.

title: Offering Help
dialogue_line: Hi, Michelle. What are you up to?

title: Offering Help
dialogue_line: I'm looking for work online.

title: Offering Help
dialogue_line: Cool! What kind of job are you looking for?

title: Offering Help
dialogue_line: I need a part-time job, but I'm not doing too well.

title: Offering Help
dialogue_line: I'm pretty good at this. Can I help?

title: Offering Help
dialogue_line: You sure can.

title: Offering Help
dialogue_line: Okay, let's see. You can narrow your search on this site.

title: Offering Help
dialogue_line: How can I do that?

title: Offering Help
dialogue_line: Go to the "Advanced Search" button and click on it.

title: Offering Help
dialogue_line: I see it. Okay, now what?

title: Offering Help
dialogue_line: There are many options. You can search by city, by job, or pay.

title: Offering Help
dialogue_line: I see. Let me try searching by city. Thanks.

title: Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Hello, my name is Sally. I am hoping you could help me.

title: Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Of course I can, that's what I'm here for.

title: Asking for Help
dialogue_line: I want to look for a job, but I don't have Internet access at home.

title: Asking for Help
dialogue_line: That's okay, let's get started.

title: Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Great! What do I do first?

title: Asking for Help
dialogue_line: You're going to need an email address. Do you have one?

title: Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Yes, I have my own email.

title: Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Okay, I can show you a couple of good websites for jobs.

title: Asking for Help
dialogue_line: That would be awesome! Thanks.

title: Asking for Help
dialogue_line: We also have job bulletins on that table over there. You can search through those, too.

title: Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Well, thank you, miss. I greatly appreciate your help.

title: Asking for Help
dialogue_line: No problem. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask.

title: Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Hey, Richard, I could sure use your help.

title: Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: What is it, Jerry?

title: Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I can't seem to land an interview.

title: Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Have you applied to many places?

title: Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Yes I have. I've sent out about 50 resumes.

title: Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Did you include cover letters?

title: Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: On some I did, others, no.

title: Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Well, that may be your problem. You should always include a cover letter.

title: Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Really? Why?

title: Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: It shows you took the time to research the company. HR people like that.

title: Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Okay, I will. Thanks.

title: Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: You're welcome. I think you will see more interest in your resume now.

title: How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: This is the first time I've ever had to do a timesheet.

title: How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Well, they're very easy to do.

title: How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: You've done this before. Maybe you can help me.

title: How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Sure, I can help.

title: How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: What do I need?

title: How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: You'll need your employee number.

title: How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Okay, I'll look it up.

title: How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Once you have that, all you need to do is log your hours.

title: How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: I have a good idea what hours I worked this week.

title: How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: You need to be accurate.

title: How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: It will be pretty close.

title: How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: It must be exact. You don't want to cheat the company, or yourself.

title: Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Hi! How are you?

title: Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: I'm doing good. How are you?

title: Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: I'm great, but a little nervous.

title: Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Why is that?

title: Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: I have a phone interview for a job in an hour.

title: Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: A phone interview? That's great!

title: Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: It is, but I'm convinced I'm going to mess it up.

title: Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Oh, you shouldn't say that. You'll be fine.

title: Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: I wish I had your confidence.

title: Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Just relax, and be yourself. A phone interview is easier than in person.

title: Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: That's right. I wasn't looking at it that way.

title: Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Be yourself. Don't pretend to be anyone else, and you'll do well.

title: Schedule an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Good morning, Jet Office Products.

title: Schedule an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Hello, my name is Richard Lee, and I would like to make an appointment.

title: Schedule an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Good morning, Mr. Lee. My name is Sheila.

title: Schedule an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Hello, Sheila. I was asked by Mrs. Roberts to schedule a meeting with her.

title: Schedule an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Is this for an interview?

title: Schedule an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: No, I've already interviewed with her.

title: Schedule an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Oh, I see. It's for a follow-up meeting. When are you free?

title: Schedule an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: My schedule is fairly open. When will she be available?

title: Schedule an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: How about Tuesday at 9 a.m.?

title: Schedule an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: This Tuesday, the 5th?

title: Schedule an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Yes, that's correct.

title: Schedule an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: That will be fine. I'll be there. Thanks.

title: Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Good afternoon. Jet Office Products.

title: Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Hello, my name is Richard Lee. I need to reschedule an appointment.

title: Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: I could help you with that.

title: Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: I have an appointment for 9 a.m. Tuesday that I need to change.

title: Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Who was your appointment with?

title: Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: I was scheduled to see Mrs. Roberts.

title: Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Okay. Thank you for calling.

title: Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: You're welcome. Can I reschedule?

title: Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Yes, of course. When will you be free?

title: Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Does Mrs. Roberts have any time on Wednesday?

title: Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: No, but she's free Thursday afternoon at 1:00 p.m.

title: Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: That's perfect. Thank you. I'll see her then.

title: Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Good morning, Peterson Industries.

title: Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Hello, Betty. This is Roger.

title: Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Hey, Roger. Where are you?

title: Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: I am stuck on the 60 freeway. I'm going to be late for work.

title: Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Oh, no. Any traffic accident happened?

title: Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: I really don't know, Betty. All I know is that traffic is crawling.

title: Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: I will tell your supervisor you called in late.

title: Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: That would be great, but I could tell him myself.

title: Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Well, normally that would be okay, but he's stuck in the same traffic jam.

title: Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Oh no! Really? Okay.

title: Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: At least he'll know your excuse is true!

title: Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Yes. Thank you. See you soon.

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Please have a seat.

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Thank you.

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I am very disappointed in you.

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I know. Believe me, I tried very hard to make your deadline.

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I was depending on that report.

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I know, but unexpected circumstances came up.

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Unexpected circumstances?

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Yes. I would have had it ready in time, but the computer crashed.

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: The company computer crashed?

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Yes, it did. I had weeks of saved work on it when it crashed.

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: So your report was ready?

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Yes, it was. The crash deleted all my work.

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Okay, I'll check with IT. Thanks.

title: Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: You're welcome.

title: Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Hi! How are you?

title: Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: I'm doing good. Hey, did you apply for the job?

title: Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: I sure did. I'm meeting your boss today.

title: Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Today, but it's Saturday.

title: Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: I know. I'm meeting with him at a restaurant later.

title: Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: That's cool. He must be very interested.

title: Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Can you describe him?

title: Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Sure. He's a tall Asian, who is a bit overweight with long black hair.

title: Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Well, that helps. This is the first time I will see him.

title: Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: He's really friendly, and he always wears a tie.

title: Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Okay, thanks. That helps.

title: Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: No problem, my friend. Good luck on your interview.

title: Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Hello, this is my first time here. I could use some help.

title: Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Okay, I can help. What is it you want to do?

title: Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: I need to use the database on your computer.

title: Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Well, I need something from you before I can allow you to do that.

title: Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: What do you need from me?

title: Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: I will need you to fill out this form, and show me identification.

title: Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Okay, I'll do that. I can then search your database?

title: Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Oh, no. You'll need to ask for permission.

title: Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Here's the form and my ID.

title: Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Wonderful. You can ask Mr. Lee for permission now.

title: Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: That's super. Thanks.

title: Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: You're welcome. Good luck.

title: Express Agreement
dialogue_line: how's it going?

title: Express Agreement
dialogue_line: Same old stuff. What's up?

title: Express Agreement
dialogue_line: I'm working on this project. Can you look at it?

title: Express Agreement
dialogue_line: Yeah, I'll take a look at it. What is it supposed to be?

title: Express Agreement
dialogue_line: It's a presentation on how to increase productivity.

title: Express Agreement
dialogue_line: Really? This is your project?

title: Express Agreement
dialogue_line: Yes. I came up with an idea, and my boss wants to see it.

title: Express Agreement
dialogue_line: That's awesome. Let's see it.

title: Express Agreement
dialogue_line: Well, that's it. What do you think?

title: Express Agreement
dialogue_line: I really liked the graphics. I think it's a winner.

title: Express Agreement
dialogue_line: That's great. I am really nervous.

title: Express Agreement
dialogue_line: Don't be. It is very professional, and it's a great idea.

title: Express Disagreement
dialogue_line: Hey! Are you busy?

title: Express Disagreement
dialogue_line: Not at the moment. What's going on?

title: Express Disagreement
dialogue_line: I wanted to run something by you. It's an idea for work.

title: Express Disagreement
dialogue_line: Okay, shoot.

title: Express Disagreement
dialogue_line: Well, I'm thinking of asking my boss to change the work schedule.

title: Express Disagreement
dialogue_line: Why? What's your idea?

title: Express Disagreement
dialogue_line: It's to change from five, eight-hour days, to four, ten-hour days.

title: Express Disagreement
dialogue_line: Wow. That's a big change. I don't think he'll go for it.

title: Express Disagreement
dialogue_line: It's still 40 hours per week, and everyone will get an extra day off.

title: Express Disagreement
dialogue_line: I don't think it will work. It's not a good idea.

title: Express Disagreement
dialogue_line: Why is it not a good idea?

title: Express Disagreement
dialogue_line: Companies should be open five days a week. Sorry, I don't like it.

title: Express Certainty
dialogue_line: I just read your proposal.

title: Express Certainty
dialogue_line: What did you think about it?

title: Express Certainty
dialogue_line: You definitely have some good ideas.

title: Express Certainty
dialogue_line: Well, I worked on it very hard.

title: Express Certainty
dialogue_line: I'm concerned about the cost, though.

title: Express Certainty
dialogue_line: I thought you might be. Here's a cost analysis I ran.

title: Express Certainty
dialogue_line: It says here that your proposal will pay for itself in a year.

title: Express Certainty
dialogue_line: That's what I put in the report.

title: Express Certainty
dialogue_line: That's impressive. If this is true, I'm certain this can work.

title: Express Certainty
dialogue_line: I'm quite sure it will work.

title: Express Certainty
dialogue_line: You have done a good job. We'll discuss this at our next meeting.

title: Express Certainty
dialogue_line: I appreciate your confidence in me.

title: Express Uncertainty
dialogue_line: How are you?

title: Express Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I'm doing well. How are you?

title: Express Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I'm fine, thanks. I was wondering if you read my report.

title: Express Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Yes, I did read your report.

title: Express Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Well, what did you think?

title: Express Uncertainty
dialogue_line: To be truthful, I didn't like it much.

title: Express Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Oh, no. Why not?

title: Express Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I don't have the time to discuss this now. Let's make an appointment.

title: Express Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Okay, but generally speaking, what was wrong with it?

title: Express Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I just don't feel confident in it.

title: Express Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I can make it work. All I need is time.

title: Express Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I like your enthusiasm, but it's too risky, sorry.

title: Express Likes
dialogue_line: Hello, my name is George. What's your name?

title: Express Likes
dialogue_line: Hi George, I'm Christine. Nice to meet you.

title: Express Likes
dialogue_line: Hi Christine. Have you worked here long?

title: Express Likes
dialogue_line: Almost two years now, and you?

title: Express Likes
dialogue_line: This is my first week. I really like it so far.

title: Express Likes
dialogue_line: Yes, it's a good place to work.

title: Express Likes
dialogue_line: I like how it seems so organized.

title: Express Likes
dialogue_line: That's one of the things I like best, too.

title: Express Likes
dialogue_line: The benefits aren't bad, either.

title: Express Likes
dialogue_line: No, they're not. I especially like the health plan.

title: Express Likes
dialogue_line: That's great. I'll be eligible in July for that.

title: Express Likes
dialogue_line: You're going to like it here. This is the best place I've worked.

title: Express Dislikes
dialogue_line: Oh, I am so tired.

title: Express Dislikes
dialogue_line: I know what you mean.

title: Express Dislikes
dialogue_line: I don't know if I can continue working like this.

title: Express Dislikes
dialogue_line: I know. I've been doing it a lot longer than you.

title: Express Dislikes
dialogue_line: Isn't there something we can do?

title: Express Dislikes
dialogue_line: I have complained about the double shifts before.

title: Express Dislikes
dialogue_line: What has management told you?

title: Express Dislikes
dialogue_line: They said they are hiring more people, and that this is temporary.

title: Express Dislikes
dialogue_line: I need this job, but I don't like these hours at all.

title: Express Dislikes
dialogue_line: Just hang in there. I'm sure it will change.

title: Express Dislikes
dialogue_line: It'd better change, and the sooner the better.

title: Express Dislikes
dialogue_line: You're right. People may start leaving.

title: Making Promises
dialogue_line: I know a lot of you have been working double shifts lately.

title: Making Promises
dialogue_line: Yes, we have.

title: Making Promises
dialogue_line: I am pleased to say that we have hired some help.

title: Making Promises
dialogue_line: Alright! That's great. When do they start?

title: Making Promises
dialogue_line: One person will start next week. The others will follow.

title: Making Promises
dialogue_line: Only one? You promised more help last week.

title: Making Promises
dialogue_line: I know I did, but the search has taken longer than I thought.

title: Making Promises
dialogue_line: Oh, no. That's terrible.

title: Making Promises
dialogue_line: Don't worry. I promise you all, I'll get some help.

title: Making Promises
dialogue_line: Okay, thanks. These 16-hour days are killing us.

title: Making Promises
dialogue_line: Help is on the way. I promise.

title: Making Promises
dialogue_line: That's good enough for us.

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: Hey Diana, why so glum?

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: Aw Bobby, I just lost my job.

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: Oh, no. What happened?

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: The company is relocating to another state.

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: That's tough, Diana. What are you going to do now?

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: I'm looking for a new job. I need to pay my bills.

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: Are you filing for unemployment benefits?

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: I don't think I'm eligible. I only worked there three months.

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: Sure, you're eligible. You worked long enough.

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: I didn't know that.

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: I think you only have to work for two weeks to be eligible.

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: That's great. I hope I can get it.

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: You'll never know untill you try.

title: Unemployment Insurance
dialogue_line: Thanks, Bobby. You're a good friend.

title: Calling EDD to Report Unemployment
dialogue_line: Good Morning! EDD, how can I help you?

title: Calling EDD to Report Unemployment
dialogue_line: Hello, I recently lost my job. Can I file for unemployment?

title: Calling EDD to Report Unemployment
dialogue_line: Yes, you certainly can.

title: Calling EDD to Report Unemployment
dialogue_line: How do I file a claim?

title: Calling EDD to Report Unemployment
dialogue_line: The easiest way is to go online.

title: Calling EDD to Report Unemployment
dialogue_line: All right, I will. What's the website.

title: Calling EDD to Report Unemployment
dialogue_line: Just do a search for "EDD" and you will see the site.

title: Calling EDD to Report Unemployment
dialogue_line: I will, but what if I need help?

title: Calling EDD to Report Unemployment
dialogue_line: There's online help, but if you still need help, call back.

title: Calling EDD to Report Unemployment
dialogue_line: Okay, I will. Thank you.

title: How to Collect Unemployment Benefits
dialogue_line: Hello. What are you doing here?

title: How to Collect Unemployment Benefits
dialogue_line: Hi! I lost my job, so here I am at the EDD.

title: How to Collect Unemployment Benefits
dialogue_line: That's rough. I lost my job three months ago.

title: How to Collect Unemployment Benefits
dialogue_line: I didn't know that. Maybe you can help me apply.

title: How to Collect Unemployment Benefits
dialogue_line: Sure, I can help. You just need some basic information about your job history.

title: How to Collect Unemployment Benefits
dialogue_line: I have that information for the company I last worked for.

title: How to Collect Unemployment Benefits
dialogue_line: They ask for information on all places you worked for the last 18 months.

title: How to Collect Unemployment Benefits
dialogue_line: I can get that. What else do they ask?

title: How to Collect Unemployment Benefits
dialogue_line: Name, residence, addresses, that kind of stuff, and most importantly, why you're not working.

title: How to Collect Unemployment Benefits
dialogue_line: You mean if I quit, or was fired.

title: How to Collect Unemployment Benefits
dialogue_line: Yes, and be truthful. They will call your former employers.

title: How to Collect Unemployment Benefits
dialogue_line: Thanks. That helps a lot.

title: Questions about the Forms
dialogue_line: Do you know what forms I need to file an unemployment claim?

title: Questions about the Forms
dialogue_line: You can go to an EDD office or fill out a form on their website to open a claim.

title: Questions about the Forms
dialogue_line: Is it really that simple?

title: Questions about the Forms
dialogue_line: It sure is. It is easier to do online.

title: Questions about the Forms
dialogue_line: Why would I want to do it online?

title: Questions about the Forms
dialogue_line: It's faster, and you can do it from home, or wherever you have Internet access.

title: Questions about the Forms
dialogue_line: Do you know the website?

title: Questions about the Forms
dialogue_line: Yes, it's edd.ca.gov. It's easy to use.

title: Questions about the Forms
dialogue_line: Then what do I do?

title: Questions about the Forms
dialogue_line: You will have to find a link that says "Apply Here", and click on it.

title: Questions about the Forms
dialogue_line: Is that all there is to it?

title: Questions about the Forms
dialogue_line: That's it. You're good to go.

title: At the EDD Office
dialogue_line: Good morning. How can I help you?

title: At the EDD Office
dialogue_line: Good morning to you. Yes. I'd like to file a claim.

title: At the EDD Office
dialogue_line: Okay, I can help you with that.

title: At the EDD Office
dialogue_line: All right. What do I need to do?

title: At the EDD Office
dialogue_line: The easiest way to file a claim is online. You can use our computers for that.

title: At the EDD Office
dialogue_line: That's wonderful. Do I need to log in?

title: At the EDD Office
dialogue_line: No, you don't. Our computers are connected directly to the EDD.

title: At the EDD Office
dialogue_line: But I don't know if I'm eligible for benefits.

title: At the EDD Office
dialogue_line: The EDD will make that decision. Just fill in the forms as best you can.

title: At the EDD Office
dialogue_line: Thank you. I'll use the computer here to file the claim right away.

title: At the EDD Office
dialogue_line: If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask.

title: At the EDD Office
dialogue_line: All right. I will. Thanks once again.

title: Payment not Received
dialogue_line: Did you bring the mail in today?

title: Payment not Received
dialogue_line: Yeah. I got it right here.

title: Payment not Received
dialogue_line: Oh, great. I'm waiting for my unemployment check. It's late.

title: Payment not Received
dialogue_line: Sorry to tell you, your payment didn't come today.

title: Payment not Received
dialogue_line: No way. Darn it! It's more than a week late!

title: Payment not Received
dialogue_line: Why don't you call EDD? I think they can tell you where it is.

title: Payment not Received
dialogue_line: I definitely need to call them.

title: Payment not Received
dialogue_line: I think it's an automated system.

title: Payment not Received
dialogue_line: Oh darn. I don't like automated systems.

title: Payment not Received
dialogue_line: The EDD system is not so bad.

title: Payment not Received
dialogue_line: Okay, I'll call. This is the longest the check has taken to get to me.

title: Payment not Received
dialogue_line: If you have problems with the system, you can speak to a person by dialing "0".

title: Reduced Payments
dialogue_line: I just got off the phone with the EDD.

title: Reduced Payments
