dialogue_line: What are you not good at?

title: 4. Job Interview (1)
dialogue_line: I am impatient with myself at times and am hard on myself.

title: 4. Job Interview (1)
dialogue_line: We appreciate hearing that about you!

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Good morning. Thank you for the interview.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: No problem. Now, do you prefer working with others or flying solo?

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Actually, I enjoy both.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: So, what is most important to you in a job? Do you need job security or professional growth and a chance to advance?

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I need job security.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Would you be able to relocate?

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I am open to relocating.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: What are your annual salary requirements?

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I need at least 75,000 per year.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I'll keep that in mind. Thank you for coming in today. We'll be in touch.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Thank you so much for interviewing me this evening.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Happy to meet with you. Now, do you prefer group projects?

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I like to work alone on some things and then bring those things to the group.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Do you value a steady job more or one that offers a chance to move ahead?

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I want to grow in my job and move ahead.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Could you work for us in another state, if need be?

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I need to stay in the area because of family.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: How much do you need to make per year?

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: 75,000 per year.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Yikes! Thanks for your interest in this job. We'll be getting back to you.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I really appreciate the opportunity to interview for this position.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I was wondering if you like team projects, or projects that you work on alone.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I like to work on group projects that value and need each individual's contributions.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Are you most interested in a good steady job with benefits or one that will allow you to quickly advance?

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I have children so a steady job is important but I would like a chance to advance.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: How would you feel about relocating to another state?

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: I could not relocate in the next year, but might be open to it in the future.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: Do you know how much this job offers per year?

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: A minimum of 75,000 per year.

title: 5. Job Interview (2)
dialogue_line: OK, well, that's all I need to know for now. If something comes up, we'll be contacting you.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: May I ask you how much this position pays per year?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: This job pays sixty-five thousand dollars per year.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: What kind of benefits does this job have?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: This job provides full medical, dental, and disability.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: What type of vacation time do we get?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: You get 3 weeks paid vacation that you may use as you wish.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: Do we have a 401K?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: We offer a 401K with some matching funds available depending on length of service.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: What type of professional development do you offer?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: We provide up-to-date training on state of the art equipment.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: Where do I sign up for my benefits package?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: Down the hall. I'll show you when the interview is over.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: What is the annual salary for this job?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: The annual salary is sixty-five thousand dollars per year.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: What does the benefits package include?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: This job pays for half of your medical, dental, and disability.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: Do we get paid time off?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: You have a total of 21 days paid time off which can be used for vacation, personal, or sick leave.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: How about retirement?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: We still offer a traditional retirement plan that pays out if you stay with the company for 5 years or more.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: Can I get company provided specialized training?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: We offer full tuition reimbursement for job related classes.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: Where is the benefits office?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: It's on the second floor in Suite 201.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: What will I earn per year in this job?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: You can expect to earn sixty-five thousand dollars per year.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: Are we covered by a good benefits plan?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: The job has a menu plan where you are given a fixed amount of money and you choose what you most need in terms of benefits.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: Can we take personal days off?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: You get 2 weeks paid vacation and an additional 10 days of sick leave.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: What do you offer in terms of a retirement plan?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: We do not currently offer any retirement plan.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: Do you reimburse for education that relates to my job?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: We allow several weeks release time each year for our employees to attend job-related seminars and conferences.

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: Do you have a benefits brochure?

title: 6. Asking Questions at an Interview
dialogue_line: Whoa! Who said you got the job?

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Is this Mr. Wallace?

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Yes, this is Mr. Wallace.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Mr. Wallace, this is the Xenon Company.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Oh, hello, how are you doing?

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Mr. Wallace, we were very pleased with your interview and would like to offer you the position.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Wonderful! I am very happy to be able to join your organization.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: We are interested in having you begin as soon as possible, perhaps in two weeks?

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Yes, that would be perfect!

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: We will see you then.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Good morning, may I speak with Mr. Wallace, please?

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: You are speaking to him, may I help you?

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Mr. Wallace, this is the Xenon Company calling to speak with you.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Yes, good to hear from you!

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: We are calling you today to offer you the job you interviewed for last week.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: That's great! I am looking forward to working for you.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Would you be able to begin working for us in two weeks?

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: I could begin working then with no problem.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Welcome to our company; we will see you then.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: This is Jason Brack calling, is Mr. Wallace in?

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Yes, how may I help you?

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: I am calling you from the Xenon Company.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Yes, I was hoping to hear from you!

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: You had great interview and we are pleased to be able to offer you a position.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Excellent. I will consider it an honor to join your organization.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Would two weeks from now be a good start date for you?

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: That would be great. I could give notice to my current job and start with you on that date.

title: 7. Accepting a Job Offer
dialogue_line: Glad that will work for both of us; I look forward to seeing you then.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: This is Ray. May I speak with Lee?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Yes, this is Lee speaking.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Lee. How are you today?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Oh, things are going great. What's up?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: I was wondering if you could meet me tomorrow for lunch?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Sure! Where did you have in mind?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: I was thinking of Joe's in the village.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: I love that place. Sure, let's go there.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Fine then, I'll meet you around twelve.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: I'll see you there. Look forward to it.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Good morning, this is Ray speaking. Is Lee in?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Hi, Ray. This is Lee.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Good morning, Lee. How is it going with you today?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Things are wonderful. What can I help you with?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Could we meet for lunch tomorrow to discuss the new project?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: That would be great. What restaurant did you have in mind?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: We could go to Lozano's downtown.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: That would be perfect. It's a nice quiet place to meet.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: I'll see you there around twelve then.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: I am looking forward to meeting with you. See you then.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: May I speak with Lee? This is Ray.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Lee here.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Lee, I thought that was you. How's it going?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: I am doing well. How can I help you?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: I would like to treat you to lunch tomorrow so I can get some suggestions from you.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Sounds like a plan. Where would you like to meet?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: How about the new Chinese place next door?

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: Yes, that would work well for me.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: I'll join you around twelve for lunch then.

title: 8. Talking on the Phone
dialogue_line: It's a go then. See you there.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Excuse me. I was wondering how to order office supplies.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: We have a requisition form on the company web site. What type of supplies do you need?

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I need paper, ink cartridges, and paper clips.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: How quickly will you need your supplies?

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I need all of my supplies right away.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: We also will have to check your department budget. Do you know how much money you have for office supplies?

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I will check to see what my budget is.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Would you like these supplies delivered or would you like to pick them up?

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Please deliver them to my office.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Fine, well just send the form to us and we will let you know as soon as your supplies come in. Have a good day!

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Thank you!

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I need help in ordering my office supplies.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: You can print out a copy of the Order Supply Form from our company web site and turn it into me. What will you be needing?

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I need ink cartridges, staples, and Post-its.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Will you need all of them right away or can some wait?

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Some of these can wait but there are a few things that I need right away.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: You can only buy supplies that you have a budget for. Do you know what your budget is?

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: We have plenty of money for office supplies.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: You can pick these supplies up or they can be delivered to your building. Which would you prefer?

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I want to pick them up.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Well, just finish the request and we will contact you when the supplies come in. Have a good day!

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: You too!

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: How do I order the office supplies that I need?

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Fill out this form with whatever you need. What do you need the most?

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I need many things.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I can get a few of them right away, but might have to order some.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I can wait a few days for these items.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Make sure that you have money allocated for these supplies. How much do you have for office supplies?

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I don't think we have very much money for supplies, but we have a little.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Would you like them delivered to you or can you come get them here?

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: I am not sure yet.

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: When you finish completing the request form, we will order and let you know when the supplies are here. Have a great day!

title: 9. Making a Request for Office Supplies
dialogue_line: Good-bye!

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: I was wondering if you need any help on your new project.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: Sure! That would be great! Are you good at writing or would you rather do the computer work?

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: I would like to help with the computer work.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: Great! We are going to be working in teams of three. Are you OK working with others?

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: Yes, I like working like that.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: We will begin next Monday. Would you be available then?

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: Yes, I can be there.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: Well, if you could send me your basic background information before next Monday, it would be useful.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: I will send the information to you.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: Well then, thanks for your help. Have a great day!

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: Would you like me to help you on your new project?

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: I would love the help! Would you prefer helping with the writing part or is programming more your thing?

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: I would enjoy helping with the writing portion.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: Perfect! You'll be working alone on that portion. Do you like to work alone?

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: That is OK sometimes.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: Our first meeting is next Monday. Could you meet with us at that time?

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: No, I can't be there.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: Please send me your background information before the meeting so I can look at it.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: I can send that information to you.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: OK. I look forward to working with you. Enjoy your week!

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: Could I help you on your new project?

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: I have a need for help with writing and also a need for help with the computer work. Which would you prefer?

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: I want to help with both.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: That would be wonderful. Sometimes we will be working together and sometimes independently. Would that be OK?

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: Most of the time that is what I prefer.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: We start on Monday. Can you be there?

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: I am not sure yet.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: I need your background information before the meeting.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: I will do that.

title: . Offering Help
dialogue_line: I'll enjoy working with you. Have a great day!

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Can you help me plan the office party?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Sure. What do you need the most help with, the food or entertainment?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: I need help with food.

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: OK, well, let's coordinate our efforts. Should this party be formal or casual?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: I think it should be casual.

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: I agree. Next, we have to decide on food. We have a choice of Chinese or Continental Cuisine. Which one should we have?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: I would prefer Chinese food for this party.

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Perfect choice. For music, should we have a live band or a DJ?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: I think we should hire a live band.

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: OK then. Well, I will work on my part and get back to you with my progress on Friday.

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: I need help with the office party.

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Yes, of course. We could split it. What part would you like to do, the food or the entertainment?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: I have no idea what the entertainment should be.

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Let's make sure we are on the same page. Do we want a formal or informal gathering?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Let's make it a formal affair.

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Yes, that would be best. Now, for food should we have Chinese or American food?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: American food would be the best choice.

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: That would be great. What kind of music would you like, a band or recorded music?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: We should bring in a really good DJ.

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: That works for me. Let's see what we can each do about planning our part and meet again on Friday.

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Would you help me figure out what to do about the office party?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: I would be happy to help. What would you like me to help with, food or entertainment?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: I would like to help you with both.

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: That will work out fine. To make sure everything goes together, do you think this party should be casual or dressy?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: A dressy party would be fun!

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: That will work out fine. Do you think that Chinese or Continental food would be best?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: We should probably have both.

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Yes, that will work out fine. Should we hire a band or bring in a DJ?

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Maybe we could do both!

title: . Asking for Help
dialogue_line: Everything sounds great then! I'll meet you back here on Friday to discuss the details.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Is there anything I can help?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Yes, thank you. I am really far behind on this project. Could you help me with the extra typing or xeroxing?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I can do either one.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Good. That would be very helpful. Can you start with those pages over there?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: No problem.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Thank you very much! How long have you been working here?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I have been working here for 5 years.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Well, we have some special projects coming up. Would you be interested in working on any of those?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Yes, I would love to work on a special project!

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Well then, I'll keep you in the loop. Thank you for your help today.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Do you need any help?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I need some help catching up. Are you good at typing or could you help me xerox?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I like xeroxing.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: Thank you! There are papers on the table to start with.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: That would be OK.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I really appreciate the help. How many years have you been with the company?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I just started working here.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I have a special assignment coming up. Would you be interested in helping me on it?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I'd like to, but I am very busy.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I'll make sure that management keeps you in mind for special projects in the future. Thanks for the help!

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: What can I do to help you?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I have some extra help with my project. What would you prefer to help me with, typing or xeroxing?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I could do some typing for you.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: That is very kind of you to offer to do that. Can you start with the pages on the table?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: That would be a good place to start.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I like your positive attitude. How many years have you been employed here?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I have worked here long time.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: We have a really interesting project coming up. Would you want to join us on it?

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: I'm not sure. Let me think about it.

title: . Responding to a Plea for Help
dialogue_line: OK. I will mention how great you were about helping me today. I appreciate your help.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Can you help me with my timesheet?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Sure! I can help you. Do you know where the timesheets are kept?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: No, I don't know where to find one.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Well, once you get one off the shelf over there, you first put your name on it. OK?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Yes, I can do that.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Now you have to fill in the hours in the blanks and total the hours for the week. Do you know how to use military time?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: No, I don't know what that is.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: OK, so we just start counting hours at midnight and record it. Show all minutes as a dot and then write how many minutes. OK?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Yes, I understand how to do this.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: After you total your hours, make sure you sign it and turn it in to your supervisor.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: That was easy!

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Good luck and let me know if you need any help later on.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: How do we do timesheets here?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: They are actually fairly straightforward. Do you know where the blanks are kept?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Yes, I already have one.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: OK, well after you take one out of that second drawer, you put your name on the top. Do you see?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: I am kind of confused.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Next you fill in all of your hours for each day and total them. Do you know how to show time on a 24-hour clock?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: I'm not quite sure.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Midnight is zero and when you put the minutes in, make sure that you show them with a dot followed by the minutes. Do you understand?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: No, I have no idea what you are talking about.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: It's easy, just write in the hours, total it, sign it, and put it in the box.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Thanks for your help.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Try it and if you can't do it, one of us can always help you later.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: I need help with my timesheet.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: OK, no problem. Have you found the blank ones?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Yes, I have seen them.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Yes, well put your name on it after you have downloaded it off the company website. OK?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Yes, I understand what to do.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: You fill in the hours and total them for the week. Have you ever used a 24 hour clock?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: What? Huh?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: So after you noted the hours, starting at zero which is midnight, you just write down the minutes as a dot followed by minutes. Get it?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Huh? What?

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: Just make sure you show your total, sign it, and turn it in.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: I thought you said this was easy.

title: . How to Do a Timesheet
dialogue_line: You are a quick learner. I don't think you'll have any trouble with this.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: I need help figuring out how to use this phone.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Sure. First you pick up the receiver and hit one of the first 3 buttons. Do you hear a tone?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Yes, I hear the tone.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: OK. Now you dial 9 on the keypad. Do you hear the tone change?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Yes, it changed.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Well, when you hear it change, that means you have an outside line. Where are you trying to call?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: I am trying to call home.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: OK. Well, to dial to the outside you just now dial the number. For a call inside the company just hit the extension number. Do you know the extensions?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Yes, I have a list of extensions.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Well, if you ever need help with an extension, you can dial O.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Can you show me how to use this phone?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Yes, I can help you with that. Pick up the receiver and hit one of the buttons. Do you hear a tone?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: No, I don't hear anything.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Next you dial 9 on the keypad. You should hear the tone change. Did you hear it change?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: I'm not sure.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: OK. Well, after you get the line to change you have an outside line. Who are you trying to call?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: I am trying to call a client.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: To call a number on the outside you now just dial the number. For inside calls, punch in the extension number. Has someone given you an extension list?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: No, I don't know anyone's extension.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: All of the extensions are listed on the wall chart over there if you ever need help.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: I want to make a phone call. Can you show me how?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Of course, pick up the receiver, hit a button and listen for a tone. Are you hearing it?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Yes, now what do I do?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: Well, after you dial 9 on the keypad, you should hear the tone change.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: No, nothing changed.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: When you dial 9 and hear the tone change it means you have an outside line. Who are you trying to call?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: I am trying to call my boss.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: For an outside call you now just dial the number. For a company number you need to know the extension. Do you have a list of extensions?

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: I know a few extensions but I don't know all of them.

title: . Making a Phone Call
dialogue_line: You can always look an extension up on the company website.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: I would like to make an appointment for a project meeting.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Of course, I have Monday or Tuesday available. What day would be best for you?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: I would like to meet on Monday.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Very well then. Are mornings or afternoons best?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: I want to come in the morning.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: I will have my assistant check my calendar and get back to you with the exact time. Can you bring me an outline of the project when you come?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Yes, I can bring the outline when I come to the meeting.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Do you think that we should include the entire committee in the meeting or just our sub-committee?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: I think that we should have just the sub-committee.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: OK then, I will make the arrangements for them to attend. Do you know how to get there?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: No, I need directions, please.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Fine, we will make sure that we send you all of the information that you need. See you there!

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Could I meet with you to discuss the project?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Good idea. We could meet on Monday or Tuesday. Which day would you prefer?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Tuesday would be good for me.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: OK. Do you think we should meet in the morning or in the afternoon?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: I think the afternoon would be best.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: That will work out. I will e-mail the exact time tomorrow. I need you to bring your plans with you.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Yes, I will bring my plans with me to the meeting.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Should we invite the whole committee or should we just have the sub-committee there?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: I feel that the whole committee needs to be there.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Yes, I agree. We'll make sure that they get notified. Can you find the meeting place?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Yes, I know how to get there on my own.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Great! We will send you all the details later. Looking forward to meeting with you!

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: When could we meet to discuss the project?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: I will be available on Monday or Tuesday. Choose which day is best for you.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: I prefer Monday.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Good. Can you come in the morning or would afternoon be best?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Either one is OK.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Great! When I check with the others, I will send you an exact time. When you come, be prepared to do your presentation.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: I will be prepared to do my presentation.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Who would you like to see there? Just the sub-committee or should we ask the whole committee?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: Everyone needs to be there.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: That will probably be best. Do you need help with directions?

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: I think I know where it is. Maybe you could send me directions just to make sure.

title: . Making an Appointment for a Meeting
dialogue_line: OK. We will e-mail you all the information you need tomorrow. Have a good day!

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: I had an appointment tomorrow and I need to change it to a different date.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Certainly, what day would be best for you?

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: I think that Monday or Tuesday would be good for me.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: I can give you Monday; I have ten or eleven in the morning.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: I think ten o'clock is best.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Fine, I'll put you down for that.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: That would be great!

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Happy I could help you; see you then!

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: I was wondering if I could reschedule my appointment to a later date?

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: OK, just tell me what day would be best for your appointment.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Wednesday or Thursday would be perfect.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Thursday is available; would ten or eleven be best?

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: I would love to have an eleven o'clock appointment.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Great, I'll just add you in, if that works.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Perfect, I appreciate that.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: So happy that we had an opening for you.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: I can't make my appointment and need to make another one.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: That's OK, we can reschedule it if you tell me what day works for you.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Friday, Saturday, or Sunday would be good for me.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: I can give you Friday; would you prefer ten or eleven?

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Ten o'clock is perfect.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Well, in that case, I'll just write you in.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: Thanks. That will work out well.

title: . Rearranging an Appointment
dialogue_line: It was my pleasure to have been able to make it work.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Excuse me for being late to work.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Where have you been?

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: My car broke down.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: That's too bad. Please try to fix it so that it doesn't happen again.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Yes, I'll work on it.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Thank you, have a seat. We are working on the new project

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Great! Fill me in.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Let's take a look at the Campbell Project.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: I don't understand the projected revenues.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Let's take another look at it for those of you who don't understand.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: I am sorry I am so late to work.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: What was the problem?

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: I lost track of time.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Things happen; make sure it doesn't become a habit.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: It won't happen again.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: All right, please take this message and call this client.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: No problem.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Now does everyone understand the diagram on the board?

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Yes, I understand the numbers.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: I will explain it again; especially for those of you who arrived late.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: I lost track of time, am I late?

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Yes. What kept you from arriving on time?

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: My friend needed me to help him.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: I realize that everyone has emergencies; just get here on time from now on.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: My apologies.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: I appreciate you saying that and would like you to join us in our meeting.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Sure, I'll sit right here.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: Wonderful, does anyone have any questions about this project?

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: I am confused about the projected revenues.

title: . Giving an Excuse for Being Late to Work
dialogue_line: I'm glad that some of you get it, but let's go over it once more.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: So tell me again, why couldn't you get the supplies I ordered?

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Well I ordered them when you asked, but the supplier said they might need to back order them.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: When do you think they will finally arrive?

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I think maybe by Tuesday.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: If they don't arrive by then, what are our options?

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I could try another supplier down the street.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: That would work for me.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: OK, I will stay on it and let you know how it's going.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Thank you for taking care of the problem.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Thank you for your business. We appreciate you as a client.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: You promised me the supplies would be in today and now you say they aren't here?

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: They said they had part of the order, but the rest won't be available until later.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I guess that's it then, when will you be able to get the rest?

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I am not sure.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I am not convinced that will work for me, what now?

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I could order them from another supplier as a back-up.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: That is a good plan.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Good! I will call you later this afternoon and let you know when your supplies will arrive.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I appreciate you staying on it.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: We appreciate your business and aim to please.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I really needed the supplies today and you are telling me you don't have them?

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: The supplier said that it will be a few more days until they can ship the order.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Fine, what day will the whole order be here?

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: If we are lucky, they may get here tomorrow.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Is there anywhere else we can get these supplies?

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Let's order the missing items from someone else just to be sure.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I appreciate that suggestion.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I will track your order on the internet and e-mail you the moment it arrives.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: I look forward to hearing from you.

title: . Accepting Excuses for Not Meeting Commitments
dialogue_line: Please let me know if there is anything else I can do for you in the meantime.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: What does she look like?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Well, she was pretty tall, about 5 feet 10 inches and kind of scary looking!

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: What do you mean, scary?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Well, she had a crazy sounding laugh and wild hair. Do you know what I mean?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Yes, I know what you mean.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: And her piercing eyes! She looked like an alien who just came down from outer space. Do you believe that people from outer space live amongst us?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: No, that's impossible!

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Unless they beam us up for a ride, we will never know for sure. Have you ever thought that you saw a flying saucer?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Are you crazy?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Hah, I guess we never know what can happen. Do you like Star Wars movies?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Yes, I have seen all of the Star Wars movies.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: I loved Star Wars movies. My favorite character was Yoda. What about you?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: I liked Darth Vader.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Yeah, that character was pretty cool. If you had to describe that character, what would you say about them?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: They were very beautiful.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Yeah, I know what you mean!

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Can you describe her for me?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: She was large, hairy, and scary!

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: What are you talking about?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: When she laughed, it sent chills up my spine. Have you ever met someone like that?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Yes, one time I met someone like that.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: She had eyes like laser beams. Sometimes I wonder if aliens from UFOs live here with us. Do you think that's possible?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Sure, I think it could happen.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: I guess it's impossible to say for sure unless you go for a ride in one. Do you think that would be an interesting experience?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: No, I never want to be near a UFO!

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Well, you will probably never see one. Have you seen any Star Wars movies?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: No, I haven't seen any Star Wars movies.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Star Wars was the best. I really like Darth Vader. Do you have a favorite character?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: I like Luke Skywalker.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Oh yeah, I forgot about that character! What words do you think would best describe that character?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: He looked like a black vacuum cleaner.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: I totally agree!

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: How does she look?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: I am not sure how tall she was but she was very scary!

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Is this a joke?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Oh my god, you should have seen her! She looked like she had just crawled out from underneath something. Do you get what I am saying?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: No, I have no idea what you are talking about.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Oh man, her eyes were the most incredible glowing green. She might be a Martian or something. Do you think that is possible?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Yes, I believe in UFOs.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: I've never seen a UFO but I would like to. How about you?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Yes, I think that seeing a UFO would be fascinating.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Personally, I've never seen one. I think is would be fun to see the universe like in a Star Wars movie. Have you seen the Star Wars movies?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: I saw some of them.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: I loved the special effects and the story. I like Princess Leah. Who did you like the best?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: I like Yoda.

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: Yes, that is a good choice. How would you describe that character if you had to tell someone what they looked like?

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: He was hot!

title: . Asking for a Description of a Person
dialogue_line: That's a really good description.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: I was wondering if I could borrow the company van for a fundraiser this weekend.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Sure, I think that would be possible. Where is the fundraiser?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: It is in the park downtown.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Would you need it for both Saturday and Sunday?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: We will need it for Saturday only.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: I think that would be OK. Who will be driving it?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Mary and I will be driving the van.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Could you drop it off on Sunday night?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Yes, we can do that. Can we borrow the chairs from the lunchroom also?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Yes, that would be fine. Just make sure that everything is returned by Sunday night.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Our unit is participating in a fundraiser this weekend and would like to borrow the van, if possible.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: I would need to check on that. Where is the fundraiser?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: It will be at the beach by the pier.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: What day will you need it for?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: We will only be needing it for Sunday.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Maybe that could work. I need to know who will be driving it.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: The only two drivers will be Mary and I.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: If I give you the keys to the garage, could you bring it back on Sunday evening?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Sure. We also would like to use the chairs from the lunchroom. Would that be OK?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: OK, but make sure that everything is back by Sunday night at the latest.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Could we borrow the company van for a fundraiser this weekend?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: That would be a possibility. Where is this fundraiser taking place?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: It is in the hotel ballroom down the street.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Do you need it for the whole weekend?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: We will need it for both days.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: We will need to know who will be driving the van.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: The van will be driven by Mary and me.

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: It needs to be back on Sunday night. Can you arrange for that?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Yes, no problem. Would you mind if we borrowed a few of the chairs from the lunchroom?

title: . Asking for Permission
dialogue_line: Just keep track of everything and get it all back where you took it from by Sunday evening.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: I was thinking of holding the company retreat in the mountains.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: I agree, I think that that would be perfect!

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: I was thinking it could take place sometime in January.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: That might be a little too cold for some people.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: Yes, you are right.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: What about April? April has good weather that isn't too cold or too hot.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: Yes, that would work out better.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: You know, maybe we could take a survey to see how that works for everyone.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: Good idea! We'll have to get right on it.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: Fine! Well, I'll get right on it now!

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: I think that the company retreat should be in the mountains this year.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: What a great idea!

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: January would be a good month for a mountain retreat.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: I like the mountain idea, but I am not so sure about the month of January.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: You know, now that I think about it, you might be right.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: April might be nice. It is far enough away to make the necessary arrangements.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: That is a good suggestion.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: We could ask everyone what would be the best time for them.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: Yes, that would let us know what would work best.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: I'll put the survey online this afternoon.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: The Mountains would be a great place for the company retreat.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: That's a wonderful choice.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: I have chosen January as the month for this retreat.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: January is a little too close to the Christmas holidays.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: Yes, maybe another choice might be better.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: I think that April would work. Spring is a lovely time to be in the mountains.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: Thank you for thinking of that.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: Maybe if we asked around we could see what people would prefer.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: That is a good idea.

title: . Agreement and Disagreement
dialogue_line: I'll take care of taking the survey and get back to you with the answers.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I was thinking about applying for the new position.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Do you think that is a good idea?

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: It seems like a good idea but I am not really sure.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: What are your main concerns?

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: It would give me a chance to grow, but I am wondering if I would like the job.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I know what you mean, I've thought about that myself.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I also am thinking about the pay.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Could you take a slight pay decrease for a chance to move forward?

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Yes, it might be worth it. I am not certain.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I think I'm convinced that trying for this position is the best choice for you.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I am not certain, but I think I might ask to be considered for the new job.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Why are you considering trying for it?

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I think that I might like it, but I am still thinking about it.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: What is it about this job that appeals to you?

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I think that I would enjoy the position but there isn't a lot of creativity involved.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Yes, you could be right. There is a lot to consider.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I am also wondering about the pay.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Would a slight decrease in pay be worth it for a new opportunity for growth?

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I am thinking that might be the case.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I think you should give it a shot. What do you have to lose? You can always change yourmind.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I am considering going for the new job that was posted yesterday.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Are you certain that that is what you want to do.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: It may not be the best choice for me, but I am considering it.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Why do you think that this would be a good move?

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I believe that this job would allow me to move up but might be a little boring for me.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Yes, there are always pros and cons to making a career change.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Also, the matter of pay is also a consideration.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I think the slight pay decrease might be worth it. The benefits are much better.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: Yes, sometimes giving up a little to move forward is the best choice.

title: . Certainty and Uncertainty
dialogue_line: I think you definitely should apply for the position.

title: . Likes and Dislikes
dialogue_line: Whoa, look at all those ice cream choices!

title: . Likes and Dislikes
dialogue_line: Yes, that is a lot of choices. What is your favorite?

title: . Likes and Dislikes
dialogue_line: I love anything with chocolate the best.

title: . Likes and Dislikes

title: . Likes and Dislikes

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: I need help preparing for my presentation on Friday.

dialogue_line: I could help you with that.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: Are you sure you have the time?

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: I promise you that I have the time to do this. If I didn't, I wouldn't offer to help.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: What would be the best time for you to help me?

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: Tomorrow night would work for me.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: Should we just meet here?

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: OK, and I'll bring some information that helped me with my presentation.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: I'll see you then.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: See you tomorrow night.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: Could you help me prepare for my presentation on Friday?

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: I would love to help you prepare for your presentation.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: I hate to ask you to do something like that.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: This will not interfere with my work. I promise you that.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: When could we get together?

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: I could easily give you some time tomorrow night.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: Would you like to meet at the coffee house next door?

title: .Making Promises

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: I'll come prepared.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: Goodbye until then. I promise you that you'll do well after we meet.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: I am a little nervous about my presentation on Friday.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: If you would like me to, I could help you with that.

title: .Making Promises

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: I have plenty of time to do this. I promise you it won't be a problem for me.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: Is there a good time for you to help me?

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: If we work on this tomorrow night, you could easily be ready for Friday.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: How about meeting in my office?

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: That would work out well. Bring any concerns that you might have.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: Sounds like you'll be able to help me a lot.

title: .Making Promises
dialogue_line: Don't worry. Everything will go well. I promise!

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I need help planning my vacation.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: Sure, where would you like to go?

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I haven't decided where to go yet.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: Do you enjoy warm or cold climates?

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I am thinking that I might enjoy a tropical climate.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I have some brochures here that you might like to look at.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: These look great!

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: Do you know how much you want to spend on this vacation?

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I have about a thousand dollars to spend on this trip.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: Well, take these brochures, and get back to me when you want to make your reservations.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: Could you help me with vacation plans?

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: Do you know where you will be traveling?

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I am open to suggestions at this point.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: Are you wanting to travel to a tropical climate, or would you like to go somewhere with a cooler climate?

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I would like to travel to a cooler destination.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I can give you some brochures that could give you some ideas.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I will look at them right now.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: How much money is in your budget for this trip?

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I think that I can spend about two hundred dollars a day.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: Take your time choosing a destination and, when you've narrowed it down, I'll be happy to help you make a reservation.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I was wondering if you would be able to help me with vacation plans.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: Have you chosen your destination?

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I don't know where I want to go yet.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: Do you enjoy warm weather, or are you looking forward to a cooler vacation?

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: A nice temperate climate would be best for me.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: Why don't you take a look at these brochures that might help you make up your mind?

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: This place looks nice.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: Have you thought about what you would like to spend on this vacation?

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I just got a bonus and can spend about three thousand dollars total.

title: Visiting a Travel Agent
dialogue_line: I'll be happy to help you make a reservation whenever you decide upon a destination.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: Could you help me make a plane reservation?

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I would be happy to help you. Where do you plan on going?

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I am going to go to Hawaii.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: For that destination, you may leave from Los Angeles or Burbank Airport. Which would you prefer?

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I think that I would rather leave from Los Angeles Airport.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: Would you prefer a morning or afternoon departure?

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I need to leave in the morning.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: Fine. On your return flight, do you have a preference as to morning or afternoon?

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I would prefer to return in the afternoon.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I have booked you on your flight at a great rate. Here are your tickets.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I need to make a plane reservation.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: That is what I am here for. What is your destination?

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I will be traveling to Aspen, Colorado.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: Would you prefer to leave from Los Angeles or Burbank Airport?

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: Burbank Airport would be best for me.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: You can leave in the morning of afternoon from that airport. Do you have a preference?

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I can only take a flight that leaves in the afternoon.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I can book that for you right now. When you return, would you prefer morning or afternoon?

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I think that I would like a morning return flight better.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I was able to book your flight, and I will print your tickets right now. Have a great trip!

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I am planning a trip and need help making my airline reservation.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: Sure. Where are you traveling to on your trip?

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I will be vacationing in Oregon.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: You have an option of departing from Los Angeles or Burbank Airport. What is your preference?

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I live closer to Los Angeles Airport, so that would be the best choice.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: Does it matter to you if you leave in the morning or afternoon?

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I can leave at either time.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I'll put you on a morning flight. Is a morning or afternoon return flight preferable for you?

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: Either morning or afternoon would work for me.

title: Making a Plane Reservation
dialogue_line: I'll give you an afternoon flight. Here are your tickets.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: Have you ever booked a flight online?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: I have booked airline tickets online many times. It has worked out great for me!

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: How do you book airline tickets online?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: The best way is to go to a website like Travelocity or Expedia. They can help you find the best price.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: What information do I need to provide to book a flight?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: You need to know where you are going and when you want to travel.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: How do I get the cheapest rate?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: Usually you get the best price by having some flexibility in your travel time and dates.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: Can I fly on different airlines?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: You can choose the airline you prefer to fly with or let the website find you the best deal.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: Do you think it is a good idea to book airline tickets online?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: I think that booking airline tickets online is the only way to go.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: Can you help me figure out how to book airline tickets online?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: You can find the best price by using a website like Travelocity or Expedia.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: What do I need to know to book a flight?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: You will need to type in the dates that you wish to travel and where you are going.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: How do I get the best price?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: If you have some flexibility in when you can travel, that will usually get you a better rate.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: Can I choose which airline I fly with?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: These sites deal with a lot of different airlines, so you can choose whichever one you prefer.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: Is booking airline tickets online a good way to go?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: I have had really good luck booking airline tickets online.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: How do you book airline tickets online?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: Usually you can find the best price by using a website like Travelocity or Expedia.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: What are they going to ask me to book a flight?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: They will ask you when you will be traveling and what your destination will be.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: Is there anything special I can do to get the lowest price?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: You get a better rate if you aren't too particular about what time you travel.

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: Do you have to fly with a particular airline?

title: Booking a Flight Online
dialogue_line: The travel sites deal with many different airlines. It is always up to you to choose who you will fly with.

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket
dialogue_line: I would like to fly out of Los Angeles International Airport.

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket
dialogue_line: Well, I have you booked on a flight that will fit your schedule. The tickets will arrive by mail in a few days.

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket
dialogue_line: Would you rather fly in the morning or later in the day?

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket
dialogue_line: I need an afternoon flight.

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket
dialogue_line: I have you booked on a flight in the afternoon. Your tickets will arrive in the mail within 3 days.

dialogue_line: We can book your trip right now. What city are you flying to?

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket

dialogue_line: You can fly out of Los Angeles International or Burbank Airport. Which do you prefer?

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket
dialogue_line: I will fly out of whatever airport has the cheapest price.

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket
dialogue_line: If you have a choice, what time of day would you prefer to fly?

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket
dialogue_line: I would like to be booked on the least expensive flight.

title: 4. Buying a Plane Ticket
dialogue_line: I was able to find an inexpensive flight for you. We are sending you your tickets in the mail.

dialogue_line: I would like to make a hotel reservation.

dialogue_line: What day will you be arriving?

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: I will be arriving on May 14th.

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: How long will you be staying?

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: I need the room for 3 nights.

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: How many people will be staying in the room?

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: I will be staying in the room alone.

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: Would you like a smoking or nonsmoking room?

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: We need a nonsmoking room.

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: We have booked a room for you. Please be sure to arrive before 4:00 on your check-in date.

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: I would like to book a reservation at your hotel.

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: What date would you like to make that reservation for?

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: I need the reservation for May 14th.

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: How many days do you need the reservation for?

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: I will be staying for 3 nights.

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: Is that a single room, or will there be more guests?

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: I need a double room.

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: We have smoking and nonsmoking rooms. Which do you prefer?

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: We require a smoking room.

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: Your room is booked. You must arrive before 4:00 the day you are to check in.

dialogue_line: On what day will you be beginning your stay?

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: Please book the room for 3 nights.

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
