title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: We must have a nonsmoking room.

title: 5. Making a Hotel Reservation
dialogue_line: We have reserved your room. To secure the room, you must pre-pay with a credit card.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: I need to get a passport.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: The first thing you need to do is go to the post office and get an application.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: After I fill it out, where do I take it?

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: You need to take your application to a specially designated post office. They will help you mail it to the proper place.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: How do I know where these agencies are?

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: They are listed online. All you need to do is put in your ZIP code.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: Will I need to bring anything else?

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: You also need to bring your original birth certificate and two pictures. Look at the website for details.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: What if I need a visa?

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: You only need a visa for certain countries. Contact that particular consulate for details.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: Can you help me figure out how to get a passport?

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: The automobile club can provide you with an application.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: Where can I turn my application in?

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: You need to go to a passport agency in your town. They will help you process it.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: How can I find which place to take it to?

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: You can check in your phone book.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: What else do I need to bring?

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: If you go online, the site will provide a detailed list of what you need to bring.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: Do I need to do anything special to get a visa?

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: You must contact the consulate of the country that you wish to travel to.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: I've never had a passport before and need to know what to do to get one.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: You can download an application.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: What do you do with the application?

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: You need to take your application to a special post office or passport agency.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: Can you tell me how to find these agencies?

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: Any post office can refer you to the proper place.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: Is the application the only thing that I will need to bring?

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: The passport website lets you know what types of identification and pictures you must provide.

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: What if I am going to a country that requires a visa?

title: 6. Getting a Passport
dialogue_line: The requirements for a visa vary from country to country. You can go online to find out what the requirements are for the country you are visiting.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: I don't know how much luggage I can take on the plane with me.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: You need to look up each individual airline online to get their restrictions.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: I just wonder what the general rules are.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: In the United States, if you fly economy on a domestic flight, you usually have to pay for checked baggage.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: What about international flights?

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: On international flights, you usually have a two-bag limit with weight restrictions.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: What about carry-on bags?

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: All airlines will allow you to bring one small carry-on that will fit under the seat. Sometimes you can also bring a purse or handbag.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: Do you have any words of wisdom for travelers in regard to luggage?

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: Keep it light in regard to what you pack. Figure out what you absolutely need and leave the rest at home.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: I am getting packed for my vacation and don't know what the luggage restrictions are.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: You could call the airline that you will be flying, and they can tell you what you can bring.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: I just need to know what most of the airlines have decided to do.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: Unless you fly on a discount carrier, you usually have to pay a fee for checked baggage if you fly economy.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: Do I also have to pay on an international flight?

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: Some international airlines charge a fee for extra bags or weight but allow you a free bag.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: How much carry-on luggage may I bring?

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: You may bring a carry-on piece of luggage, and usually you can bring a handbag also.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: What overall suggestions do you have regarding travelers and luggage?

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: Do not bring anything on a trip that you don't really need. Think of it as leaving space for anything that you might want to purchase along the way!

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: I heard that the airlines are changing the luggage restrictions, and I need to find out what they are.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: There are online sites that list the general restrictions of the airlines.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: Because I fly a lot, I need to pack in a way that will be suitable for most airlines.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: Except for the discount carriers, you almost always have to pay a fee for checked baggage if you fly economy within the U.S.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: Do they charge a fee for baggage on an international flight?

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: Almost all international carriers charge for excessive luggage. You are limited in weight and size.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: Is carry-on luggage allowed?

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: You are restricted in what you may carry on. You almost always can bring one small piece for free.

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: What do you think is the most important thing to remember when packing for a trip?

title: 7. Luggage Limits
dialogue_line: Pack lightly! You don't want to haul around or pay fees on things that aren't essential.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: I haven't traveled much and need to know what I can carry in my luggage.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: There are different considerations. You have to consider airline rules and rules for customs.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: How do I find out about each country's Customs regulations?

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: You can go to a website for the particular country you are interested in.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: Is there anything that I should keep in mind for all countries?

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: Do not ever lie about what you are carrying in your luggage. If you get caught, there is a major fine just for lying.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: How about regulations for what you can carry on an airline?

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: The Internet is a good source for special regulations for particular airports and airlines.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: I heard that I can't bring my own bottled water on the plane.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: You can buy water at the airport once you pass luggage inspection.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: What can I carry in my luggage when I travel on an airline trip?

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: When you fly, you need to think about what you can carry onboard and what you can take into a particular country.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: Where can I go to find out about Customs regulations?

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: Just Google the country you are interested in with these keywords: Customs and restrictions.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: Are there any general rules for all countries?

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: Always answer all questions accurately. If you get caught omitting anything, you will be fined and possibly detained.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: What about airline regulations for the contents of your luggage?

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: If you go to a website for a particular airport or airline, you can get specific information.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: Is it true that I can't even bring my own water with me?

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: You can bring an empty bottle with you if you like and fill it up once you pass inspection.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: How can I find out what I can carry in my luggage on an airline flight?

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: You have to think about Customs regulations and airline regulations.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: What is the best place to get information about the Customs regulations for a country?

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: It is easier to go online, but if you can't do that, you can write the Customs Office for the country you are interested in.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: What is the most important thing I should keep in mind as far as Customs is concerned?

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: Always be honest in declaring everything you are carrying. Otherwise, you can be fined for not declaring everything.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: How do you find out what you can carry in your luggage for a particular airline?

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: You can always call the airline you are flying, and they can give you specific information.

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: Can I at least bring my own bottled water with me?

title: 8. Carry-on Luggage
dialogue_line: You can't bring your own water. You must buy it at the airport.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: Can you drive me to the airport tomorrow afternoon?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: I would be happy to drive you to the airport. When do you need to leave?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: For an international flight, the airline wants us to check in two hours in advance, so I need to leave my house at 2:00.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: Do you have a lot of luggage to check in?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: I am only carrying one large bag and a carry-on.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: I'll bring our smaller car then. Do you know where you need to get dropped off?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: Yes, I am flying out on Singapore Air to Sydney, so I need to be at the International Terminal.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: Will I be able to come in with you to say goodbye?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: Actually, with airport regulations being so strict, you should probably just drop me off at the curb.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: That will work out fine. Just give me a call if anything changes.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: If you are free, I was wondering if you could give me a ride to the airport this afternoon.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: Sure, I'll give you a ride. What time do you need to get there?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: I need to leave my house at 2:00 so I can get to the airport two hours before my flight.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: How much luggage are you bringing?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: I have my carry-on, a purse, and a large suitcase.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: I won't have to drive our larger car then. Do you know where your terminal is?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: I need to be dropped off on the second level of the International Terminal since I am flying to Sydney on Singapore Air.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: Do you want me to go in with you at the airport to help you pass the time before you leave?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: I would like that, but only ticketed passengers can go into the departure area.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: I'll drop you off wherever you need to be dropped off. See you later!

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: Could you help me out with a ride to the airport this afternoon?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: I can give you a ride with no problem. What is your departure time?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: My flight departs at 4:00, so I need to leave my house at 1:00 to get to the airport by 2:00.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: Are you bringing a lot of bags with you?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: I am bringing my purse, a carry-on, and a large suitcase.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: Your stuff should all fit in my car just fine. Do you know which terminal you are going to?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: Since I am flying to Sydney on Singapore Air, I need to be dropped off on the second level of the International Terminal.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: Can I go inside the airport with you and maybe we can have a drink before you leave?

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: They only allow ticketed passengers into the departure area, so you'll have to drop me off at the curb.

title: 9. Dropping Off at the Airport
dialogue_line: I can take you wherever you need to go. Let me know if there are any changes to your travel plans.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: Would you be able to pick me up at the airport next Sunday?

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: Sure, I would be happy to help you. What time are you arriving?

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: I will be arriving at 3:00 in the afternoon.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: By the time you pick up your luggage, it will be around 3:30. What if I meet you outside at the curb?

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: That would be a good time to meet, but what if I am running late?

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: I can track your plane online. I can just put in the flight number and I can see if you are on time.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: Can you make sure that you have your cell phone with you so I can call you?

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: Yes, that would be good idea.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: If something happens and you can't make it, just let me know and I'll book a Super Shuttle.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: Don't worry. I'll be able to pick you up.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: I am flying in next Sunday and was wondering if you might be able to pick me up at the airport.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: I can pick you up. What time does your flight arrive?

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: My flight arrives at 3:00 in the afternoon.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: I think if I am at the curb at 3:30, that would allow you time to pick up your luggage. How does that sound?

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: I think that would work out well, but what if the plane is late?

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: I can call the airline, and they will tell me if the flight is delayed.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: I am going to carry my cell phone so I can call you.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: Yes, that would help us find each other at the airport.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: If you find that you have to make other plans, I can always book a Super Shuttle to pick me up.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: You don't have to take a Super Shuttle. I'll be there.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: Could you help me out and pick me up at the airport next Sunday?

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: It would be no problem to pick you up. When is your flight arriving?

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: I am coming in around 3:00 in the afternoon.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: I think that by the time we factor in half an hour to clear Customs, that maybe I should meet you at the curb at 3:30.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: I will meet you at the curb, but how will you know if the plane is delayed?

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: Don't worry. I can track your flight on my iPhone browser.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: I want to be able to call you on my cell phone in a pinch.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: I'll make sure to keep my cell phone with me and turned on.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: If it doesn't work out, just let me know and I can take a Super Shuttle.

title: . Picking Up at the Airport
dialogue_line: You won't need to take a Super Shuttle. Just stay in touch and look for me!

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Could you tell me how to get my bags?

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Just go straight ahead, down the escalator, and there will be signs directing you.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Where do we clear Customs?

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: You will pick your bags up first.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Should we have our passports out?

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: You should have your passport out and your Declarations form totally filled out before you get into line.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: My friend here is continuing on to Puerto Rico, and we were wondering if she has to go through Customs.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Travelers who are continuing on to another country will check in over there and be directed where to go next. Their bags have been checked through.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Are there any restrooms in this area?

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, right over there after you pass through the line.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: I have never arrived at this airport before and need to know where to go next.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Go to the end of the walkway, down the stairs, and to the right.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Do we need to clear Customs before we go get our bags?

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: You will clear Customs and Immigration when you have picked up your luggage.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: What do I need to have out when I pass through Customs?

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Make sure that your passport is out and that your Declarations form is complete.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: My seatmate here is traveling through to Canada, and I told her that she probably doesn't have to clear Customs.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: People who are not entering the United States should go to the left and follow the directions given to them. Their bags are already routed through to their final destination.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Can we use the restrooms before we clear Customs?

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, there is one right over there especially for this area.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Where is the luggage claim area?

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: You can get to Baggage Claim by going down the escalator and following the signs.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Don't I have to clear Customs before I go get my bags?

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: After you have picked up your bags, you will be directed to Customs.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Do I need to have this Declarations form filled out before I get there?

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Do not get in the Customs and Immigration line until you have your passport out with your completed Declarations form.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: My brother won't be staying in the U.S. but is continuing on to Mexico.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Passengers continuing on should check in with the attendant on the left who will direct them to where they can connect with their next flight.

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Is there a restroom we can use in this area?

title: . Going through the Customs
dialogue_line: Of course, right over there on your left.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: Can you help me figure out where I should go first to check in at this airport?

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: If you already have your ticket, we can take your bags here at the curbside check-in.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: How do I know what gate to go to?

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: There are arrivals and departures listed on the screens inside.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: Is there someplace where I can find out what I can carry in my baggage?

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: There are signs posted near the baggage check area to help you know what the rules are.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: Can my friend go inside with me?

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: Your friend can go with you to the ticket counter but not past the security check.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: When I return, will this curbside area be a good place to get picked up?

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: This area is only for departures. The bottom level is for arrivals.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: I don't know the departure procedures at this airport and was wondering if you could help me.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: If you need to pick up your ticket, you need to go to the ticket counter right inside the door. They will check your bags for you.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: I don't know where my plane is departing from.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: There are agents for your airline at the counter in the corner.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: Where can I find out what I can carry on in my bag?

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: There should be a list of restrictions printed on your ticket.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: Can I take my friend along with me to say goodbye?

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: Only ticketed passengers can go past the security checkpoint.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: Is this the area for departures and arrivals or only departures?

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: This is the drop-off area for departures. Arrivals are on the lower level.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: I am flying out today and need to know where I should begin checking in.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: If you only have a carry-on and already have a ticket, you may proceed directly to the gate to check in.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: Do you know what gate my plane is leaving from?

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: Check on the screens when you go through baggage inspection for your airline.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: I need to know what the restrictions are for carry-on luggage contents.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: Check out the list of banned carry-on materials on the signs inside the airport.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: I have a lot of time to kill before my flight departs and want my friend to keep me company.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: For security purposes, only ticketed passengers can go to the gate.

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: Can my friends pick me up here when I return?

title: . Talking to a Curbside Agent
dialogue_line: The curbside area is a departure area only. Arrivals are downstairs.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: Can I ask you some questions about the in-flight instructions?

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: I would be happy to help you clarify anything you need help with.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: Could you help me find out where my nearest exit is?

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: There is a card in your seat pocket that shows you where your nearest exit is. Yours is two rows in front of you.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: Where is my oxygen mask that you were talking about?

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: Your oxygen mask is above you, next to the reading light. It will drop down when you need it.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: I am concerned about landing in the water.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: The life jackets are under your seat. You can also use your seat cushion as a flotation device.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: What is the most important thing we can do to stay safe?

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: The most important thing you can do is keep your seatbelt fastened when the captain asks you to.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: I am kind of confused about the in-flight instructions and need to ask you a few questions.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: It would be my pleasure to help you with any questions you might have.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: Where is that card that shows my nearest exit?

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: That card is in the seat pocket right in front of you. Your nearest exit is directly behind you.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: Is my oxygen mask up here?

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: Your oxygen mask will drop down if we lose cabin pressure.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: Do we have any life jackets on this plane if we need them?

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: Your seat cushion can be used as a flotation device and your life jacket is under the seat cushion.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: It seems really windy outside.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: The wind won't be a problem. Always make sure that your seatbelt is fastened when you are requested to fasten it.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: Would it be all right if I asked you a few questions about your in-flight instructions?

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: I would love to help clarify any questions you might have.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: When you were talking about the nearest exit, what were you talking about?

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: There's a card in this seat pocket that shows you where your nearest exit is. Your nearest exit is right here.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: What if I need an oxygen mask?

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: The oxygen mask is above you and will drop down if you need it.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: Where are the life jackets?

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: You will find your life jacket under your seat if you need it. Also, you have a seat cushion that can be used as a flotation device.

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: If I want to be safe, what can I do?

title: . Talking to a Flight Attendant
dialogue_line: Keep your seatbelt fastened at all times. If you fall asleep, keep it fastened loosely around you in case we hit turbulence unexpectedly.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: That rain is really coming down out there!

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Yes, it's kind of crazy weather outside.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: I get kind of nervous flying in this kind of weather.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: I don't think anyone feels all that comfortable flying in a storm.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Do you think it will be this bad the whole trip?

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: On the weather channel, this storm looked to be a big one. It will probably be with us for a while.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: I worry about too much ice on the wings.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: I have to believe that our pilot knows what he is doing and we'll be okay.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: When do you think the pilot will turn off the Fasten Your Seatbelt sign?

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: He'll turn it off as soon as he knows that we are through the turbulence.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Do you think that we are going to crash?

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Maybe. You just never know.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: It sure is windy out there!

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: It definitely is not the perfect day to fly, is it?

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: I am scared of flying to begin with, but bad weather makes it a little worse.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Anyone who actually enjoys flying in bad weather is out of their mind.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Will the whole flight be this bad?

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: I think that it will probably let up once we get out of here. Let's cross our fingers!

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: What if we hit a flock of birds?

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Plane crashes are very rare. We'll be fine.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Do you think that the pilot will ever turn off the Fasten Your Seatbelt sign?

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: The pilot needs to make sure that there is no more turbulence before he lets us get up.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Do you think that we are going to die?

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Can I buy you an alcoholic beverage?

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: I can't believe how bad the weather is today!

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Yes, according to the weather report, we will be flying through a pretty nasty storm.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: I don't really like flying in this kind of weather.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: It is normal to feel a little nervous about flying in bad weather.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: How long do you think this will last?

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Usually the pilot can get enough altitude to get above it. I hope that happens this time!

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: What if one of the engines stops working?

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: I trust that the airline wouldn't let us take off without feeling that all was okay.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: How much longer do you think that the pilot will leave the Fasten Your Seatbelt sign on?

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: When we are past the turbulence, I am sure that the pilot will shut the light off.

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Do you think we are headed for an air disaster?

title: . Talking to a Seatmate
dialogue_line: Would you like a pillow and blanket so you can take a nap?

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: I was wondering if I could order something to drink.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: Yes, we have alcoholic beverages as well as coffee, tea, or soda.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: How much do drinks cost?

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: Our alcoholic beverages are five dollars each. All others are complimentary.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: When will our meals be served?

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: We will serve a snack with the beverages. Dinner will be served a few hours into our flight.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: What are our dinner choices?

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: You will have a choice of chicken, fish, or beef. I will be bringing a menu by shortly.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: I am a vegetarian and need a vegetarian meal.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: Vegetarian meals need to be requested at least two days before your flight. I might be able to find you extra servings of vegetables, however.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: I am getting thirsty and was wondering if I may order a drink.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: Yes, I would be happy to take your drink order. We have coffee, tea, or soda as well as bar drinks.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: Do you charge for beverages?

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: We offer nonalcoholic beverages for free. Our bar drinks are five dollars each.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: Are we going to get fed on this flight?

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: You will get a small snack served with your beverage. We will be serving dinner about halfway through the flight.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: Do we have a choice of what we get for dinner?

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: Tonight we have chicken, fish, or beef to choose from. You will get a chance to look at a menu a little before our mealtime.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: Do you have vegetarian meals?

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: We serve many different meals for people with religious or dietary restrictions. We do need to know about this at the time you book your flight.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: When you get a chance, could you take my drink order, please?

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: On this flight you may have your choice of bar drinks or coffee, tea, or soft drinks.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: What is the price of drinks?

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: Our alcoholic beverages are five dollars apiece. All others are two dollars each with free refills.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: Do we get to eat on this flight?

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: We always pass out a small snack with your beverage. You will be served dinner in a few hours.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: What are we having for dinner tonight?

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: We are serving a chicken, fish, or beef plate. You may select whatever you choose.

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: Can I order a vegetarian plate?

title: . Ordering Food and Drink
dialogue_line: With advance notice, we are able to accommodate a wide variety of special diet needs. Once we are in the air, unfortunately, there isn't much we can do.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: My flight just arrived late, and I need to know what to do.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: That's okay. The airline computer is keeping track of what is happening with you.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: Do I have to call anyone?

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: By speaking with us at the arrival gate, we can fix the problem for you and direct you.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: What if there are no more connecting flights for today on this airline?

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: We will go online to see if there is something available with this airline. If we need to, we can check for a flight with another carrier.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: What if I can't find another flight out of here tonight?

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: We can help you find transportation to a local hotel.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: Will the airline pay for my room if I have to spend the night at the airport?

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: Since the flight delay was our fault and you are continuing on with our airline, we will cover the cost of a hotel room.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: Our flight was late, and I missed my connecting flight.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: We can help you find an alternate flight that will get you where you are going.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: Whom should I call?

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: The arrival gate is where you need to find someone to help you. You are in the right place.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: I think the flight we missed was the last flight out of here today.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: We can go on the computer to try to find an alternate flight on another airline if we cannot accommodate you.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: What if I get stuck here and can't get out of this airport?

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: There is a shuttle that is still running and can take you into town to a hotel.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: I don't have any money for a hotel room.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: The flight that you missed is not with our airline, and we would not have suggested booking the flights so close together. We won't pay for your hotel room.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: I had a connecting flight, but our arriving flight was late.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: We will help you make alternative plans.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: Can you give me the number of the airline so that I can call?

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: The airlines always have personnel at the arrival gate to help direct you when a flight is late. We can help you right here.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: I remember that when we booked this flight, our connecting flight was the only one on this day.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: Our ticketing is tied in with other airlines. If we cannot accommodate you, perhaps another airline has some open seats to your destination.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: Where will I stay if I can't get another flight tonight?

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: Since I believe there is a flight out of here at 5:45 in the morning, you may want to consider just staying at the airport.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: I don't think I should have to pay for a hotel room.

title: . Missing Connecting Flight
dialogue_line: We will pay 50 percent of the price of your room.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: I just arrived and need help getting transportation to my hotel.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: There are shuttles, taxis, and buses that go all over the city.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: Which one is the best form of transportation?

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: It depends on where you want to go. If you are going to a well-known hotel, they have their own shuttles that drop you right off at the door.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: Where can I catch a cab?

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: All ground transportation leaves from the island as you walk out the arrivals gate.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: Where can I rent a car?

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: The car rental agencies are against the wall as you exit.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: Are there any subways in this town?

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: We have a subway system, but you need to take a shuttle to get to the station.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: I need help figuring out how to get to my friend's house in the city.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: You may take a shuttle, a taxi, or a bus to get wherever you need to go.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: Which form of transportation is preferable?

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: It depends on what you are looking for. If you are looking to travel inexpensively, a bus might be your best bet.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: Where do the buses pick you up?

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: The ground transportation center is right outside the exit leading to the street.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: Is there a car rental place around here?

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: You can find a car rental agency just outside of baggage claim.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: Is there a subway in this city?

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: Our subway station is a mile outside of the airport. I would suggest you take the designated shuttle to get there.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: I need information about my options for ground transportation.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: This city has many taxis, shuttles, or buses to transport you to your destination.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: Is one form of transportation better than another?

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: It depends on where you are traveling. If your destination is close by, you might want to just grab a taxicab.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: Where are the shuttle pick-up points?

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: When you pick up your luggage, walk out of the door and you will see the transportation kiosk.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: Where are the car rental agencies?

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: You will see the car rental agencies as you walk down the hallway as you exit.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: I heard that you have a very good light rail system in this city.

title: . Ground Transportation
dialogue_line: We have a subway station in the airport. The in-airport moving sidewalk system will take you to it.

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: I was wondering if you could help me book a few tours.

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: You have come to the right place. How many days will you be visiting here?

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: I will be here for a week.

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: Have you ever visited our city before?

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: This is my first time visiting this city.

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: What are you interested in? Do you enjoy museums and buildings, or would you rather hit some outdoor hotspots and venues?

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: I really enjoy visiting museums and art galleries.

dialogue_line: We have tours for all interests.

dialogue_line: Do you have a tour where I can get a quick overview of the city?

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: We do have tours like that, and I think that that is a good place to start.

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: We are definitely the place to come to when booking tours. What is the length of your stay here?

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: I am on a layover and will only have today and tomorrow morning to sightsee.

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: How familiar are you with our city?

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: Actually I was born here but haven't been here in twenty years.

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: Do you have any ideas of what you would like to see? Perhaps you would enjoy our world-renowned museums or a visit to our magnificent zoological gardens.

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: I was interested in checking out local architecture.

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: I think that you would enjoy a number of our tours.

title: . Arranging a Tour of the City
dialogue_line: Is there any way that I can take a quick tour of the city, so that I can get some idea as to what I might like to see?

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: I am having some big problems on this tour.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: What seems to be the problem? We are here to help you.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: This tour company seems very disorganized. No one seems to have a clear picture as to where we are going and when we are going to get there.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: I will see what I can do about that. How about the accommodations on the tour?

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: So far, we have been staying in really out-of-the-way accommodations.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: Is anything wrong with your room?

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: The television in our room was broken, and they didn't send anyone to fix it.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: I will complain to the hotel manager about that. How about the hotel restaurant?

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: The food in the restaurant was terrible, and a few people from our group got sick.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: I am so sorry that you had such a bad experience. We would like to offer you a free city tour and lunch to make it up to you.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: I paid good money for this tour and would appreciate some help with some problems that have come up.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: I would like to help you smooth out any difficulties you are having. What can I help you with?

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: This tour company can't seem to coordinate anything. We are always arriving after something is closed or get there when the guides for the site are on a break.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: We are trying to fix that. Are the accommodations to your liking?

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: Our accommodations are pretty substandard.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: Is there anything in particular that is wrong with your room?

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: The room smelled of smoke, even though it was supposed to be a nonsmoking room.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: You should not have to put up with that. Was the hotel restaurant good?

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: Actually a few people from our group got sick, and everyone thinks it was from the bad dinner that we ate.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: Our tour company takes pride in providing excellent tours. Please let me offer you a free city tour and lunch as an apology.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: I would like to discuss some problems that I am having with this tour.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: I am sorry you are having a difficult time. What may I help you with?

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: This tour company doesn't seem to know the town very well. We are always getting lost!

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: I am sorry that that has been the case. How would you rate your accommodations?

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: Our accommodations are not very pleasant.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: What don't you like about your room?

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: The room was very noisy, and we couldn't get to sleep.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: That is unacceptable. Did you at least enjoy your dinner in the hotel restaurant?

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: The food was horrible at the hotel restaurant, and a few of us got sick after eating there.

title: . Complaining about a Tour
dialogue_line: I am glad that you told me about the problems. I would like you to be my guest for a free massage at the hotel spa tonight.

title: . Sightseeing

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: I think that some things might be best done in the morning and others in the afternoon.

title: . Sightseeing

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: That would be a good place to start our sightseeing. We could have breakfast there.

title: . Sightseeing

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: I think that I would like to go to the amusement park. It's supposed to be quite good.

title: . Sightseeing

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: That sounds like a great idea! Let's go get a map.

dialogue_line: It's so hard to choose where to go first on our sightseeing trip!

dialogue_line: We could think of what would make a good morning activity versus an evening activity.

dialogue_line: I really wanted to make sure that I got a chance to go to the local beach.

dialogue_line: The local amusement park is supposed to be wonderful.

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: That sounds like a perfect sightseeing day to me.

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: There are so many places to go on our sightseeing trip that I am having trouble narrowing it down.

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: Let's figure out what to do before lunch and later figure out what to do in the afternoon.

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: I heard that the local beach is a place that can't be missed.

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: That would be a relaxing way to begin our morning. It would be good to get out in the sun.

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: The Natural History Museum is close by, isn't it?

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: That museum is supposed to be fantastic!

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: Do you have any suggestions as to where we could go in the afternoon?

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: We could check out the local amusement park.

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: We could eat dinner and watch the sun go down at that restaurant by the park.

title: . Sightseeing
dialogue_line: That could really end up being a great day!

title: . Making Alternate Plans

dialogue_line: I think that maybe we could check out the local mall, grab some lunch, and maybe see a movie.

title: . Making Alternate Plans
dialogue_line: Yes, that sounds like a relaxing way to check out the local culture and still stay dry.

title: . Making Alternate Plans

title: . Making Alternate Plans

title: . Making Alternate Plans
dialogue_line: That would be fun, and the rain would only add to the atmosphere.

title: . Making Alternate Plans
dialogue_line: There is an old English pub next door. Maybe when we finish with the haunted house, we can duck in there for some brew.

dialogue_line: What a great idea!

title: . Making Alternate Plans
dialogue_line: If we are lucky, maybe they'll have some great food at the pub for supper.

title: . Making Alternate Plans
dialogue_line: This rain sort of blows our chances of going rollerblading!

dialogue_line: No, I don't think that we will be able to do what we planned to do. What can we do for fun today?

dialogue_line: There is a large indoor mall just down the street with an incredible ice rink we could check out.

dialogue_line: We could stay inside and dry, and still get out of this hotel room for a while.

dialogue_line: I am trying to think of something else that we could do in bad weather.

dialogue_line: I think that when we are done with our haunted house touring, we should pop into the English pub next door for a beer.

dialogue_line: I hope that we can get some nice hot food for dinner at the pub.

title: . Making Alternate Plans
dialogue_line: I think that rollerblading today is kind of not happening in this rainstorm.

title: . Making Alternate Plans
dialogue_line: We definitely need to come up with a different plan to amuse ourselves. What do you think would be fun?

dialogue_line: There is a large indoor mall hooked onto the Modern Art Museum just down the street.

title: . Making Alternate Plans
dialogue_line: That would allow us to stay dry and still get a feel for the local culture.

dialogue_line: There is a sign for a double-decker tour of haunted houses in the lobby.

title: . Making Alternate Plans

title: . Making Alternate Plans
dialogue_line: I think we should wrap up our rainy haunted house day with some ale at the English pub down the street.

title: . Making Alternate Plans
dialogue_line: I think that rainy days and pubs go together!

title: . Making Alternate Plans
dialogue_line: Usually pubs have some pretty good cold-weather food. Maybe we can have dinner there.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: I can't find my purse!

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: What was in your purse?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: It contained my wallet and passport.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: How much money was in your wallet?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: There was about $200 in my wallet, and I had some traveler's checks in there, too.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: We can call American Express to deal with the traveler's checks. How about credit cards?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: I had a MasterCard and a Visa Card.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: We can look at the back of my cards to get the emergency phone numbers.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: Where do I report that my passport is missing?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: We need to take a cab to the embassy to report that right away. They will help us.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: I think that someone stole my purse!

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: What did you have in your purse?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: Both my wallet and my passport were in there.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: Did you have a lot of money in your wallet?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: Fortunately there was only a little change and some traveler's checks.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: Did you have any credit cards in your wallet? We need to report them as well as the traveler's checks.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: I only had a Visa Card in my wallet.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: We can call the front desk to get the lost or stolen card phone numbers.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: I am worried about reporting my passport as missing.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: The embassy can help us. We should walk over there and they can advise us on what we can do about replacing your passport.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: I left my purse in the taxi!

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: Can you remember what you had in your purse?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: I had my wallet and my passport in that purse.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: How much cash was in your wallet?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: Most of my money was in traveler's checks with just a little amount in cash.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: Do you know what credit cards you had in your wallet? We can call and report those as well as your traveler's checks.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: I had an American Express Card and a Visa Card in my wallet.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: We can call the information number to get the phone numbers for lost or stolen cards.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: Do you know how to report a missing passport?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: We need to contact the embassy right away. They will be able to help you replace your passport.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Is there anything special I need to think about as I tour this city?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: You need to keep in mind that this is a very poor country. Things are a little more desperate here than you are used to.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: What do I need to look for?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Be particularly vigilant anytime you are in a crowded place with other tourists. Pickpockets know that tourists aren't paying all that much attention.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: I have seen many children on the street begging, so what do I do about them?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: It is best not to give money to children or other beggars on the street, as they can swarm you. You can give money to a local charity.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Should I be concerned about what I eat or drink?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Do not drink any water that isn't bottled. Avoid street vendor food.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: How about being out on the street at night?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: I would take a cab to your destination at night. Don't walk down the street alone.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: This city is much larger than the one I live in, and I wonder if there is anything special that I need to keep in mind.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Crime can happen anywhere, but it is a little worse here because of the poverty.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Should I be vigilant about anything in particular?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: The train stations, airports, and tourist sites are favorite spots for pickpockets.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: When I see children on the street begging, what amount should I give them?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: I wouldn't suggest giving money to them. Most of them are put out there by adults who then take their money.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Can I eat or drink anything I want to?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Do not use tap water at all, not even to brush your teeth. Only eat fruit that has been peeled.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Can I walk around and see the sights at night?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: I would be sure to travel in a group at night. Stay in well-lit areas.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Do I need to take any special safety precautions in this city?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: This is a very large city with a lot of crowds to work your way through. Keep in mind that poverty makes people a little more desperate.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: What should I watch out for?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: You have to pay special attention at train stations, airports, and tourist sites. They are known for having a lot of pickpockets.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: There are so many children begging on the street that I don't know which ones to give money to.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: It is a natural instinct to want to give money to those children, but it is better to give money to one of the local charities or schools.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Are the local food and drink safe?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Avoid eating food prepared by street vendors. Use only bottled water.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: How safe is it to be out at night?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: You should always travel with others at night and stick to well-lit areas.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: This is really a fascinating city!

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, this city is thousands of years old and has quite a history!

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: I really love this temple we are visiting.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: As you enter the temple, please remove your shoes as the others are doing.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: It is so quiet here.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, they are showing respect to their gods. People come here to pray and meditate.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: I noticed that the women all have some sort of head covering.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: It is a tradition that women cover their heads while in the temple.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: I noticed that all of the people were eating with their hands at dinner last night.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, that is another custom that people practice here.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: I have never traveled to a place that was so different from my home.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, this city has a fascinating and diverse past. It is thousands of years old!

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: This temple is beautiful!

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Please make sure that you remove your shoes before you enter the temple.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: It is very quiet in here even though there are a lot of people in this area.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, even the children are expected to be respectful and quiet here. People need quiet to meditate.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: The women all seem to have beautiful scarves or veils on their heads.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Women in this society would not consider setting foot in a temple without their head being covered.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: I noticed at dinner last night that people in this country like to use their bread to eat with instead of silverware.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, that bread is made of a special texture that works well for that.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: This city is certainly very different from what I am used to at home.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: This is an amazing city. It is quite ancient with a diverse past!

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: What an amazing temple!

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: See how everyone is removing their shoes before entering? We need to do the same.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: The people in this room are very quiet.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: This is an area of peace and tranquility. It is expected that people keep their voices down out of respect for those who are meditating.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: The women's scarves are quite beautiful.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Women of this faith must have their heads covered to enter the temple.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Last night at dinner, I noticed that everyone was using bread to eat with instead of silverware.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, eating your curry or vegetables with your bread is a custom in this country.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Is this where I catch the Super Shuttle?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Yes, this is where you catch the Super Shuttle. Where are you headed?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: I am headed home to Pasadena.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: You can tell where each van is headed by the name on the front of the van. I am the driver for Glendale, but your van should be along in a minute.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Do you know how much it costs to get to Pasadena?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: I believe the cost of that trip is sixty dollars.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Do you know if the shuttle goes directly to Pasadena, or does it make a lot of stops?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Before you pay the driver, you need to ask him. He needs to be upfront with you about the number of stops he will be making.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Do I need to have exact change?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: You don't need exact change, but it is useful to have smaller bills.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: They told me inside that I should catch the Super Shuttle here.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: You are in the right place to catch the Super Shuttle. What is your destination?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: I am trying to get to my home in Pasadena.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Look at the sign on the front of the van to tell where each van is headed. My van is going to Glendale, but yours will be along in minute.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: How much does a trip to Pasadena cost?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: If I remember correctly, that trip costs sixty dollars.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: I am hoping that this shuttle goes straight to my city without making a bunch of stops.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Always ask the driver how many stops he plans to make before you pay him.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: If I have large bills, should I break them while I am waiting?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: It is better if you have cash close to the amount of the fare. There is an ATM machine right over there.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Am I in the right place to catch the Super Shuttle?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: This is the Super Shuttle stop. Where are you trying to get to?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: My final destination is my home in Pasadena.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: The destination of each van is always written across the top. I have Glendale written on mine, but your van will be here shortly.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: What is the price of a shuttle trip to Pasadena?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: The trip to Pasadena costs sixty dollars.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: I need to know if this shuttle is going to make a lot of stops or go straight to Pasadena.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: If you find out the driver will be making too many stops on the way, you may wish to wait for a more direct shuttle.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: What should I pay the driver with?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: There is an ATM machine over by that wall. It is best if you have bills close to the amount that you will owe.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: It's great to be home!

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did you have a nice trip?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: It had its surprises, but when all was said and done, it was a good trip.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: What was your favorite part?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: I loved our full moon beach party.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: What were the people like? Were they friendly?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: The people were basically quite friendly.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did you bring me anything?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: I brought you a lovely souvenir that I will be giving you for your birthday next week.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: I can't wait until I get to be the one to go on vacation.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: I love traveling, but I love coming home, too!

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did you enjoy your vacation?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: It had its ups and downs, but I really enjoyed it.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: What did you like the best?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: I absolutely enjoyed the kayak trip we took to an outlying island.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did you enjoy the people there? Did they like you?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Most of the people seemed happy that we were there, but some of them really resented visitors.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: What did you bring back for me?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: I did get you something, and I will give to you as soon as I unpack.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Next time, I am going to save up my money and go with you.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: How nice it is to be home again with all of my family!

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did your journey turn out as well as you had hoped it would?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: All trips have good and bad points, but this one had mostly good ones.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did you have something you enjoyed the most?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: My favorite thing was the amazing food.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Were the people receptive to having visitors?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: You could tell that some people did not have a favorable view of Americans.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did you get me a souvenir?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Of course I brought you something!

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Next time I am going to be the one to go away, and you can stay home and feed the dog!
